review_body: I have stayed at this property 4 different times on business. It is a secret gem...dont miss it. It is close to all things Waikiki. The staff is great and the food is very different. The noodle house across the street is world class.

I am still traveling for work and the folks at the LAYLOW are fantastic! Kim, at the front desk in the mornings, always greets me with a smile and calls me by name! Gabby, who is usually there when I check in at night is also wonderful! I've also had lovely interactions with Ben and the GM, who's name I cannot recall... I can see their smiles through their eyes as we are all wearing masks now. It's a lovely boutique-type hotel, such a nice vibe compared to other standard hotels. You will not be disappointed!!

My stay was a truely relaxed get-away. All this owing to the well-designed property and the hospitality of the management team. I was upgraded to a very nice , well-appointed and spacious room on the 15th floor. Whole-panel floor-to-Ceiling window, modern and stylish room design with wide open areas, light-colored carpet and bright-colored furniture (all in excellent condition), looking exactly like the picture at the hotel's website. The room is stark contrast to many of those tiny Waikiki hotel rooms with glum dark-colored carpet and old smelly furniture. Staff were super polite, efficient and professional and appreciated local residents. Bed is indeed on the soft side but still OK. The only problem was that a door handle fell when I tried to close the door; luckily it didn't cause any damage.

Laylow was so much better than Marriott hotels usually are, including the great snack basket. It was modern, well-designed and convenient for everything we planned around Wakiki. Super close to a tiny mususbi shop that was great to grab for breakfast or snack if you didn't chose the breakfast included option ;) The pool cabana at night was a nice peaceful and elevated change to the beach!

Ive realised that a lot of rooms in Hawaii are quite old and dated.. But Laylow was good - its modern and at a really good location. Its close to this really yummy Masubi takeaway shop and also walking distance to the main shopping street.I would stay here again!Service was really good, vibe in general was good too.

I had a wonderful stay at the Laylow which is part of the Marriott Bonvoy Program. The rooms were very well appointed and spacious. The bed sat a little low but was comfortable once you got in. I would recommend requesting a high floor so u don't hear any noise at night. The outdoor bar and lounge area was really nice with the fire pit. They had local entertainers performing in the evening which added to the laid back ambiance. The flip flops, snacks and water offered in the welcome basket was more than what some other hotels offer in return for the pricey resort fees. The location was perfect for walking to Wakiki beach and shopping and restaurants. The ABC store is right next door and it is right across the street from a very reasonably priced Japanese noodle restaurant. I would definitely recommend staying at the Laylow.

On our honeymoon we had the pleasure of being helped by Greg who went above and beyond with all our traveling needs. He not only ensured we had pleasant excursions, but was also helpful with the first hand experience of said excursions which helped us decide out of many choices the ones we had time for. I also happened to have forgotten my tickets for a Pearl Harbor museum and a quick phone call to Greg took our troubles away and got us adventuring once again. This guy is a Gentleman and a Scholar, I wish more people on the service industry were like him. Thank you for a great experience Greg!

We enjoyed our time at the Laylow. The rooms were comfortable, but a litle small. The lotions, shampoo and conditioners were different and wonderful. We were there 3 nights to recover from our flight from the US, before continuing on to Auckland. We wandered around the area. The hotel is only a couple of blocks from the beach and the Internatinal Marketplace is next door with restaurants, stores, etc. There is a GREAT udon noodle restaurant across the street - the line can be long, but all the food we had from there (lunch and a dinner) was great!

We stayed at this hotel prior to our cruise for a few days. The staff were great from front desk, concierge to the bar team. All of them were friendly and helpful. The rooms were typical hotel rooms but we liked having the balcony to sit out on each night. The little gift basket was a nice touch. I’d recommend staying here. The location was perfect, close to the shops and the beach. We would stay here again.

This place is a mid-century Hawaiian dreamboat of a hotel. They have a wonderful deck area for food and drinks. Their pool is small but truly delightful. And they are just a short walk to the beach. They make parking very easy as well. We absolutely love the decor and vibe of the entire place from entry to room! Highly recommend!

We had a week long stay at The Laylow and enjoyed our stay immensely. The room had two kings and was perfect for our family of four. The hotel is centrally located between the beach and the canal - we also rented a car and the hotel has valet parking which we opted in and out of depending on our plans. Everyone on the staff is very helpful and made our stay comfortable, fun and relaxing. The salt pool was especially nice and stays open late. The only down side doesn't have anything to do with the hotel - it's in a busy part of town so expect street noise. If you can, try to stay in a room on one of the higher floors. Ours had a view of the mountains but the balcony is small and has a better view of the buildings next door. Highly recommended and easy to find - look for the torches welcoming your arrival.

Following is a wordy review. In short being allocated a noisy room on the third floor and the lacklustre service turned me off this hotel...Despite requesting a higher floor we were on the 3rd floor right above the restaurant. It was so noisy it was distressing and I hardly slept (I used ear plugs and an eye mask). Day bed was not made up - apparently we had to request this specifically even though there were three adults staying - we arrived at midnight so this added to our annoyance.Level 3 is not recommended for car noise, noise from people talking on the street, restaurant noise, music etc. Even though we had a larger corner room (which was why I selected the Laylow) I was willing to give this up for a higher floor. I was even considering moving hotels. I was very disappointed with the lack of concern and service with regard to my concerns; it was explained they were fully booked and had been very busy. I had been given no confidence we could be moved but the next morning we were relieved to be told another higher room would be available however we would have to pack up by 11am and then wait until 2-3pm to get back in. The 10th floor room was so much better. But the lack of service in regard to the situation and no small gesture for the inconvenience was surprising and disappointing. When we moved rooms I got a courtesy phone call, but that was it.The good things...location - close to everything - and style. The restaurant, bar and café are pretty good too.Resort fee and car parking is excessive. Pillows and beds are not comfortable for all.

In December 1967, Don Draper from the AMC show Mad Men visited Honolulu and stayed at the iconic Royal Hawaiian hotel. Were he to be incarnated today (vs. reincarnated, since he never actually existed), Don would feel right at home a few blocks away at the Laylow.This hotel is a lot of fun. From the neo-retro style to the friendly folks staffing the hotel, The Laylow is elegant hotel with a distinctive mid-century modern personality and an arch wink. The rooms are nice, albeit cozy and the beds are comfy. I don’t believe I’ve ever stayed in a hotel with a wooden shower (even if it is a simulacrum of timber). It’s not on the famous Waikiki sand, but two blocks away. And yet the hotel boasts it is “Hawaii’s most Instagramable hotel” … and they might actually be right. The food is tasty and there’s a lively bar scene at the “Hideout” packed with soused and sunburnt salespeople celebrating their hard won President’s Club reward trips to Hawaii for exceeding their annual quota. As I said, Don would fit right in.One pet peeve, and not a surprising one from a fellow writing under the moniker “Jittery Eric”: Hotels – including the Laylow – should offer regular, non-elite guests a way to access standard coffee and hot water for tea without waiting in line behind all of the folks ordering specialty coffee drinks. It’s no fun to start a day in paradise jittery and cross. In-room coffee makers and kettles or urns of coffee and hot water in the lobby for a couple of hours each morning should be a basic right. If they can do it at the Hampton Inn and Econo Lodge, they can do it at the Laylow. Even charge for it if you must, or better yet, include it as an amenity covered by the $35 per day, per room “Destination Fee” (not a “Resort Fee because the Laylow is not a resort)!Many guests would likely value coffee and tea over some of the amenities included in the Laylow’s Destination Fee – Hawaiian chips, chewing gum, flip-flop “slippers,” a Laylow rubber duck (a mysterious inclusion given the rooms have no bathtub in which this duck might float), Shave Ice (on select days), Ukulele lessons (on select days), air, etc. – even the singers provided in the Hideout in the evening. Speaking of the singers, they are quite talented and mellifluous. If you happen to be in residence when Keahi Delovio & John Manion are in the house, you might just hear a version of Let It Go (no, not the Frozen one) by James Bay that far eclipses the original. And the best part is that even if you have to leave the set, instead of Muzak, the Laylow streams a live stream of the performance into the elevators.A brief digression about Destination/Resort Fees. I’ve never met a traveler who has expressed enthusiasm about such fees. Some people don’t mind them a jot, but I’ve never heard anyone say, “Gee, this is a terrific hotel, but the amenities are so doggone great I wish they charged me a Destination Fee too.” These fees are here to stay until (1) hotel shopping aggregators TripAdvisor, Expedia, Hotels.com etc. include them in quoted rates as people comparison shop or (2) they are legislated out of existence. Why? Because people say they want and how they behave are inconsistent. Any hotel is at a competitive disadvantage if it doesn’t charge hidden fees when travelers choose based on price comparison with another property that does charge equal fees but displays a lower basic room rate. Taken to its natural apotheosis, soon the room rate at the Laylow will be $35 and the Destination Fee $300. Or more likely, the room rate will be $300 and the Destination Fee $300. It’s all nonsense in the pursuit of RevPAR, but I’m serious about the coffee. A final note: remember to count your blessings. You’re in Waikiki, not Wichita. When’s the next time your oatmeal is going to taste this tropical? The good news is the coffee bar at the Laylow opens at 4 am, so if you are willing to wake up way before the lark, you’ll likely be able to secure caffeine without too much competition.See you at the pool reading my copy of Dante’s Inferno.

This is a stylish, hip hotel right in the heart of Waikiki. Perfect location if you want to be in the center of the action there. It’s designed well, common spaces are nice, rooms are nice, bathrooms a bit small but shower is big. Nice toiletries. This is not a resort, it’s more of a hotel with a small pool that I’ve heard doesn’t get much sun. The beach is a minute walk, but if you’re looking for a resort on the beach with beach service and a big pool this isn’t it. Hotel parking is absurd at $45 a night. There is an enterprise a block away we did daily rentals and returned each night to avoid paying the fee. Staff was lovely. I would stay here again if I was looking for this type of hotel in Waikiki.
user_name:
cj2148
New York City, New York

review_body: Our third time at the Laylow. It's gotten better each time. Just keep in mind that between a resort fee and parking (if you need it), you can add about $100 to your room rate. If you are looking for a resort with a large pool, this isn't it. But you are right in the center of things in Honolulu, with great shopping and restaurants a stone's throw away.

Hotel is wonderful. Location is great as it’s just off the main strip but next door to the international marketplace. At the international market place you can pick up a rental car which is easy and convenient. We rented a car just for each day and at the end of the day instead of worrying about (and paying) for parking we just dropped it back off and picked up a new car the following day. The hotel has a nice restaurant and lounge along with coffee bar. Nice to walk downstairs grab a coffee then go back up to your room. Room decor is so tasteful and very Hawaiian. Loved the little touches like the welcome basket with flip flops. They will lend you beach towels which conveniently have the hotel name printed on them. Shower is very nice great amenities. If you’ve never staying on Waikiki it’s noisy no matter the hotel so don’t complain about the hotel rather be prepared this is a very large city (population 1,000,000). Yes there is cars driving at all hours, ambulance, sirens etc. The check in process was easy. No rooms available for early check in but that’s ok the valet guys take your bags and store them until you have a room. Then they will bring up and deliver your bags. Upon check out we ordered a cab with the front desk and by the time we were downstairs the cab arrived the valet guys scooped up our bags and put them into the cab. Restaurant/lounge has live music nightly which is such a lovely touch!We will definitely stay here again when we return.

If youre looking to easily lounge in the water or even roast in the sun, this place isnt for you. I was there for 3 days and found it pleasant, but the whole hotel is one tall building with a lovely airy open lobby and a small pool area. It isnt a resort.That said, its really beautifully decorated and every interaction with the staff was lovely. The sheer lunacy of "resort fees" continues to astound me, but Laylow at least gives you some free flip flops and water to soften that blow. The pool is perfect temperature and well appointed, right next to a small good gym. (NOTE: the pool is in a punchbowl of sorts beneath a garage and the hotel itself, so the sun only warms the area a few hours in the afternoon, which worked well for me, but beware a full day/mroning at the pool would be a waste). As a Bonvoy Gold member, i was a little irked that not only was I not upgraded (no way hotel was full) but i didnt evn get the King Balcony room i ordered- they put me in a Double (and i think every single room has a small balcony, that isnt really a perk). Nevertheless, the room was pretty and the bed was DIVINE. (As luxurious and fresh the sheets/mattress was, the towels were frayed and could use a replacement). Good shower, too.I was here mainly for work, so this was ideal. WIll be headed to more of a "resort" for rest of stay, but enjoyed this spot.
user_name:
nb424
New York City, New York

review_body: I love this hotel and have stayed here about 10 times. The staff is always friendly and accommodating. They have a beautiful outdoor lobby with multiple activities available throughout your stay. It's off the main strip so it's a little less busy than the mega hotels that litter the beach. Can see both the mountains and ocean as long as you're above the 10th floor.

We stayed at the Laylow for one night to recover from our east coast flight into Oahu before heading to Ko Olina the next day. Our room felt clean and modern however one of the windows only had a shade that didn’t do the best job of darkening the room which made it a little annoying. The bathroom was rather small only one sink and the toilet isn’t separate which I prefer but did appreciate the larger shower so it’s a trade off. I don’t think I could stay here for a whole week with the bathroom situation it would make it challenging and more time consuming to get ready. We were stocked with plenty of toiletries and towels so we didn’t have to call the front desk after one night and I really loved that. All the staff we encountered was kind and helpful. Otherwise I was very happy with the bed and pillows. I liked the amenity basket with the flip flops and it’s a nice souvenir that is still a reminder of my trip many months later. We didn’t get to use the pool but it seemed nice. I did like the water station set up by the pool that was a nice touch. The area that I would like to see improvement is the hotel restaurant, nothing on the menu is marked gluten free nor did I find the restaurant had many options or perhaps able to accommodate for someone with a seafood and gluten allergies. I ended up eating a salad for dinner which was fresh though not exactly what I was looking to eat but we were exhausted from traveling and not in a state to venture out for food. We decided not to eat breakfast there the next morning as there were more options for my allergies elsewhere. Overall I’d definitely stay here again only a few minor downsides but I do tend to be particular. I liked the location and many places to walk around nearby the hotel convenience store, shopping and restaurants you could possibly get away without a car.

The Laylow has a nice boutique feeling and we enjoyed the stay. The quality of the breakfast is commendable. We had dinner at the hideout and it is one of the best meals I've had in Honolulu, beating a lot of 'luxury' restaurants handsdown. Staff are wonderful and they provide shaved ice everyday. Location is very convenient for shopping/beach going. It also feels more casual/intimate than the big resorts.Had a happy time here! Waikiki is not only about the beach -- it has really nice neighborhood as well.

Love the hotel. Location, people are helpful , friendly, cheerful. Rooms are decent size. Its kept clean. Everything is great. Except the crappy bed which about time the hotel change. The mattress is soft and old, sagging and dip, pls change the mattress , then everything else will be perfect. Bonvoy member

We are a family of three from Australia and spent one night at the Laylow (after a week on Kaua’i) before catching an early flight home.We stayed in a double king room. The beds were very comfy, and there was plenty of storage space in the cupboard for our bags. Bedroom and bathroom were both clean. We were a couple of floors up, overlooking the pool. Noise was not a problem at all. We found the staff very friendly and welcoming, and we enjoyed the welcome basket of snacks and flip flops. It was a lovely touch! My husband also loved the in-room ukulele. Waitstaff were very kind to our son, who was tired after a long day, and we were seated and served very quickly for dinner. We appreciated the coffee and pastries that were available early in the morning in the lobby. Honolulu is not somewhere we are ever likely to visit for more than a night in-transit, but if we find ourselves looking for somewhere quirky, friendly and within reasonable drive of the airport again, we’ll definitely be back.

I would definitely recommend the Laylow! It’s in a really convenient location, near lots of stores, restaurants, bars & the beach. It’s super stylish & the rooms are a good size. The staff are incredibly helpful & so friendly. The concierge was a wealth of information & could not have been more helpful. The restaurant & bar are really good & it was great hanging by the pool & being served shave ice!

They offered a free ukele’ class and it was wonderful! Matt was my instructor and he taught me the basics that I can keep building on. He is awesome, funny, and patient. If you get the chance, take the class!

The Laylow is on Kuhio Ave which is one street back from Kalakaua Ave which is the main street in Waikiki. The location is great but because of the location, don’t expect great ocean views from the rooms. I had an “ocean view” room where you could see the ocean from the lanai between a few buildings. The rooms and the hotel have a modern feel and my favorite part of the hotel was the bar/ restaurant. They have a good Happy Hour and two of the bartenders, Taylor and Rei were very friendly and made me feel welcome. The pool has some big loungers which is nice but it’s very narrow and not very inviting for a swim. The price was just a little less than the Moana Surfrider which is an ocean front hotel and is a notch above but the Laylow is a good alternative.

The Laylow hotel was amazing. The front desk team was extremely helpful and friendly with big smiles the whole time I was there. The crew at Hide Out (the bar) were super friendly and provided a great and welcoming atmosphere and always had suggestions for places to check out on the island. The food and drinks were delicious with locally styled ingredients that tasted incredible. My room was immaculate upon check-in and stayed that way throughout the duration of the week I was there. Housekeeping was efficient, thorough, and friendly. Their pool and the location of the hotel were both as good as it gets. I HIGHLY recommend this hotel to anyone looking to enjoy a relaxing stay surrounded by exquisite customer service in a modern, super comfortable hotel! Thank you so much for taking such great care of me!

This hotel has the perfect location, and is walking distance from all the good shopping areas and restaurants. Hokulani checked us in and was very warm and welcoming. All the staff who work at this hotel are so friendly as well. This hotel is great for couples and big families. You should definitely book this hotel, you won’t regret it

Will never stay at this hotel again. The majority of the staff here are very rude, unwelcoming and have no appreciation for customers. The service in the restaurant downstairs is appalling, the female waitresses and hostesses snap back at you, throw the food at your table and are only interested in having their personal conversations with each other. We stayed her for 8 days and I have never experienced this rude service in any other hotel that I have stayed at. Disappointing that management aren’t very proactive in monitoring and ensuring that staff provide at least reasonable customer service.

I enjoyed a great one night stay at The Laylow before I headed out to another island. As with many Autograph hotels, it had really great local design of the rooms. There was a fun bar on the second level that had also had a coffee option for those non-drinkers. It was within walking distance to many restaurants and shops. It is also super walkable to Waikiki beach, which was fun. I would definitely stay here again.

We had the pleasure of staying at the Laylow in late December. My spouse had a few days of meetings in Waikiki so my daughter and I tagged along. The Laylow really is a little Oasis in the heart of Waikiki. Upon an early arrival we were given guava juice and pineapple as we waited for our room. We were beyond grateful when we stepped into our room. Just beautiful!! The decor and colors are so Tastefully Done and very Hawaii. Guests are treated to little welcome baskets. In ours we had flip flops, Hi-Chews, Taro chips and chocolate! One of my favorite parts of the hotel was the restaurant. The food is presented beautifully and tastes even better! We had dinner there and 2 breakfasts. My daughter loved the pool and floating loungers as well! The hospitality and Aloha will definitely bring us back someday!

Perfect location to walk around downtown Waikiki, close to plenty of shopping, eating and the beach. The hotel is lively and full of life. Great bar, with great drinks, and food. Not a fan of their coffee, but other than that not much to critic. Once you order a drink smooze on over to the pool, plenty of seating, it looses the suns rays once it passes over the building, but it provides enough space to lounge relax and dip to cool off if need be. We traveled during the holiday season and their were more kids than adults, which I’ve never encountered in a smaller hotel, but their rooms are supper accommodating. All rooms have a king size bed and if you need a double it is fitted with two king beds. They have a mid modern Hawaiian feel breezy, airy with flashes of contemporary. Our room had a balcony to chill on, it was spacious and clean.

I really wanted to like the Laylow and I knew the hotel was not a typical big resort but even for our family of 4 (2xAdults and 15yr and 9yr old), it just didn’t suit. The pool was too small and shallow and there was not enough seating. The fitness centre was ok - but too small for the amount of guests that were staying in the hotel. The coffee served at the Hideout was terrible - only bought once. We did not eat at the restaurant as the menu was limited and too expensive. We were notified of the New Years Eve party at the Hideout, however, it was for adults, which ruled us out as we had our kids. The room was clean but small. I hated the bed, it was way too soft for me. The other thing that was noticeable - no tea or coffee making facilities in the room. The “Destination Fee” of $35USD per day is also exorbitant! What is it for? Daily ice shaving, lei making and ukulele lessons? I don’t mind paying this fee if it had decent recreational facilities!!! This hotel is good for young, childless couples so we won’t be back.

There must be good reason why Conde Nast Traveler recently ranked this hotel high on its list of great hotels in Hawaii. True, it is not on Waikiki Beach and there is no direct beach access. However, within a few minutes from the hotel's doorsteps, you will be at Waikiki and its loyal throng of voracious tourists. With it being considerably more economical than a Waikiki property, you would be stricken with beach fever if you pass this option up.From the airport, it was about a 20-minute cab ride to the hotel, located rather obscurely by the International Marketplace, an open-air compilation of boutique shops, gourmet eateries, and lovely water features. Beyond the small sign stating LAY LOW, the New York pizzeria, and a dual set of escalators, you would be hard-pressed to know that you had arrived at the hotel.Up the escalators, you reach an open area with a large seating area, two cocoons, as well as Hideout café and restaurant. This was also where the reception and concierge were located. It was a rather small reception area amid the backdrop of hula girls. We arrived around 9:00am and obviously our rooms were not available. By the way, we booked the corner suite with queen day bed and two balconies.When we returned after a full day of sightseeing, we were assigned rooms #1004 and #1015. We were also given a card entitled "The Perks of Laying Low" as well as informed that an arrival E Komo Mai basket would be available in each of our rooms. Keep in mind that most Hawaii properties charge a resort fee, so you are in essence paying for all of these extra perks and amenities.After about 15 minutes, the bellboy brought all of our luggage to our room. He was friendly and had a smile on his face, although we wished the service could have been a bit faster.Both rooms were mirror images of each other, just on opposite sides of the hallway on the tenth floor. There was a nicely firm king-sized bed, rather simplistic and on a basic wooden foundation. The backdrop was pinkish wallpaper with green- and pink-colored palm tree designs. There was a comfortable powder-blue sofa bed adjacent to the bed and the ginormous day bed by the room door. There was a small window by the day bed with views of he Honolulu skyline away from the beach. There were also two balconies, one with views of Diamond Head (partial) and a glimpse of the water by the Royal Hawaiian Hotel.There was also a stylish TV rack and cabinet combination piece, with a chair to a supposed work space, two large coffee-table-sized literature, as well as the must-have ukulele. The TV did not have a good selection of programming and given the onslaught of Japanese and Korean tourists everywhere we went, we were shocked that there was absolutely no Asian programming. Behind this unit, there was an actual secluded work station, with sturdy table, bench, and two chairs, as well as convenient plugs. This was located right across from the bar area with ice bucket, "smart" fridge, as well as some books to read if we wanted to do so. The welcome basket, which included flip-flops of two different sizes, a bag of taro and sweet potato chips, a bar of dark chocolate, and a stick of Hi-Chew acai-flavored candy, was located on a surfboard-shaped coffee table in between the sofa bed and king-sized bed.We definitely appreciated and admired all of the beachy touches in the room. The light fixture in the separate work station was simply the coolest, although the bellboy emphasized the safety aspect. The stools looked like objects you could find on the beach, and the color scheme of pinks, blues, and bright oranges added to this appeal. The carpeting can be likened to reeds found in the water and there was one token picture of Waikiki by the king bed.The bathroom was of a decent size, with a large oval-shaped mirror, a spacious single vanity, an adequate selection of toiletries, and interesting locations for the tissue box and toilet paper roll. We requested for extra towels but even if we didn't, we would have plenty for our needs. The shower was great, since the sliding door actually closed all the way, unlike most hotel showers that have gaps that cause water to seep out, making the floor wet, although the temperature control was a bit hit or miss. You really couldn't control the water temperature for the shower, cold or hot. Moreover, there wasn't much space between the toilet and vanity, making the bathroom useful for only one person at a time.The one major problem experienced during our stay was the room temperature controls, since on the first night, it was really stuffy, despite lowering the temps to the lower possible degree. It gradually became too chilly but we were unable to raise the temperatures any higher on our last two days there.We did not dine at Hideout since we started each day very early, although we were a bit confused as to why the hotel would advertise coffee and pastry availability at 4:00am daily if that wasn't the case. Only coffee was available. Luckily, there were a myriad of dining options at all hours of the day very close to the property.The bellboy service was very good, very friendly, attentive, almost effortless. The receptionists consistently welcomed and greeted us, which is a bit unexpected nowadays. The pool was a nice touch, although we didn't use it.We would definitely choose The Laylow again in a heartbeat. It was close to all of the action -- great shopping, amazing dining, a short stroll to Waikiki -- and the price was extremely attractive for all of the extras offered. Why pay an arm and a leg for Waikiki access when you can save that money and dine at some of the most coveted establishments in the area, such as Duke's?! Are you ready to lay low?
user_name:
littlepiggydc
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I looked at many hotels before deciding to reserve the laylow and am so glad we stayed here! Before our stay in December, I contacted the hotel on several occasions, Suzanne, a supervisor, assisted me with a ton of requests and was extremely helpful, very customer service oriented. Our room was amazing for a family of four. The location is perfect - close to the beach and next door to a large mall and car rental place. We visited a lot of hotels on the beach but glad we decided to stay just off the main "drag" - quiet and comfortable - the theme and decor are all Hawaii - very nicely done. I was also impressed with their restaurant - better experience than a lot of the well known and high end restaurants one feels compelled to visit when traveling - if I would return, I would eat every meal at their restaurant (coffee & wine list is top notch) - we had the pleasure of meeting the Food and Beverage manager, he was extremely helpful & knowledgeable. I highly recommend The Laylow and want to thank the staff for an incredible stay!

We stayed for 2 nights on a quick stop on our way to the Big Island. Laylow was nice - we paid for executive club level, other than the coffee, I would not recommend the extra $. The "club" is in the hallway near the elevator and the breakfast options were either greasy ham croissants or chocolate croissants the next day. Not good options. Room was small but nice, had a view of the beach out the window. Didn't use the pool but it is small and not well situated. The hotel has great, reasonable restaurant options very close by. 10 minute walk to the beach. Nice fitness center.

A very cool, hipster bar scene and vibe which helps you escape the chaos of Honolulu. The Hawaiian-American food was delicious and service was decent. Adults and kids alike enjoyed their dinner. We’ll be back.

I wish I had read up a bit more about this hotel before booking. We arrived yesterday from Toronto at 3:45pm and the rooms were not ready, not the best way to start a trip to Hawaii after an 11 hour flight.The rooms are quite nice, but...If you are interested in lazing by the pool, this is not the hotel for you. The pool is quite small, with limited lounges. The sun hits the small space only between 12:00 - 3:00pm, so no chance of seeing the sun and getting an early start on the tan.Also, if you prefer to have an Adult pool experience, this isn’t the place for you. Lots of kids having fun in the pool. Again, not the fault of anyone, just need to beware.Yes, there are other options - beach, morning excursions, however, we’ve been many times to Waikiki and always like to start with a couple of pool days. Unfortunately, it’s not working for us.The hotel is boutique, renovated, but with a small “motel” feel to it.Will choose elsewhere for our yearly trip to Waikiki.

We are Marriott gold elite members, which one would think would mean something. But no, we booked well in advance only to be told we got the only room left and it is the absolute worst room in the hotel: third floor, right across from the elevator and over the rocking pool/bar. Never mind we give all our business to Marriott. Never mind our profile clearly says high floor. They offered ear plugs and some points for our trouble. And we are paying $550 a night for this pleasure! Marriott should block off this room and know to never put a loyal member of their rewards program in it. If you want to “Lay low” this is not the place for you. If you plan to party all night in the bar below the 3rd floor rooms, at full volume, feel free to come to our room. We won’t be sleeping that’s for sure.

Convenient location next to International market. The package came with valet parking. The restaurant breakfast is ala carte and expensive for a family of 6 over $100. The concierge is Expedia, but well experienced and willing to call around for sold-out venues. A couple misunderstandings regarding the booking were cleared up instantly. we had the two bedroom family suite, which were king and two queens adjoining rooms overlooking the pool and an adjacent parking garage.

I stayed here recently for 5 nights on the recommendation of 2 people. it's very central and convenient (in the back of the Int'l Market), I was on the 8th Floor facing the pool area and it was perfectly quiet. Not sure if lower flowers would have noise issues. Cute welcome basket like others have said -- a really nice touch (two pairs of flip flops, a rubber duckie, large bag of chips, chew candies, and small chocolate bar, and 2 small bottles of water). I hope they never do away with it. Not much of a pool area but that's to be expected since it doesn't fare the ocean (which is right across the street). The pool is actually quite nice for what it is, but I didn't come to Hawaii to lounge at the pool when the ocean is right there. Bar area is nice, sort of a balcony open area. Didn't try the restaurant as there are plenty of options.My only "complaint" is that the bed is really soft -- I'm more used to the Westin/ Sheraton type bed. Maybe it's b/c I had the handicapped room -- which I voluntarily take b/c it's on a higher floor than what I was offered (basically just a lower bed, handheld shower option, and a pull out bend in the shower --no bathtub). I didn't ask until the third day if there's something that can be done about the bed -- like putting a hard board at the bottom. The front desk said it would call housekeeping. Never heard from anyone. If I had asked for this right away, I would have followed up, but as it was, I didn't bother. Anyway, not a huge issue but I wonder if the beds here are all that soft. This is the only negative for me and I would certainly come back. Closet area all pretty tiny -- it was fine as it was only me, but could be tight for two people. Again, not sure if the non handicapped room would be different. Didn't try the gym but for a hotel this size, it looks decent. Daily "resort" fee, but that's to be expected everywhere other than at the low end here is my guess. Definitely recommend.

I wish I could have stayed longer. Had it not been for the hospitality at the Laylow—I was going to conclude that Oahu was a very unfriendly place. It’s an absolutely adorable hotel. And I love love the color scheme. There is a resort fee every night. I didn’t need parking. Cute restaurant but didn’t check it out. Cute pool area and free towels to take to the beach. Free flip flops and other goodies in a welcome basket. I stayed in a double king room. I want to go back ! I bet the suites are luxurious...free pineapples upon check in . Very sweet people and management. Toiletries are organic and smell great. Just book a room, you’ll see...

I have often stayed at places in Waikiki when having an overnight layover before going on a bigger trip from Honolulu. I've tried most of the properties in this price range but this was by far my favorite. The hotel is super chic with a Hawaiian mid-century modern aesthetic. We got upgraded to the exec floor - so they also had an espresso machine and different small snacks (croissants, cookies, mixed nuts) throughout the day. The rooms were huge (for the area) and we had a partial ocean view (between buildings) with a nice balcony. The hotel is also within walking distance of everything Waikiki has to offer. I used to always get a car but with parking now what it is down there, it is actually cheaper to just take a car to/from the airport if you aren't going anywhere else on island.We also had a chance to try the restaurant for lunch - it was a little pricey but the food was really good and it had a nice vibe. They seemed to have a DJ or live music when we got there in the evening, but we didn't hear any of it from our room which was great! Will definitely be back next time we are passing through Oahu!

What a remarkably wonderful experience we had at the Laylow! Our family of mom, dad, and 4 little girls had a marvelous time at this luxury hotel. What stands out first and foremost is the exceptional service. Everyone at the Hideout restaurant, front desk, and the valet stand really did a tremendous job ensuring that our needs were met. I commend the staff for their attention to detail and proactivity. It was highly impressive how folks went above and beyond and tried to think of how to offer "extra."Here's an example -- there is a lovely pool and good fitness facilities where complimentary fruit is offered. Early one morning, I got an apple to feed the girls prior to breakfast since they were complaining of being hungry. I went to the restaurant to see if they had a real knife for me to use in order to slice the apple. Upon requesting the knife, Ashley C perceptively asked if I needed it cut (to which I answered yes), and she went to the back room to get it sliced. Then, she came out with a takeout container with it cut, and 4 little peanut butter containers since she thought the girls might like that. WOW. They did obviously, and I am so appreciative for her forethought and initiative. Every single time, the entire staff was proactive in their thinking, and accommodating of our requests -- really excellent service!!In addition to Ashley C, Edgar, Rita, Cindy, Ashley and Ben the general manager were amazing, helpful, and friendly. We mostly ate breakfast meals at the hotel -- favorites were the French Toast with Nutella and the salmon with pesto and toast. The flatbread pizza with truffle is also fantastic. The valet staff was terrific. Harold, Christopher, Matt, (name escaping me...starts with A) were all incredibly quick to get our 13 passenger van and super accommodating. Front desk staff ensured everything was well explained and taken care of.The location is right in the heart of Waikiki. The rooms were beautiful. The beds were very comfortable. The shower had great water pressure with both overhead shower and removable shower head. Gift baskets with complimentary flip flops, snacks, water etc. were a very nice touch.Definitely a strong recommend and would love to stay here again!

A very nice hotel but we were impressed with the folks working. DJ, Suzanne, Matt etc. all excellent. Nice rooms. Good amenities. Truly treat you like family. Highly recommend. Pool area a little small but nice. Great bar and the whole place is service oriented.

Good things first: the Laylow is a stylish hotel that's located in the middle of Waikiki with a host of eating options on your doorstep and the beach two short blocks away. The staff are very friendly, the rooms are a great size, the coffee in the lobby is excellent and there are fun touches like free shaved ice daily between 2-3pm, free flip flops and ukelele lessons. Despite this, I was disappointed by our Laylow experience. I am a Marriott Bonvoy member and had booked our two adjoining rooms directly with the hotel. When I booked I asked for our rooms to be on a high floor, mindful of reviews here about noise. I also requested an early check in as we were arriving about 8am, though I was aware that might not be possible.As it turned out we had to wait, drooping in the foyer after an overnight flight, until 2.30pm for our room. Guaranteed check in time is 3pm so that wasn't exactly early. Another day I noticed another family waiting to check in (they had to wait half an hour) and they were offered free pineapple to snack on. We were offered nothing. And as for the high floor - we were on level 6, of 16. Reception is level 2. So my requests amounted to nothing. And I understand that happens but it would have been nice if we at least had been given an apology. The only explanation was that there are not many connecting rooms, but if people have to check out by 11am why did it then take 3.5 hours for our room to be ready?Our connecting rooms had no view whatsoever, were quite noisy from the airconditoning in the International Marketplace and also from loud amplified music in the bar area until 10pm on at least two nights. The kind of loud music that earplugs doesn't drown out.Our rooms were stylish and clean. However they were also poorly lit at night, short of hooks in the bathroom for towels (if you have only two hooks and one rail, how do you hang two bathtowels, a facecloth, a hand towel and a bath mat?) and the pillows were hideous: overly large and overly stuffed. I found the bed quite comfortable but it is on the softer side, my husband hated it.Also a security bug: you need to use your room key to access your floor in the lift. But anyone can enter the stairwell from the lobby and access every floor in the building that way.The pool area as others have pointed out is very small (and shallow, only 3" deep) - quite often there was no seating available at all.I realize this all sounds highly critical. It IS an appealing hotel, we loved the look & feel and we loved the location. But we never felt particularly valued to the staff and that noise - even requesting particular room types in advance doesn't guarantee that you will get a quiet room. So it's a guarded recommendation from me.Protip #1: if you want to order things online and have them sent to the hotel before your arrival, this is possible. I noticed a small pile of packages waiting for guests to arrive.Protip #2: Overnight parking is $45 but you can park overnight in the parking lot round the corner on Sunset (next to Ross) for only $32 or for free alongside the canal one block to the east.

This hotel was absolutely amazing, down to every last detail. The coffee and food is delicious, the pool area is quaint and impeccably clean, and the rooms are comfortable and beautifully designed. I really felt like I was getting a luxury experience. If anything, I was surprised it wasn't more expensive.I'm not one for huge resorts that feel impersonal. So the fact that the bartenders remembered my name, and the person working the coffee bar remembered what I had gotten the morning before, was lovely. The hotel has a shop with some cute local goods. Obviously nothing is "cheap", but I also wouldn't say that the items were unreasonably priced. The drinks and food were really tasty. It all seems to be carefully crafted, which is again something I appreciate in a "boutique" hotel. The only thing I noticed was that the service at the pool was a little slow. However, it's a 20-step walk to the coffee bar and restaurant host stand if you really wanted to put something in. I'm a huge coffee snob, so the Hideout coffee bar was a dream to me. The pool is a bit small, so I made sure to get there a little earlier to make sure I got a chair, etc. that I wanted.Honestly, this hotel fit my travel style to a T and I can't wait to cross more Autograph Collection Hotels off my list.

Love this place! The hotel is cleaned and beautiful. It’s located near so many restaurants and shops in walking distance. Staff is amazing and so accommodating. Special shout out to our housekeeper AMOR she does a great job and is so sweet. Thank you!

Really unique hotel on the main retail strip off waikiki. Great vibe, excellently appointed rooms with great views. Staff really go out of there way to ensure a happy stay. Caitlyn and Naimu were wonderful at check-in and out. Activities and free bine rental. Small pool but main beach is literally a block away. Would definitely recommend.

I’m a big Bonvoy fan and I really like the Autograph collection. The Laylow is hip, clean and very well located. The outside terrace bar and the pool area are awesome. We even took ukulele lessons one night. My only complaint was around the service - two failed room service orders and little to no service while around the pool.

We stayed here for 5 days and upon arrival we asked for a quiet room and got a room on the 5th floor in the middle what means you are probably in one of the loudest rooms you can have- facing the poolside and the huge air condition of a big parking lot- that is not quiet at all! We tried to sit on the balcony but were not able to have a conversation!After complaining immediately it only was possible to change the room after one night so we cot a room on the 12th floor facing the other side- much less noisy, but not a quiet one either! The location of the hotel makes it impossible to provide you with very quiet rooms, I suppose!So if you are noise sensitive you might consider another place to stay!The way our complaints were handled was pretty poor and not very professional at all- yes we tried to speak to the manager- but they were not interested- we only were offered a business card to write an email!The positive thing about the hotel is the very well designed rooms and everything is in corporate identity on point and everything was very clean! The Gym is poorly equipped No coffee provided on the rooms- you can only purchase coffee in the lobby!Our experiences with Hyatt Regency Waikiki and Hyatt Centric- which is right around the corner is way better!We would never stay at The Laylow again
user_name:
pascals178
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I agree with the last coupe of reviews regarding the style and location. It is in a busy area which is both good and bad. You're right in the middle of everything. If you want to feel a little more 'away from it all' this is probably not a good choice. I also agree with the last couple of reviews mentioning a slow bar and lack of recognition for Bonvoy members. This feels more like a hip boutique hotel (positive) but your Bonvoy status isn't going to get you much (negative). It's a fun alternative to the large hotels right on the beach. I think if I had kids I might go for one of the bigger hotels that has a bigger pool and closer access to the beach.

We loved the Laylow from the second we arrived. The check in area is an open air area, making it feel very beachy. The front desk staff were very nice. We got upgraded to a room with two king beds, which I didn’t even know existed! There was a complimentary gift basket in the room with fun slippers and snacks. The beds were comfortable and the bathroom was big and well designed. Our room overlooked the pool which was absolutely packed, I imagine you have to get there very early to get a good spot. We had a drink at the lobby bar before going out, service was shockingly slow but the drinks were good.The location of this hotel can’t be beat, it’s very convenient. I didn’t see many kids, this doesn’t seem like the best place for a family due to the small pool area and hipster vibe. We look forward to returning to the Laylow!
user_name:
jen_travels636
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed here for 4 nights because we decided to elope in Oahu. Laylow was in a great location near the restaurants and beach. It's not right on the beach but a 5 minute walk so very convenient. The bar has great cocktails and food is delicious. The hotel is very chic and very chilled and feels new. The bar is trendy and attracts the young hip crowd on Friday and Saturday evenings. Great shower pressure and bath amenities very catered to females (makeup remover wipes!) Pool is cool to chill out by and gym is decent sized for our circuit training. We had problems with payment but it was quickly recognised and rectified.I would recommend this place for couples and girl trips away. Loved the tropical decor and the welcome basket is lovely. The concierge is lovely and so helpful! He got us a bottle of sparkling on our wedding day so thoughtful :)

I am a Marriott Bonvoy Titanium member and travel on a continuous basis for work. Honestly, I LOVED The Laylow - from the rooms, hotel amenities, in-room welcome basket, bathroom products, onsite restaurant (expensive but good quality) and most importantly their staff. In particular I want to commend the following staff for making my 9 day stay even more enjoyable as follws: Alahi and Hokulani (Front Desk), DJ (Pool Attendant), Edgar and Daisy (Hideout Restaurant). My only suggestions for travelers is to try to get a high floor only because many of the lower floors do not have any views of the ocean and if you are a pool person like me, get to the pool early as there are limited lounge chairs on the deck. The pool has regular chairs and water lounges that seem to always have availability. Also, the sun doesn't seem to hit the deck until 11:30-12:30 so if you want sun walk to the beach (one block) and then come back later. ENJOY your stay; I hope you will love The Laylow as much as I did!

Thank you hokulani for helping me out with all my needs and making sure my stay was extra special! She was quick to answer any questions I had and knew any and all info I needed. She was also very polite and made me feel like I could come to her for anything. Wonderful hotel and staff!

We spent two nights at the Laylow on our way to Tahiti. We wanted a good location, which this is but we also thought that it would be nice and relaxing, which it isn’t.The hotel is very well located for shopping, dining and exploring Waikiki but the area where it is located is very busy and noisy!Our room was on the 8th floor and you could hear a lot of road noise and deliveries starting around 6am every morning.If you are a light sleeper you should look at getting a room on a higher floor.Only other issue is the lack of recognition for Marriott Bonvoy Elite members. We requested a late checkout and the best they would offer was a half hour extension where most Marriott properties offer an hour or two!

Family went on a staycation and choose to go Leilow in Waikiki. Looked cool and good location. The shave ice was really good and helped us cool down. The pool was small and intimate and perfect to just hang out. It was what we were looking for. The international marketplace is right there so lots of shopping and food options. Staff of hotel was good and helpful and really nice. The bartendars were not the most helpful and I had to flag them down to get a drink even at slow times. But still overall was decent enough in service. Cons:The bed was lopsided. After the first night I woke up the next morning feeling un rested and my back felt sore. But kids were excited and we headed out first thing in the morning and spent the whole day swimming and hanging out in Waikiki. Came back after dinner exhausted and was ready to go to bed. The kids were in bed and when I jumped in the bed I realized the left side was lower than the right side. I asked my wife to jump on the bed and she said it was lopsided. At that point I was going to call to switch beds but the kids were sleeping so I just slept on the bed and woke up unrested again but we were checking out and going back home. At this point I probably would have still gave 3 stars since the hotel stay was great, amenities were as expected and the lopsided bed probably minused one star. When I came home I recieved an email on a survey. I participated and expressed how the bed being lopsided was bad and I wouldn’t wish it upon anyone else to sleep on. I mentioned in the survey that I wanted to be contacted via email due to the lopsided bed. No one ever responded. If you are going to have me do a survey on my stay and ask for my opinion then at least follow thru and reach out to me. Not sure if hotel manager gets these survey. If they do then I fault them for not getting back to me. If the hotel managers never get the survey then what is the purpose of having us take them. And because of this I gave a 1 star as this is a service based industry and if Marriott doesn’t take it seriously then they will lose customers because of this.

Everything about The Laylow is beautiful! An unexpected find when searching for boutique hotels in Honolulu, but what a treasure. From the moment I arrived after a long international flight from Australia I was warmly greeted and the staff were exceptional, warm, welcoming and accommodating. This really is something special.

I spend about 100 nights every year in hotels. To get enough sleep being away from home, I typically ask for silent rooms. I did the same in the laylow at the pre-checkin at 8:30 am of the day of arrival, coming back for the checkin at 6pm (doing a day tour in between). What we got is a room directly facing a parking space, on the same floor, with loud music and a constantly working air airconditioning of a shopping center next door, with the elevators in front of the room and a door to our neighbors. I asked for a change after I saw the room, but no way. Really? That is the worst experience I have had in years. After coming from a perfect experience at the Hyatt Waikiki Beach, this is even more disappointing, considering that this hotel is more expensive and much worse located. Just the interior is better, as newly renovated. I do not recommend this hotel, if you like a good night sleep in your holidays.

So glad we booked here. It was a great location, pretty central in Waikiki and close to the International Marketplace and Dukes Lane. It’s not as close to the water like some hotels, but that’s not what we were looking for. The rooms a modern and I suspect the hotel is not very old. We would definitely book here again on our next visit to Hawaii.

From the moment my family and I arrived we knew we had made a great decsion selecting the Laylow. Summer checked us in and helped with an early room allocation which was well appreciated. She was so helpful with all the details about the property and surrounding areas all with "Aloha" spirit. I must say all the staff we interacted with made our stay special. I appreciated having 2 x king beds which is a rare occurrence that worked well for 2A & 2C (6 & 8 yo) and the welcome basket was great.No boring brown cookie cutter room styling here, which makes for a welcome change.Our rate included credit towards breakfast at the hideout each morning. This became one of our travel highlights - coffee, food and service all top shelf! The terrace bar/meals area is such a delight to relax and is so well appointed and kept. Although the pool is small, my young daughters had no complaints and enjoyed a daily splash. Location is perfect, being righ next door to the international food market complex, provided many choices for shopping, meals and even a really great free Hula show well worth taking the time out for. Given the gym is modest in size, the choices of equipment still enable variety to get the most out of your fitness needs.Needless to say, we would certinaly stay here again. Thanks Laylow, till next time!

Stayed here for five nights before a cruise back across the Pacific to Vancouver and was very impressed with the service. WIFI is excellent, coffee bar/bar/lounge open from 4:30am to the early AM. Gym is well equipped and spacious and restaurants, bars, shopping, Waikiki trolley all within steps of the front escalator. Front desk and concierge staff were all very knowledgable and helpful ... regardless of the question. Would stay here again.

I want to give a warm mahalo to all of Waikiki Laylow Hotel staff! Living on Oahu, The Laylow Hotel is a perfect staycation hotel. My apartment had water damage that initially needed two-weeks for repairs. The repairs ended up taking five and a half months, from March to September 2019! My initial feeling was stressed to be living out of a suitcase, but the staff made it easy to adapt to the situation.The Laylow is located on Kuhio Street, one street inland from the busy Kalakaua Avenue and almost half way between the Waikiki stretch. I was able to walk instead of dealing with traffic and parking. There is a market next door for any needed essentials, shopping, and restaurants. The Laylow is a smaller intimate boutique hotel that is able to maintain a hospitable environment. The staff consistently provided me with unexpected personal attention that made this stay feel like a second home. Off of the bustle of Waikiki, you take a ride up the escalator and enter tropical sanctuary. There are multiple seating areas surrounded by lush greenery. From this area you can access the pool/gift shop/gym area, the front desk, and the Hideout coffee, restaurant and bar. From my check-in to the multiple extensions, to checkout, the front desk was always very helpful in making the changes and accommodating any needs. The entire front desk staff were all very welcoming, especially Joey who greeted me by name every time I left or returned to the hotel. In a conversation about coffee, he offered to have a coffee maker sent to my room. I was given two complimentary coffees/teas to make a day. This was an unexpected convenience for me for those rushed mornings before leaving for work. I didn’t have to worry if there was a line for coffee in the lobby.My Laylow room was on the 10th floor and comfortable with a midcentury style and the right touch of Hawaii detail. A welcome basket and a note was in the room with snacks, bottled water, a cute Laylow duck, slippers (flip flops), and $50 activity credit that can be used with the concierge. The room had a mini fridge, built-in style furniture along with books, fun décor, and a ukulele for those of you who are musically talented. The hotel also offers ukulele lessons you can sign up for held in the lobby! Rooms also have a reading area and balcony for another relaxing space. I loved having the plush robe after using the large walk-in shower and lounging. After earning enough Marriott rewards points I was able to upgrade to a 12th floor corner junior suite. This room was very spacious having two balconies, and two sitting areas. During my entire stay at the Laylow, I rarely spent time in the rooms. I almost felt like I was missing out on enjoying the corner suite, but Waikiki has so much to do rather than stay in the room! The housekeeping staff was also always consistent in the cleanliness of the rooms, leaving a sufficient supply of toiletries, and accommodating any needs I had. I liked how they came during work hours too!Another favorite is the saltwater pool with submerged lounge chairs along one side, comfortable cushioned lounge chairs with overhead moveable shades, and two cabanas. They also have fruit infused water and fresh fruit available daily while relaxing in the sun. Around midday, a pool server stops by and gives mocktails and a menu for easy ordering drinks and/or food. The Wagyu Mainlander Burger and fries was perfect for lunch at the pool, followed by a 1:00 pm complementary shave ice! The pool attendant DJ was always attentive in welcoming me to the pool, and providing me with sunglass wipes. Love those! There is also gym access from the pool area open 24 hours. The gym also has fruit infused water, fresh fruit, towels, and ear buds to use with the machines. They have a variety of equipment for any level of workout you might desire during your vacation. In the early morning hours, I had the gym to myself!The valet was another plus for me during this extensive stay. I was always greeted with a smile and by name. They knew my work schedule and had my car pulled up front before I came down from my room. Even when they got busy during peak times, the valet team made sure my car was near. The entire valet team was friendly and made it a point to be aware of my schedule. In the morning the Hideout coffee bar was a friendly bonus where I could grab a coffee and order a great acai bowl. They also have fruit and bars to grab for on-the-go mornings. Maryann greeted me frequently and offered me a stamp card where you earn a free coffee after nine stamps. I was able to earn a lot of free coffees during my stay!The Hideout Restaurant and Bar was my go-to spot for many snacks, breakfast, lunch, dinner, and drinks. Managers Roberto and Ben do a fantastic job to ensure the Hideout is run smoothly. They regularly check in with guests and have welcoming personalities that make them easy and fun to talk to. The Hideout environment is laid back with stylish décor that makes you want to hang out forever. The energy is always fun! I especially liked how there are no televisions in this space, this forces patrons to be more social and enjoy the moments. During my time at the Hideout I met many interesting people from locals, to business travelers, to vacationers. In fact, I still keep in touch with some of those people. In the open-air rooftop style area, there are two large fire pits on each end and lounge seating. Local music artist begin to play at 7:00 pm every night and allows the crowd to feel that intimate, yet exciting venue. They also have a DJ play for the weekend nightlife vibe. There aren’t many places in Waikiki that provide fun live music nightly.This was a fantastic spot to go to unwind after work and enjoy happy hour or dinner. They have a menu with a variety of Pacific-Rim style choices. My favorite appetizers are the poke tacos and Pork Belly Brussel Sprouts. The Manchego & Truffle Flatbread is yummy and the Asian Pear/Bacon jam flatbread with a glass of Pinot Grigio is the perfect combo! The Hideout also features a fresh catch fish dinner that the chef prepares perfectly with your choice of a recommended sauce. Other favorites are the Poke and/or Chicken Rice Bowl, Miso Spinach Salad add Chicken, Coconut Curry Seafood, and the Mango Smoked Chicken. These are healthy portions that can be shared. All of the meals I had were consistent in preparation and service.Lindsey bartends in the morning and I was able to enjoy his spicy Bloody Mary drinks with a breakfast burrito or avocado toast. Rae, Justin, Tyler, Sheena, Matt, Julie, and Atticus bartend in the evenings and I always looked forward to talking to them. They are all very personable and take time to get to know the people who sit at their bar by name. There were times where they would have my glass of wine ready as I walked towards them! Although my norm is a glass of Rose or Pinot Grigio, I’m also a gin drinker, but picky about the brand. Justin took time to make me a fancy gin cocktail that I was able to add to my favorite gin list. The consistency of the staff for my long stay says a lot about how the staff is treated by management. I am under the impression that the Laylow staff is an extension of their own ohana. During this extensive time I was able to have both friends and family stay at the hotel or visit to enjoy the Laylow with me. It’s now become their favorite too! Mahalo to the Laylow staff for creating a home-away-from-home for me! I’ll be seeing them all again soon :)

Looking for great and friendly service?....As you pull up to the valet, they greet you well and are very quick, provide excellent services, and as you step onto the escalator and feel the breeze going up, you are greeted at the top with a warm Aloha greeting. They escort you to the front desk, and the receptionists give you a warm greeting with a big smile while they check you in. Onto the rooms- We were booked in one of the suites- it was very clean, a simple Hawaiian motif. Things were very roomy and well organized. On the floor we were at there was a lounge that had a coffee bar that provided delicious refreshments. Overall, excellent and friendly service, clean, and right next door to the International Market. If you want to experience the Aloha spirit, stay at The Laylow Waikiki.

Our stay at the LayLow far exceeded our expectations. But to be fair it started nearly 4 weeks before we got here. We were planning a staycation and then checking out the hotels the LayLow kept surfacing as an ideal spot for local families. So we decided to do some reconnaissance. The moment we walked into the hotel we were great greeted by Rachel at the reception desk who gave us the details of the hotel invited us on a quick tour and encouraged us to have a bite and a drink at the bar. She just had so much aloha we couldn’t help but feel right at home and then our food and drinks were amazing.It was quite a first impression and thankfully our stay, rather than challenging that impression actually confirmed it; the LayLow will be our go-to spot from now on, it is conveniently located between Kuhio and Kalakaua avenues so you can feel part of the action or just distant enough to keep the relaxing vibe. So how did we spend our time do you ask? Sitting at the pool drinking amazing cocktails and lounging around doing absolutely nothing during the days then in the evening cruising Waikiki, dancing and having an amazing time. The LayLow was the perfect homebase.Big Mahalo to Suzanne and Rachel and our food service workers Justin and Alexa it’s a great crew we will see you again soon!

The Laylow is my new favorite hotel in Waikiki! I recently went with a few friends to celebrate my birthday and every detail the Laylow team put into my stay made for one awesome birthday celebration. Victoria was so friendly and welcoming during the check-in process. She truly embodies the aloha spirit. She'd remember us each time we stopped by the front desk during our stay to ask for any thing. We stayed in a Ho‘okipa Level Corner Suite. Upon arriving in my room, there was a bottle of champagne with a super cute note from the hotel wishing me a "Happy 40th Birthday!" The room is perfectly laid out: spacious enough for hanging out with friends, catching some sun from the lanais and had the most comfortable bed, and day beds. We had 4 people staying in the room without it ever feeling crowded and like we each had our own space. The room amenities were great: a welcome basked filled with local goodies, an empty mini-fridge (definitely a plus when you're staying multiple nights), and perfectly scented toiletries.Upon check-out, Summer and Suzanne helped us quickly through the process. We had several room charges that needed to be put on different credit cards and they were able to accommodate our request flawlessly. Mahalo to the Laylow team for such a hospitable stay! I can't wait to return to the islands and stay with you again...

Well, first trip to Hawaii. A friend of mine loves staying here. Right in the middle of everything is what I was looking for. Rooms were great and comfortable. What really made the trip great was how above and beyond the concierge staff was. I work in service and this is the kind of performance I wish I got from every hotel. Ricahrd and Meena were SO easy to deal with. Seriously made the whole trip better with their suggestions and guidance. Thank you for such an amazing time. I appreciate you 2 especially.

Fairly new hip, vibey hotel that offers daily shaved ice from 1.00-2.00pm and waitresses come around with refreshing drinks round the pool regularly. We stayed on the ground floor in one of the 4 pool cabana rooms available. These had great access to the pool and reception areas but the downside of being close to the lifts and reception/bar noise. This wouldn’t be a problem for heavy sleepers or partygoers but if it’s the weekend and you are up early to fly out... maybe stay in one of the very large we’ll-appointed upstairs rooms.

Hotel at very central location in waikiki. Easy access to everything. Great restaurants nearby, Starbucks is just a few steps away. International market just right next door. Hotel room is good for a group of 5adults. big space with comfy beds.

We arrived early and were able to drop our bags off with a very receptive employee. The hotel is in great condition, has live music at night, a bar onsite, and a salt water pool. The pool area was a good size and didn't ever look over full. There is a daily resort fee which came with a few perks like a welcome gift basket that had snacks and sandles. The resort also had towels to take to the beach and a few other benefits. The only disappointmeant was some of the benefits were very time limited like the shaved ice. It would have been better as a serve yourself setup then a specfic and limited time window. The room and bed were comfortable with a dedicated sitting area, large tv, and small balcony.Pros:Staff was very receptive and kindRooms and hotel were in great shapeOnsite barConvenient access to shopping, rental cars, and foodCons:Resort fee was a bit too high and the benefits very time limited. A bit noisy as there is a parking garage next door.

I booked this hotel because the rate included complimentary valet parking and destination fee. There was a bit of misunderstanding but the front desk ladies and gents were amazing! Even though I had to call Chase several times, the Laylow staff were super patient and understanding and always had a smile while trying to solve my issue. I also requested to move my room since my view was the parking lot. Even though there was not a suite available until the next day, I gladly waited to move because Gabrielle the manager made me feel so welcome and taken care of. Special thanks to Summer and Gabrielle. Thank you for making my stay amazing and always providing me the best customer service. I will definitely be back because of the staff and service! FYI, all junior suites are next to the elevator but you wont hear the commotion from the elevator because of the configuration of the room. The hotel is surrounding by buildings so the sound from the live music travels up. Request higher room floors for better view.

So far the best hotel we’ve stayed in Hawaii whole all others have disappointed. Location- central. Easy walking distance to shops, restaurants, 24 hrs convenience stores, laundromat, beach. Hotel also provides bicycles for free which we used to bike to the nearest Crossfit box for 3 mornings. And to Ala Moana Centre too. Room - really tastefully done. Mid century Nordic designs in wood and a warm green / teal colour. Accented with drawings of palms on the wall paper, sand design echoed on pool towels, flip flops given to us, etc. Quality and sturdy furniture that still looks good despite all the stays. Bathroom is well designed. Showers have wood tiles so feels warm to be in there. No view of the water and get a room on the high floor. 15 or 16th. Not rooms by the pool. It gets really noisy early. Big surprise- along the corridor is a self service station with a great coffee machine (really good coffee with all kinds you can think of. Even the regular black coffee has a great cream!). There are also 3 kinds of water on tap! Snacks like assorted nuts, fruits like oranges and green apples. In the afternoon, there maybe be cookies or something sweet up for grabs. In the mornings, they put out pain au chocolat, cinnamon rolls, etc. It’s a great pick me up place and I’ve never been so excited to get to a corridor to see what they have put out! Restaurant- had dinner there once, and a small breakfast. Menu is limited and in the evenings, it’s a big hangout place for the local hipsters with live music. So it gets noisy. Overall, I’d recommend it.

The hotel may not be the newest in Waikiki nor the fanciest, BUT therein lies the charm. Add a perfect location, 2 blocks from the ZOO and crowds of Waikiki and 2 blocks from the Canal that separates Waikiki madness from the rest of Honolulu; though in a lovely private pool area, and a great bar and you have an excellent base from which to explore Oahu. Oh, did I mention the International Marketplace only a half block away with shopping, fine dining, entertainment, and general food/necessity availability and it’s all here. Let me not forget the STAFF!!! Wonderful, accommodating, cheerful, friendly, and just about any other accolade you can think of fits. Housekeeping A+. Front Desk A+. Bar tenders and waitresses A+. Pool towel attendants A+. As a Titanium Bonvoy member I did stop by many other Marriott properties to check them out for future visits. Non had the uncrowned relaxed charm of LayLow. Thank you staff for a terrific week.

My husband and I came here for our 1-year anniversary and we were so excited. Well, we got 0 sleep because of our neighbors and the roaring cars/street outside (even with earplugs), we went to relax at the pool early to find people 'reserved' the only beds with towels and didn't come to claim them for another 4 hours - and nobody from the hotel helped. The location was right in the middle of busy streets - our view was of a parking garage, the rooms were so cramped. The only nice part was the bar/restaurant attached. Great cocktails and dinner/breakfast. But they play music until late so that's more noise added :)Our anniversary was ruined. I suggest going to ANY OTHER ISLAND BUT THIS ONE. It's trashy, packed, and there's no serene nature.

The Laylow is every instagrammer's dream. From the straws and cups to the welcome basket, every detail at this beautiful hotel has been crafted to include their signature colors/decor. We loved the welcome basket, which included water, snacks/chips and flip flops. Free shaved ice by the pool daily, while sitting in their first come, first serve cabanas. We came here for our honeymoon and booked a junior suite. It was right by the elevator on the 9th floor but we hardly noticed the noise that some reviews mentioned. Never had to wait long for an elevator. The noise from the street can be loud but we slept just fine at night. The room was super clean and the netflix/smart tv was a great touch. Valet parking was $45 daily. Location is prime. Across the street is the popular Marakume Udon, as well as the international market next door. Kalakaua Ave for all the main action/shopping is just a short block away and we usually just took the side alleyway to cut through all the foot traffic. Everything was within walking distance and perfect for us to get away and relax for the week. I def recommend staying here and would stay here again the future.

This place is such a fun place to be. It is very clean and comfortable. The rooms are so inviting. The restaurants are so good. The brussel sprouts and pork is so good. The refresher drinks by the pool are awesome too. This is our second stay and will definitely return again. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The pool is small but never had a problem getting a lounger. The pool only has direct sun for a few hours but really it is enough. Very short walk to the beach and right next to the International Marketplace. We are Platinum Elite and had a high floor room. Very quiet.

I was checked in by an amazing associate, Rachel, who provided true Aloha spirit and outstanding customer service. Rachel was a very kind receptionist who made you feel like you're the only one in the hotel. She goes the extra mile to ensure you receive the perfect room and acknowledged and appreciated our marriott elite status. This hotel is in a great location and is a lovely modern, comfortable and beautifully decorated in hawaiian style. The bed and room was comfortable and includes nice personal touches such as a welcome basket in your room. This hotel provides a lovely outdoor bar area with music and outdoor couches and chairs that provided a relaxing atmosphere. This hotel is close to everything and is in a centralized Waikiki location. This hotel proves why I'm loyal to the marriott brand. You will not be disappointed at this hotel. Extremely clean and comfortable. From the moment you check in till the time you leave, you will love this hotel. Every employee we met from housekeeping to the bar, bellman and front desk display outstanding customer service. Obviously the management at this hotel cares about the customers with the highest level of service. Have been to Waikiki dozens of times but this is my new go to hotel when in the area. The only thing zi would improve is while the pillows are comfortable, they are not the signature pillows in which we are used to at other Marriott brands. Kudos again to Rachel for setting a perfect customer service tone at check in. I can't wait to stay here again.
user_name:
iluvtheocean
North Myrtle Beach, South Carolina

review_body: We dined at the roof bar last Thursday and enjoyed the awesome array of foods that we shared. Our waitress was awesome and explained a few options which we took onboard. The drinks are very good, the food, the egg rolls fresh, pork belly with Brussel sprouts unbelievable, as I usually am not that much of a sprouts fan, pizza a good size and chicken satay skewers, all very good, a real different touch to the usual deep fried pub food. The musician played great tunes without being overtly loud and the seating is pretty different for a casually good time, worth the visit.
