Highly recommend The Laylow. Great location, ~10 minute walk to Waikiki Beach. Cool vibe and extremely friendly staff. Nice little welcome basket in your room upon arrival with an array of local snacks and flip flops! Having the bar open super early to grab coffee helps when you're up at 4am because of jetlag

My wife and 2 x kids (3yr and 6yr) stayed at the Lawlow for 6 nights. Excellent location. We stayed on the corner suite on level 7. The room size was excellent. Our kids shared the day bed (which was the size of a double bed). Pillows were somewhat disappointing to my liking. We arrived early at 10.30am to check in and were told that a room wasn't available, but if a room did become available, it would cost $50 (for an earlier check in). I've never heard of any hotel who charges a fee like this before (maybe its a Hawaiian custom?). They took our contact details and the reception advised that they would contact us if a room became available before the 3.00pm check in time. We decided to leave our bags in their storage to grab an early lunch and a wander of the surrounds until the check in time of 3.00pm. We decided to head back to grab a drink at the Hideout at 2.00pm. We also queried reception if any rooms were available and were advised yes (so much for reception contacting us as previously advised). There wasn't a $50 early check in fee as we were within the hour.So after the drink at Hideout we handed our storage tags to reception who then passed the tags on to the Porters (so they could retrieve our luggage). 1 hour 25 mins later, our bag hadn't arrived. By this time I made 2 x follow up phone calls and even went back downstairs to where the luggage was stored to grab the luggage myself...only to be told that it was already sent up to my room. I beat the porter to my room by a furthet 5mins. Frustrating after a 9hr flight.Overall, rooms were clean, it could get abit noisy for those on the lower floors above the bar due to the live music every night. I enjoyed listening to it on the balcony. Pool is tiny. Not suitable for young kids.Shaved Ice was great.Reception Service 6Porter Service 2Housekeeping Service 6 (they tended to clean our room in the afternoons after we had been out all morning)Cleanliness 8Location 10Room size 10Resort Fees 4Nice boutique hotel. We would come back and stay again.

My husband and I came for a 1 year anniversary trip. I had been to Hawaii a few times but not in over 10 years and he had never been. Generally I’m not a fan of going to big cities on vacation so in other circumstances I would have skipped Waikiki and gone straight on to our Kauai vacation but since we had to fly into HNL anyway and my husband wanted to see Pearl Harbor we decided to stay for a few nights. I dithered on which Marriott Bonvoy property to stay at, of which there were many as I had enough points for 3 nights at any of them, including the Ritz. Ultimately I decided to book the Laylow after reading all of the reviews here and the allure of the boutique style hotel that wasn’t a massive resort with hundred of kids on the already over crowded Waikiki beach. I have stayed at Marriott properties all over the world and this was by far one of my favorites. The location is perfect, the service is top of the line and the food and drinks at the open air restaurant are the best I’ve had at a hotel. Highly recommend the fish tacos and the Catch the Vibe cocktail. The welcome amenities and everything that comes with the resort fee are such a nice touch as well - flip flops, water, snacks in your room and the fee covers all of the usuals plus daily pool side cocktail, snack, shave ice, and a credit for an activity. There is live music at the bar every night with some great local acts. Mahalo Laylow!

This is in a great location, central to everything. The room was clean, large and airy, with plenty of room to move. But -- it's so noisy! The 2 large windows let in every possible sound from outside - and the noise went on all night, starting with the disco 'til midnight, then the street party outside. Unfortunately, the bed was rather uncomfortable, with brick-like pillows. At least the shower had good water pressure.

We recently stayed at The Laylow for 9 nights and was very impressed. We booked a junior suite and found the room to be very spacious, with king bed, sofa, arm chair and table and chairs. We were fortunate to be upgraded to the 16th floor and opposite the lifts found the coffee machine, fresh juice and pastries throughout the day a real treat. You could see the ocean from both balconies and it was lovely to open the doors for fresh air. The room was cleaned spotless daily, with plenty of fresh towels. The hotel itself looks fresh with a Hawaiian vibe. The prints on the beach towels are the print on the walls in room and coffee cups. Love the way everything flows. We had the free shaved ice one day and that was a nice treat. Staff were always attentive to any questions we had. Do try and have a drink and breakfast at hideout. Both were great with a lovely atmosphere. And the location of the hotel is perfect. Lots of great restaurants near by and a short walk to beach. Thank you Laylow for an amazing stay and vacation!

My family (with 2 adult kids) stayed at the Laylow. We loved it - great location - lots of restaurants and shopping within walking distance (including Waikiki) - the rooms were very nice and the Hideout restaurant and bar was a plus. The staff was friendly and helpful, we liked the king beds, and the gift basket was a nice touch. We also enjoyed the Hawaiian history books in the room. I highly recommend it, if you want to stay in the Waikiki area.

Our family was spending a couple of nights in Honolulu on the back end of our two week Hawaiian Island vacation, and chose the Laylow, using Marriott Bonvoy points. We stayed the first night, and then, in order to be closer to other family staying at a different nearby Marriott location, we requested that our reservation be changed and my points refunded. Kudos to manager Gabrielle M, who received my request, and while noting the hotel policy did not have to allow me to make such a change only on 24 hours notice, Gabrielle went to bat for me, and made the change happen. I always respect and appreciate managers who will seek empowerment on behalf of a loyal customer (lifetime Platinum Elite). Kudos to Gabrielle, and to the entire staff at the Laylow!

Booked this place as you can get two king size beds. The only hotel I’ve found offering this, anywhere. Great when you’re used to a super king at home and have a daughter who sleeps like a restless octopus!Staff great, breakfast great, lovely gift box with complimentary slippers (or flip flops as we call them in the UK). Wife and daughter still wearing them now.Great location too, but the smallest pool ever, although it is a city centre location to be fair.A nice relaxed vibe about the place.

As a Marriott Titanium member, my wife and I have traveled the world, and stayed in many hotels. On a recent trip to Honolulu, we decided to stay at the Laylow Hotel, which is part of the Marriott Autograph Collection. One word sums this hotel up nicely, “Fabolous”. From check in to check out, we experienced great service, and a welcoming spirit. The Laylow has a fantastic restaurant and bar. Excellent food and drinks, at very reasonable prices. Tiki torches and fire pits set the Hawaiian atmosphere and ambiance in the evening. No need to go anywhere else from this all inclusive hotel. This hotel is highly recommended. Fantastic rooms with a welcoming basket are icing on the cake. Now for some constructive criticism that will move this hotel from 4 star to 5 star. The pool and deck are very small. It is a very nice pool and deck, it just happens to be tiny. My observation is that many of the local residents/children from surrounding neighborhoods , use the pool each day. Not sure why, when you have the most beautiful beach in the world right here for free at your 24/7 disposal. There is no room check/resident confirmation at the pool so it’s basically a free for all for anyone that wants to use it. People just walk right past the “Pool for Hotel Guests Only “ sign. The number of non-residents using the pool is incredible. This makes it very difficult for residents of the hotel to find a place to sit, and use the very small and crowded pool. The recommendation is for those wanting to use the pool to be channeled through the gift shop area where pool users are asked to show a wristband (need to implement this/wristband) by a designated employee. This check should be implemented from 1 June- 1 October (busy season).Other than that, we enjoyed our stay immensely, and would certainly recommend this hotel to all needing accommodations in Honolulu.Mahalo !
Our family enjoyed the phenomenal service that this hotel gave us. The Laylow offers a relaxing vibe, pleasant employees, great food and drinks, and live music nightly. Itruly recommend booking here.

We stayed here for a 5 day break in Oahu. Ideal location. It is not on the sea front but one block away, about a 7 min walk. The hotel has lots of good restaurants near by. Also good shopping malls.Room was very well appointed , very comfortable bed and nice complimentary basket of goodies , including flip flops . We had one on the 15th floor which we paid extra for. There is a counter for hot drinks and cold water on this floor but not sure this perk is worth the money. We had a side on sea view( all views are side on) but the balconies are very small and felt precarious to see the sea so I would say don’t bother troubling your self to pay for it. The hotel has a small pool which looks very smart but there is not much seating so hit and miss if you can get a sun bed. It gets sun in the pool area for about 3 hours each day otherwise it is in shade. They gave complimentary shave ice and the odd drink during the day. We only had breakfast once ( expensive ) and we did not think the pool snacks were up to much - again expensive and a bit pretentious.We did like this hotel though and when looking at the options in Waikiki were happy with our choice. The staff were very friendly and obliging.

We stayed at the Laylow for a long weekend. We got there in the afternoon and our room wasn't ready. The manager had us go to the restaurant and have a free appetizer on the house while we waited for the room. They came and got us when our room was ready. That was very nice. The room was on the 15th floor and we could see the ocean between the buildings - in fact had a great view of the Friday night firework show from our balcony. If you went out onto the balcony, there was a better view of the ocean and the pink Royal Hawaiian Hotel. Each morning in the hallway were croissants or danishes along with juice and coffee. There were cookies at night. The room was a great size with a comfortable king bed and futon coach. My only complaint - the furniture was all very low and not great lighting. The bathroom was a good size with a great walk-in shower. The location is perfect, right next to the International Market, lots of restautants around. It was odd to have to take an outside escalator or elevator to the open lobby. Nice small pool area that was very popular.

The rooms were very clean and their are lots of great amenities. The free shave ice is great! The service was awesome as well. Manager Ashley Westerdahl was very informative and very helpful throughout our stay!

Stayed at the Laylow over 4th of July weekend. It is in a great location. About 10-15 minute walk to Waikiki Beach and steps away from Maurkame Udon and next door to The Street restaurant. Plenty of food and places to eat.Easy check in and as a platinum member they upgraded me to the 15th floor.Things to improve: The snack area on the 15th floor is pretty sad. Not much to offer. I did ask that why the sparkling water was warm. But nothing was done to fix it.Also I was unsure if parking on Sunday’s was free or not. But no one from the hotel staff could give me a straight answer. I think I bit the bullet on $6 since it look like no one paid.Despite that I would stay here again for the location.Pro tip: If you plan on leaving early in the morning to go hiking..etc...I suggest parking your car at Waikiki Parking Garage for $25 or the Hyatt Centric Parking Garage for $15. $38 parking is just too much! Plus it is a 1 min walk to the hotel.

We stayed at the Laylow for a couples trip to Waikiki and we're glad we did! It's super high quality and classy, but not snooty. The bar is a wonderful place, above ground in an open courtyard next to the restaurant. They do live music every night. The drinks are really well made and strong. Our main bartender, Lindsey, was a great guy and made really good drinks. He also gave us a lot of tips and info about the island. The restaurant breakfast is everything a vacation breakfast dreams are made of. Big ass wonderful pancakes, really good sausage, fresh eggs. Their bloody merry has f*king bacon it in it! Yes!Our main front-desk people where Hokukani and Rachel. They went above and beyond. They even spent half an hour helping me find my zip-bag when I left it at the bar the night before (like a drunky). Besides that they were both efficient and helpful. The room was everything you'd expect from an autograph collection hotel. Very clean and crisp place. When we had trouble with the wifi they sent a tech guy out, Johnathan, to help us log in. Really greatThe hotel is also in the middle of really good restaurants and bars. There's a nice little grocery store next door with a bar in it as well.

Wonderful check in, friendly smiling faces and given fresh pineapple and cool clothes.Meena concierge was very helpful in suggestions.All staff was friendly, happy and helpful and worked really hard to remember our likes. They all seemed to enjoy their job.Room on 16 floor, executive hall. Had coffee, hot and cold water, and snacks. Easy walk down the hall in the hotel provided robe.Room was good sized, had a wonderfully comfy bed, low to the ground, a day bed, mini fridge and desk. We were provided a basket with snacks and slippers. There are robes in the closet for your use and I loved the body products, they smelled so good! Towels were absorbent and fluffy.Bathroom was good sized, always hot water in shower, counter space and a small hair dryer. We enjoyed the small balcony with chairs to view the ocean.Never wanted to leave and wish we were there!Small indoor/outdoor restaurant with good food, bar service and local live music. Small pool but nice deck with shade. We liked relaxing there away from the bustle of Waikiki. Easy walk to everything, including buses.Will definitely be back!

Hotel was clean, new, and had a nice artsy vibe. Bar and Restaurant were great and nightly entertainment was nice.Hotel was in a perfect location and was within walking distance to the beach (which we didn't like due to overcrowding) and may food options. Pool was very small and not a lot of pool chairs/beds. Didn't have a view as hotel in in between parking garages.Would definitely stay there again.

Waikiki is a crowded beach and a 15 minute walk away so having the alternative of a pool was key for us. The pool at the Laylow is very small, has very limited seating and even more limited sun (it’s on the 2nd floor and tall buildings surround it). Beware of the daily resort fee that gets you nothing (okay, you do get ukulele lessons - lame), not even parking like other Marriotts. Given all that, the hotel is new and clean and the rooms are nice.

Cool boutique hotel in the heart of Waikiki. Spacious, stylish and clean rooms with great daily room service. Comfiest hotel bed we’ve stayed in. The pool was awesome and the food at the restaurant was delicious. Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful.

We loved everything about our stay at the LayLow. You are made to feel very welcome! Rooms are great and the location is great. Highly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Waikiki. Nice touch with the welcome basket as well in an era when hotels are pulling back on inclusions.

This was a very nice boutique hotel in the middle of Waikiki. It’s just s couple of doors down from the International Marketplace shopping mall. The rooms are on the smaller size but well appointed. If you have Netflix or hbo you can stream your own account on the TV. The pool is just off the lobby and a nice place to hang out. They have a nice outdoor bar and restaurant. The beach is a short walk away (about 2 blocks) and Marukame Udon is across the street. There are lots of great restaurants and shopping close by. The concierge at the hotel is also helpful. There was a welcoming basket in the room with bottles of water, snacks and complimentary flip flops to keep. A good value for location.

My wife and I selected the Laylow because we wanted an affordable hotel in Waikiki within walking distance to the beach. The hotel has very nice rooms with great views. Happy hour every day. Great concierge service.

The Laylow has five star service with high attention to detail. After arriving exhausted from long flights, the front desk staff made sure the check in was seamless - even offering early check in and helping me order a much needed coffee at the cute coffee bar! The rooms (along with the rest of the hotel) feel new and very clean with the perfect decor (very retro Hawaiian chic). The devil is in the details. You definitely feel like you are in Hawaii - not just any Marriott! On top of that, the room comes with a welcome basket that includes high quality Hawaiian items - we enjoyed having the snacks throughout the trip!While not on the beach, The Laylow is walking distance from the beach, shops, and restaurants. Additionally, it has a modern pool with comfortable loungers (think cushions, not hard plastic). Finally - the hotel has a gem - Hideout. We had delicious breakfast there (crab and prawn eggs benedict with mango hollandaise - absolutely amazing!). It also looked delightful at night with live music and tiki torches.Overall - great staff, great service, great decor, great atmosphere, great quality. Highly recommend.

We loved our stay here! Cute room, great location. We appreciated the welcome basket and used the complementary flip flops throughout our trip. The bed was especially comfortable.The beach, restaurants, bars, shops all steps away. The bar is very nice with great live music. We'd highly recommend this hotel!

We have just enjoyed 10 nights at the Laylow and have just loved it. This is not your ordinary 'cookie-cutter' hotel but one of real charm and personality. The hotel has a mid century feel with it's cutting edge design and decor. From the minute you check in you get the feeling that your in for a treat. We stayed in a Junior Suite which had ample room for 2 - the color scheme, wallpaper furnishings were all great. It's a real boutique hotel which made our stay in Hawaii very memorable. Love the shaved ice and flip flops to take home.

We stayed at the the Laylow for a week, and while the location is great if you want to be in the center of downtown Waikiki, about a 5’ walk to the beach, the Laylow is nothing to write home about. It is a pretty average hotel, with the rooms on both sides of the hotel overlooking parking garages, which is really disappointing when you enter the room after landing in a tropical paradise. The rooms are clean, which is good, but they are basic. If you are looking for a lowish cost hotel in a great location, that is good enough for a family vacation, then this may work for you. However, the only reason we stayed at the Laylow was that we booked a last minute vacation over Christmas and New Years, and had almost no other options. We will not return to the Laylow.

I’m picky, very picky. We usually stay at the Turtle Bay Resort, Aulani and The Kahala, but have also stayed at the Marriott, Embassy Suites, Waikiki Parc and others. I had been interested in the Laylow. I was intrigued by the retro Hawaiian decor at this Marriott Autograph hotel and really liked the idea of two king beds. I was a bit hesitant when it first opened, but decided to give it a try a few months ago.Verdict: We loved it! I would not hesitate to return, as a matter of fact - we will be returning later this month. The location is perfect. It is in Waikiki, but away from the noise and a very short walk to the best part of Waikiki Beach. The renovated beautiful International Market Place is next door. It was an easy walk thru the International Market Place, cross the street, go thru a lobby and we were at the beach. The hospitality was wonderful. Every staff member that we interacted with was very polite and helpful. If you lucky enough to run into the manager as we did, you will find a very polite person who is truly interested in giving you a wonderful unique experience. His staff reflects this.The rooms are brand new, clean and the decor is delightful. We enjoyed having a ukulele in the room and a wonderful selection of books to read. The books were really great selections about the history of Hawaii, culture, architecture and the Hawaiians. All carefully selected. You can see that lots of thought went into selecting these books, which is true for every detail in the room. There is no detail that has been overlooked even the straws in the coffee bar have that retro look. if you have an interest in retro Hawaii, you will be in paradise. We loved that the TV had Netflix and we were able to watch the finale to one of our favorite shows.The room was very quiet. We never heard anyone next door nor in the hall and we were right across from the elevator, but never heard a thing.Every morning we had fantastic coffee at their coffee bar. They have the very delicious and hip Stump Town coffee from Portland, Oregon. We tasted amazing cappuccinos and Lattes every morning and enjoyed their pastries. No need for a Starbucks!We spent an evening at the outdoor lounge, The Hideaway and very much enjoyed our time drinking some of the best mai tais in town with delicious appetizers. Don't miss the appetizers. They are excellent. The Hideaway is a popular place. Live music is performed and the breeze up there is great.Other highlights were being across the street from Marakume Udon. It has the best udon. We ate there twice. FYI: best time to eat there without lines is 10:00am or 3:00pm. Expect a wait if it is any other time, but totally worth it. Get a piece of fried chicken to go with it, you’ll thank me later.The top floor of the International Market Place has lots of upscale dining options. They are all beautiful and very temping. I suggest a visit to the IMP to check it out for yourself. If you are on a budget, then turn left and next door you will find Duke’s Lane Market and Eatery where you will find some great dining options and a large ABC market with food and drinks. We ate at Ono Burgers twice on our trip. Fantastic! Look down the alley and you will find the absolute best place on the island to purchase souvenirs. there are dozens of vendors selling everything you could possibly want. Don’t miss checking them out!Our stay at the Laylow was fun, exciting, comfortable, refreshing and it is a most welcomed new hotel on Oahu. Don’t think about it twice, book your stay.

Comparing to other hotels in Waikiki, this is a vibrant hotel with a lot of cool factors.Hippy decor brightens up the lobby.There a rooftop bar which turns into a lively lounge on fri and sat, with DJ spinning. Sound insulation here is good hence guests will not be affected by the music. The bar serves coffee and pastries early in the morning , in time before any day trip commences. Pastries is excellent.24hr gym is next to pool, free weights and machines available.Location is great, at the middle of Kuhio Ave, right next to Int'l Mkt Place10 min walk to the beach.Room is spacious for sure. But if i were to list 2 negative points, there are ants in the room ( i stayed in a pool cabana, that could be a reason ), floor drainage in shower area is not effective, resulting in a bit of ponding. But in overall, these does not affect my stay. I am happy with this hotel

We couldn't have been happier with The Laylow - the staff friendly & attentive, the rooms spacious, neat & very clean. The position is priceless - right next door to the International Markets. We would DEFINITELY recommend The Laylow to visitors.

I would highly recommend this hotel when staying in Waikiki:- Great location, short walk to the beach and various restaurants- Friendly and well-skilled check in staff (even the concierge says hello when walking past to the elevator)- Spacious corner suite with a dining table and two balconies- Welcome basket with water, flip flops and local treats- Big bathroom and walk in showerThe bar/restaurant downstairs is also great for a quick bite, or drinks at sunset.

We spent a wonderful week at the hotel with our three children in a large, cozy, bright and pleasant room.When we arrived at the hotel, we were greeted with pleasant Hawaiian music and burning torches.In our room, we received a basket with traditional biscuits and treats, beach slippers and ukulele ...The distance to the beach is close, the pool is not so large but sufficient. The staff was great and happy to assist with any request

I was so happy with my stay. Comfortable bed, nice bathroom, spacious and stylish room, nice balcony and friendly staff. I loved the welcome basket. By far, the best value out of the places I stayed in Hawaii. It's the nicest 3 star hotel room I've stayed in, certainly kept in a nicer state than many 4 star hotels I've visited.

This was a great property. Walking distance of everything you need to reach in Waikiki. The pool area was glorious. Our room was very spacious and we loved the welcome basket we received with flip flops for both of us, local treats, etc. Each day they had free samples of drinks and shaved ice around the pool. It was spotless. It isn't beach side so if you are looking for a place with a great view this is not it. But I did not go to Hawaii to sit in the room to look at the view. Amenities were top notch and public areas were beautiful.

I stayed here for three nights during my wedding under the kama'aina special, which included free valet parking and waived resort fee. The first full day, our room [corner junior suite w/ king bed and queen day bead] was bridesmaid "get-ready" headquarters. The room was chic, clean and spacious enough. The other two nights, I stayed with my husband for a little 'staycation' since our honeymoon wasn't immediately after the wedding. As kama'aina I love this hotel and will stay again. Nearly every employee we interacted with was stellar and had amazing guest service skills. The food at the restaurant/bar was tasty and the drinks were unique. The pool area is relaxing and very cute. The location is convenient and walking distance to many of the Waikiki attractions. The prices are very reasonable and I feel like I got my money's worth. Clearly, there are a plethora of good things to say about this place!For the sake of review, there were just a few things that could be improved, but definitely not enough to deter me from staying again:1) Our mini-fridge didn't seem to maintain a consistent, cold enough temperature. Some of the things I put in there were not always cold enough to the touch when I took them out. The temperature gauge randomly fluctuated from 35 degrees to 44 degrees.2) There is only one place to get ice, in an ice chest on the lobby level near the pool. I think a few more ice chests on a couple of floors would be a little more convenient. Also, I couldn't seem to find any signage on where to get ice in my room or in the hallway outside my room, so I called down front desk and they let me know.3) There was only one employee working poolside [taking drink/food orders] on the day we went to the pool. Though it wasn't overwhelmingly busy that day, it seemed like a lot for one person to handle. We would have ordered more had she made it to us sooner [between her running back to input the orders and running the orders out, it took about an hour for her to get to us]. I don't necessarily fault her with this, however I do think they should staff at least 2 people to work poolside.

My friends and I stayed here and we could not have asked for a better experience! The staff is welcoming and extremely accommodating, and the rooms were very clean and decorated adorably. The bar in the lobby ended up being our favorite bar in Oahu because of the delicious drinks, warm atmosphere, and live music. We will definitely be staying here again in the future!

We booked this hotel after hearing a New Zealand radio host talk about staying there when she went to Hawaii. We were very impressed with the hotel the rooms, the pool area and the bar and resturant. This is so handy to everything so if we go back to Hawaii we will stay there again.

It was our first time in Honolulu so we wanted to stay somewhere amazing and cool! The Laylow was just that! All the staff are incredibly accommodating and friendly! On arrival you get a welcome basket filled with Hawaiian snacks, sandals etc. The laylow has not got that hotel feel, it’s got a cafe, a restaurant, a bar/club (The Hideout) and pool which all makes you feel like your a VIP! Also the free ukulele lessons and shaved ice should not be missed! Amazing place!

Stayed here for 8 nights in April. The hotel is nicely situated around the corner from the Main Street and 5 min walk from the beach. Many restaurants beside it plus little grocery shopsThe welcome basket is so thoughtful. The staff are very friendly. The design of the hotel is amazing and you really get a happy Hawaiian feeling in this hotel. The pool isn’t deep so keep that in mind but it’s perfect for dipping in and out during the hot weather. We had breakfast here once and it was nice but mostly we went next door to basalt for breakfast. The gym is small but perfect for a bit of exercise on holidays. The toiletries in the bathroom are lovely and the showers are great. Really loved our stay here and would stay here over and over again.

This hotel was in a great location and a great city hotel. This is not a beach hotel. It is walking distance to the beach (5-10 minutes). We booked this hotel because of it having 2 king bed rooms, which suited us perfectly. It was a little tight for the 4 of use, but that is normal for the city. They do have valet parking and we were able to access our car when we forgot something in it.It has limited food choices, and the people at the coffee bar are quite slow, but other than that, there are no real complaints. It is right next to a shopping center, which has many options for both food and stores. It felt relatively safe, and we had no problem coming in late at night.They had live music in the evening, and the sound carries up to the fifth floor, where we were staying, but we were able to fall asleep anyway (we were working on a 6 hour ahead time difference). We had a balcony, but the view was of a parking lot. So, that was a little disappointing. As an FYI, the concierge work on commission. They helped to organize our trip to Pearl Harbor- which was convenient, but overall not worth the cost. Richard was awesome with getting us info and giving recommendations.Pool is good for a city pool. You could sign out towels to take to the beach.Overall, I would say this was a good place to go.

Nice hotel near restaurants and shops - connected to an outdoor mall (the outdoor malls with designer shops are endless in Wakik}. This hotel is accessed by an escalator/elevator from the street level/ Near bus stop and about a 10minute walk to beach. The open air lounge and bar area was nice to have coffee in the morning or a drink by fire pit at night. Servers were friendly and attentive! We did bot hang at pool but were able to check out beach towels to bring to beach. View was city view with a glimpse of Diamondback and water. Wish there was a coffee maker in room. Welcome basket was a nice touch with flip flops for me and my husband, a bag of chips, two bottles of water and chocolate. the non-sugarless gum and rubber ducky were cute but not useable. Also liked that robes were provided.

Our family of 4 just returned from our first family Oahu trip. We stayed in 2 king beds room on 14th floor. The two kind bed are great, but the desk is just too small, since my husband and I need to work at night time. Asked Hotel for bigger room, but they only replied they already gave us the room that can fit us. Other than that we have fairly good stay with the hotel. The front desk staff, housecleaning, and restaurant staff are friendly and smiley, and the beds are comfortable. If the price is right, we will visit again!

We returned for our 2nd visit, this time bringing our teenage sons. We stayed for 10 days in the corner suite - 1 King, queen day sleep sofa and twin sleeper sofa. It was more than adequate and we were on the 14th floor with views of the mountains behind Waikiki. Having two balconies meant we could chase the sun! Housekeeping was slow (sometimes 4pm) but we were never bothered, when they missed our room, they remedied it immediately. We were always able to get a poolside seat, and yes the pool is small - but you are one block from the most beautiful beach! We love the live music every evening, and the staff are always super friendly and helpful. We love that is is set a block back from the madness of the beach, and even though the hotel was full, it never felt chaotic and we never waited long for a lift. Welcome baskets are lovely, and the decor makes this one of our favourite hotels worldwide.

Our family of 4 (two teens 15 & 18) just returned from an 8 night stay at the Laylow & would definitely recommend this hotel to others. We prefer small boutique hotels and absolutely loved the mid century design & Hawaiian theme of the Laylow. Our room was a decent size & the two king beds were perfect. Although the Laylow is not beachfront, it is a very short walk to the beach. We had a room on the 14th floor which did have a slight view of the ocean from the balcony which was nice. We found all of the staff to be very friendly and helpful. Sheena at the bar especially stands out. She made a point of introducing herself, asking our names etc. After that first night, she always greeted us with a friendly smiled, asked about our day and remembered what we preferred to drink. She was great, The only negative I would mention was that our room was never cleaned before 4pm and on two nights we had to request towels so that we could shower & get ready for dinner. One of those nights our room did not get cleaned at all because we had to put the do not disturb sign on the door so that we could get ready for dinner. When the room was cleaned, it was done well. No complaints about the cleanliness, just would have preferred that it was done during the day while we were out exploring the island.

This was my family’s 2nd time at The Laylow and we are big fans. The location is great. It’s at the center of everything in Waikiki and just one block from the beach. We like the boutique feel of The Laylow over the larger beach resorts. That said, although the location is amazing, your room won’t have a great view. We spend so little time in our room that the view is a non issue. We like the cute decor, the fun welcome basket, daily shaved ice, the nightly music, and the pool (which is tiny) but great for our small kids. I also love that the lobby is elevated from the street which makes the hotel feel like even more of an oasis from the Waikiki crowds. If you’re looking for a smaller Waikiki option- this is a great one! Will stay at The Laylow again!
user_name:
rckchlk
New York City, New York

review_body: Awesome newer hotel, I believe it just re-opened about two years ago. This Hotel has an amazing vibe! It feels like vacation from the moment you step of the escalator to the lobby. Boutique style 16 story hotel. Awesome pool area with the most comfortable lounge chairs that I have ever seen at a hotel. Free mocktails for an hour and free snow cones for an hour by the pool daily. Awesome friendly staff, especially Kimberly C at the front desk and Lindsey at the "Hideout." The Hideout serves up friendly food and drinks all day in a relaxed indoor/outdoor setting. The food and service are awesome. No need to leave the Resort, except to walk three blocks to the beach or one block to the International Marketplace. Awesome young vibe at this hotel and I will be back for sure.

It’s a nice, modern hotel. I love the fact that it’s centrally located. The hotel offers two pairs of nice flip flops to take home which was nice. The only down side is that the pool was small. Overall, it was a nice stay for us.

I have stayed at the Laylow several times in the last year. It seems at checkout I continue to have issues with my bill. The first time I accounted it to a careless error, however after the fourth visit with errors at checkout, I have to be a little more critical. Ms M, the manager at checkout was unsympathetic. Last time at Laylow for me.Example: I asked for a late 4pm checkout and was told it was guaranteed, but as I came back to my room at 3:30 to take a late shower, I was told that my room now was occupied by a new guest and housekeeping had cleaned my room at 2:45pm. I guess Titanium membership has little meaning to the Laylow

Everything about The Laylow is fun! From the moment the cab drops you at the valet, you feel welcomed! Service, is stellar! I love the escalator up to checkin. It’s like leaving your travel day behind you as you are elevated to another level. Most importantly the warm ohana feeling the staff greats you with is impressive. In an era of low unemployment, I think hotels have suffered an apathy that is palpable with the most staff. Not here, they are attentive, interactive and actually offer service! We were very impressed having traveled extensively for work, and pleasure it was refreshing.This is a reflection of good management, it is a a general manager who is engaged and focused on guest experience and his/her staff as well. So well done! We stayed in a corner king and the room was FANTASTIC! Lots of room. It is in the heart of Waikiki just a block from the beach and right on the main drag. Saltwater pool is relaxing and on the main level. This high rise building it is not without views but Waikiki is dense. The upper floor where we were offers an espresso machine and am croissants. We loved that. Shopping, dining and easy access to all thing Honolulu are right out the door. This is a must stay location. Had we known how great this place was, we would have booked a whole week here and not gone to the North Shore. We liked the mix of clients here too. Families, couples, hipsters, and business travelers alike. Breakfast was great and the wait staff was fabulous. Loved the bar and nightly music. Their cocktails were creative, unique and FUN!!!! We started every night out there and then ventured to a nearby restaurant for dinner. Loved the Guacomami it is a perfect appetizer. We will be back. Aloha and Mahalo for a great stay!

Had the opportunity to stay in this great hotel in the heart of Waikiki. Conveniently located around an abundance of shops and restaurants and along a transit route. Free Wi-Fi at hotel, nice pool and gym and complimentary shaved ice every day at 1 pm as well. There’s also an in house cafe and restaurant. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Would definitely go back.

What an awesome find in Waikiki. The Laylow was exactly what we were looking for: clean, hip (but not pretentious), laid back, centrally located and friendly. The food at the Hideout (restaurant downstairs) was great. The bar offered the perfect space for relaxing with a nice cocktail after a long day. The front desk, concierge, pool and valet staff were so friendly, professional and accommodating. I did a lot of research before my stay and I'm SO excited I decided to choose The Laylow. Tips:- Mobile check in if you have an early flight and increase the chances that your room will be ready when you arrive. - If you are headed to the beach, check in with the valet to see if they have any umbrellas available that other guests have left behind.

I really liked this hotel, its definitely Hawaii decorated, but in a modern twist kind of way. The pool is very pretty and again modern, but surrounded by lots of palms and greenery, great place to hang and tan and have drinks. I had 5 days of relaxation here, and although the hotel is busy, I was able to unwind and was not disturbed. The location is really good, but not right in the middle of the busy and loud stuff. On another note, the rooms are immaculate, plus the staff is friendly and helpful.

We stayed here two days to check out Waikiki. It was a return to Oahu for two of us who worked here for the World Football League in 1974. Quite obviously, it was not the same area. It has grown in one direction—upward!There is nothing wrong with the LayLow, except it does not feel like one is visiting Hawaii. Our room was the latest, great bathroom, comfy beds. But view was of other high-rises. Hotel is deluxe in every way but jammed into the high-rise city. The. open-air restaurant on 2nd floor was super. Great for breakfast. Pool on same floor was never used by us.Service was outstanding. Hotel is next to the modernized International Marketplace. Too far from the beach! Standing on Kuhio downstairs, I estimated that 8 of every 10 passersby were Asian.

My fiance and I stayed here last spring for a weekend staycation. It's a litter pricier than some other boutique hotels in Waikiki, but its worth the price! We stayed in a corner King suite and it was super spacious, had 2 balconies, which let in a lot of light. There was a dining nook so you don't have to eat on the bed or day bed and the bathroom/shower are roomy. The king bed was super comfy and the room was decorated with really nice post-modern furniture. I really liked the random books in our room, one which stands out was the Hawaiian Survival Handbook. The welcome basket had great snacks and cute slippers to wear to the pool! They also have a mini-fridge and refill the bottled water daily. It's a great location, right next to international market place, and walking distance to other great shops/eateries. The Hideout had great food and drinks. It's just a cute place to hang out and have lunch or dinner and they offer room service too. We visit the PNW a lot, so stoked that they serve Stumptown coffee here!The staff was great, really welcoming and treated us great. Really helped us feel like we were on vacation and not just getting away for the weekend. I can't wait to stay here again!

I’ve stayed in this hotel 5 times. It’s a great boutique hotel. Excellent location and great rates for locals. The staff is super friendly and go above & beyond to please. While the pool may seem small to some I find it the perfect place to relax and unwind. It’s closed to shops & restaurants and Waikiki Beach is a few steps away. I’ve stayed in other hotels in waikiki and gotta tell you the Laylow has nothing to envied those big hotels along Kalakaua Ave. Will stay here again soon!!

I was here for a few nights for jet lag reasons on my return to the US from New Zealand. The Laylow is on Kuhio, a block away from the craziness of Kalanianaole, but still a convenient walk the craziness, if you wish. Contemporary mid-century design. Beautiful, but small, pool area. Good restaurant with an interesting breakfast menu. Excellent service - Kaitlin made sure I had a kettle and some teabags to help with my cold and Richard is a personable and knowledgeable concierge. I was in a room that faced a parking garage, not the pool, but I suspect it was quieter. The only noise issue I had was slamming doors very early. My room on the 7th floor was next to a storage type closet which seemed to get a lot of use in the early hours. I would give 5 stars except for two important reasons: my mattress was very uncomfortable - little back support - needs replacing. And it has been a long time since I stayed in a hotel that did not have a coffee tray setup in my room. Waking up with a back ache AND no coffee was problematic. I would still recommend the Laylow for the service and location.

Visited The Laylow to listen to the great music of Simple Souls. They are the best local band!! The area where they play is in the bar - an OK area, but the drink and food menu is crazy EXPENSIVE - $18 for a beer (it wasn't a bud light obviously...). Do try their mini pineapple upside down cakes - they were yummy.

Cute little hotel tucked away in the heart of Waikiki! Upon check in, we were greeted by Ashley at the Front Desk. She was very professional and exemplified the true meaning of the ALOHA spirit! Our check in was a smooth process and she even gave us a complimentary upgrade when she found out we were celebrating a special occasion. Will definitely be returning. Thank you again Ashley for the outstanding customer service!!

This is our first time staying at Laylow and it will not be the last. The hotel is pet friendly, the front desk personnel are very helpful and accommodating. The housekeeping ladies assigned to our room namely Amor and Charlie made sure our room was clean and very thorough in their work. We will definitely be back to stay at Laylow.

We had a great time at this hotel and a lot of it had to do with the staff throughout the hotel. The front desk people were so nice but it didn’t stop there. Everyone we encountered was wonderful. We had a Junior suite which was very nice. It had a very comfortable bed and a couple of small lanai’s. Loved the small refrigerator. We didn’t have a view but we were close to a lot of really great shops and restaurants. . Easy access to the beach about a block and a half away and a lovely pool area that’s equally fun at night as it is in the day. The restaurant is amazing! We had flat bread, a spinach salad and some amazing pineapple dessert. I felt very comfortable at the hotel and everyone made us feel like we were at home. Lots of great branding throughout the hotel. Mahalo and we’ll be back!

We really had a wonderful time at The Laylow. The place is picture perfect - every corner is beautifully styled with lush plants, unique art and paintings, and modern design. When we arrived, the concierge was super helpful in getting us checked in, noticed we were SPG members, and kindly upgraded us to a room on the 16th floor. This was preferable to us over a room by the pool, as it was higher up, less rowdy from the bar and pool noise, and the floor had complimentary coffee, water, and snacks. This was perfect because the mornings came with a pastry or a ham and cheese croissant, and evenings had cookies!The rooms are beautiful and comfortable, the furniture was well kept in great condition. We also loved the toiletries including the soap and hair product in the bathrooms, we were tempted to take the leftovers home! The only drawback here was the loud air unit in the room - most nights this was fine, but a couple of nights it kept us up with a whirring and whistling sound which was quite annoying. We would absolutely stay at the Laylow again, however, I think I would be sure to request a room without the noisy air unit, and I think that if they had more incentive to welcome guests to the Hideout - say, with a happy hour or a complimentary bev upon arrival - it would have been perfect. I also wouldn't count on renting a car, as it was quite expensive to valet the car overnight...$45/night!

What a great little hotel. Close to everything in Waikiki. All within walking distance. Beach was a nice 10 min walk. It has a Nice little saltwater lap pool and a funky rooftop type bar and eating area. Had a wonderful poke bowl and guacamole dish. Drinks were good, as was the food.

Ashley at the front desk was AMAZING and made our stay pleasant. When we checked in she was so kind. I called the hotel a few days in advanced and spoke with Ashley, I advised her we would be celebrating me and my fiancés anniversary.We were so surprised to check in to our room and find flowers arranged in a heart with a note wishing us a nice stay, also a bottle of wine.Aside from that the Laylow offers guests a welcome goodie box that included Laylow slippers and some local favorites from taro chips, to HICHEW candies. Our room was very nice, we booked a Cabana room which is located on the main floor of the hotel. I was surprised at how quiet the room was especially as we were a few feet away from the pool. I really liked how close we were to the pool/restaurant/coffee shop. Thank you Ashley again for your genuine Hawaiian Hospitality, I would definitely recommend this hotel and will be returning again, hopefully very soon!!!

My husband and I stayed at the Laylow for 5 nights. It has a great location, centrally located near many restaurants, bars and shops. The room was clean and very modern. The staff was friendly and even let us borrow beach chairs. Would highly recommend and stay here again the next time we are in Honolulu!

If noise an issue for you don't take room under 10 floor. East and west parking garages have noisy exhaust fans up to this height . Restaurant food good, staff excellent. Front staff very good, very helpful. Lovely pool area.

Always enjoy staying at the Laylow. They are very focused on the customer and work hard to please their guests. The HideOut is an excellent restaurant and the bar is relaxing with great service. Love the retro decor and rooms. While it isn’t on the beach, all of the other amenities and services make it an excellent alternative to beach hotels. The beach is only a few blocks away.

As a frequent traveller to Marriott hotels worldwide .. I have come to expect Autograph Collection hotels to be beautiful, but the service can be really frosty and snobbish. But not here - the team are absolutely outstanding and are a true credit to the Marriott affiliations. Justin on the bar remembered us 3 nights in a row, the team on the coffee kiosk friendly and helpful & the front desk team were all outstanding. Shout out to Richard (?) the concierge who welcomed us to Waikiki and booked us tours & gave advice on the neighbourhood. The tours were great - we did the Pearl Harbour & Boat trip/snorkel - they seem expensive but are worth every penny. Richard also personally helped us out when the tour company missed our pickup & reimburses the taxi costs to us which was really appreciated. An absolutely awesome stay as part of our honeymoon, primarily down to the efforts & ‘approachableness’ of the team - many many thanks. Wish we could come back soon!Anthony, Manchester UK

This hotel is in the middle of bustling Waikiki, about a 5 min. walk away from the closest beach access path and next to shops, convenience stores and restaurants. Our family of four, including two young adult sons, stayed for a week in a corner suite on the 10th floor facing Kuhio Ave. The room is comfortable and large enough for four people. It has two large king beds and two day beds which are a great plus to have, as is the sitting area with a small table and chairs. A small fridge came in handy to store some food for breakfast and snacks. The bathroom is a bit on the small side and it has a sliding door that in our room did not close well. You should prepare for very soft mattresses on the king beds. If this doesn’t bother you, you will be very comfortable. The daybeds have firm and hard mattresses, which I preferred. Also, prepare for some noise coming from the bar on Friday and Saturday nights, as there is a DJ until 12 AM whose music we could hear up to the 10th floor. However windows close well and sound insulation is good, noise coming from the avenue or otherwise should not bother you. The air conditioning equipment was probably a bit old, as it sometimes made some strange noises. We did not use the pool. It's rather small, about 15 meters long x 4 meters wide and it gets little sun because of the buildings. Housekeeping was fine, the room was neat and tidy, and they responded quickly whenever we asked for something. Finally, staff at reception were very friendly and helpful. I would especially like to thank Rachel and Joey, who were very attentive to my requests. At some point I mentioned that we were there to celebrate my birthday, and on that day a card and cupcakes were waiting in our room when we got back from our daily trekking, which I found a friendly gesture!

Had always wanted to stay at the Laylow and had the opportunity for a 1 night staycation. Had visited previously to try their restaurant the "Hideout" and previous to that when it was the Aqua Waikiki Wave (lived at the Wave for a month!) I give it a solid thumbs up but with some quirks. Stand out of the stay was dealing with Hokulani (Hoku) at the front desk. She was super nice, super accommodating, and hooked us up. She was super professional also as I saw her deal with a "challenging" customer and Hoku was calm, collected, and extremely professional through out the encounter!Pros of the Laylow:Nicely decorated room, improved fitness room, great room amenities including gift basket with slippers, snacks, and bathroom stuff, 15th floor cappuccino machine and snack bar/breakfast bar was great (thanks Hoku!), 1pm complimentary shave, complimentary non-alcoholic drinks poolside, evening firepits, fruit and cookies around the hotel, and friendly staff. Pretty good poolside food (from the Hideout); ok foir Waikiki Prices. Cons of the Laylow:Being that it's a Marriot brand, A LOT of kids at the pool. And the pool is not that big. If you want peace and quite you will not get it at the pool. Go early if you want the loungers at the pool but of course in February the sun won't hit the pool till noon. Poolside service a bit slow so catch the servers when you can. "Interesting" layout to the room (funny corners, funny lighting, and obstructed view if you want to watch TV from the bed). No coffee machine but we were on the 15th floor where there was one on our floor (thanks again Hoku!)But the room was spacious, two balconies, I didn't hear the elevators from the bathroom (our room was right beside the elevator), VERY comfy bed and spacious bathroom. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and glad we gave the Laylow a try! In the heart of Waikiki and next to the best Happy Hour in Waikiki: Basalt.Definitely worth a stay at the Laylow. Thanks for everything Hokulani! Really appreciate it!

If you’ve ever wanted to just drop yourself in the middle of a Waikiki then The Laylow Autograph Collection is your place. Staying here you are by so many businesses that are in walking distance and that saves you time because traffic is horrible. The service is great the hospitality is wonderful and the staff is very considerate and always looking to extend a helping hand.

Excellent location, wonderful staff and comfortable beds. We stayed for a few rainy days so the only drawback was it nor being pools weather (the pools still looked great though). The rooms are nicely decorated. This place feels as luxurious as a big resort but smaller and more personal.

Housekeepers Reilyn and Charlie were the best!!!! the hotel is clean and the property is beautiful. The hotel staff are very accommodating, pleasant and friendly. Everyone staff is helpful. The food in this hotel especially breakfast is very tasty.

We were a bit disappointed in this property compared to what was displayed on the website. While we had a high floor With a partial view of the ocean, we looked down onto the rooftop of a parking lot. On the other hand, the staff were more than helpful in addressing our concerns. The casual on property restaurant also offered tasty meals.

As a business traveler on a per diem, I found this hotel a good place to stay in Waikiki. Not on the beach but definitely in the heart of Waikiki and walkable to the area. The rooms are roomy, cleaned well, and have small balconies. The little extras on the exec floors for frequent rewards members (Marriott Total Rewards) are a nice add-on for those on the move. The bar was a nice area to get morning coffee and eggs and log on for a little email and work. The resort charge is mandatory — not pleasant, as what it gets you gives diminishing returns: you only get the gift basket once and pool usage was rare. Valet parking is the way to go. Like everything in Waikiki, the hotel, food, and parking were more expensive than you’d find in other places.

We were in need of a last-minute reservation (whole Waikiki was pretty much fully booked due to some big conferences in town). Everything about our stay exceeded our expectations! So friendly, informative and attentive reception personnel! The room was big, spacious and tastefully decorated, the balcony overlooking both the mountains to the right and the sea to the left. Really lovely touch with the complementary snacks and greeting card. Spacious bathroom with plenty of towels. Loved the shower (rain shower with some other water flow functions, wonderful)! They have apparently ukulele lessons Mon/Wed/Fri when we stayed there, and everyone could take the ukulele from their room to the lesson. Loved the pool area, and the sunbeds placed halfway in the water, as well as the usual sunbeds! Sunny there the bigger part of the day. There was a live ukulele music performance in the evening, the outside terrace-bar was amazing! We also made us of the concierge services where Gaby was fantastic at helping us accommodate our wishes and answer our questions. She was knowledgeable about our are of questions, gave us many local tips as well as suggestions for traveling around the island. We got help of Gaby with booking a dance-dinner performance. She was kind enough to take us through everything we needed to know, and more. Shout out to you, Gaby! Keep up the great work :)All in all, we loved our stay at this boutique hotel, and are definitely recommending it highly!

Hotel upgraded us to a corner room with 2 balconies overlooking downtown. Welcome basket that contained flip flops, post cards, chocolate, gum, island chips, and a rubber ducky was a nice touch upon arrival. Staff was very courteous and hooked us up with fun things to do around the island. We were also given vouchers to use on meals at the Hideout across from the lobby. Pool area very classy and relaxing. Some say the pool was too small, but hey, you're a block from the most famous beach in the world. Theres tons of shops, eateries, and places nearby to get cheap drinks. Would happily stay at this hotel again! Thank you Lay Low for making our first trip to the island one to remember!

Good location. Walking distance to the beach. Plenty of shops and eateries nearby.Nice pool area albeit small.Rooms are decorated beautifully. New and modern. Bathroom were clean and modern.Loved the welcome basket with the flip flops. Free breakfast was basic (croissant, coffee and juice) but a nice touch.Really liked the overall décor of the hotel and friendly staff but overall, we felt that the hotel was a little expensive for what you get. However, we really enjoyed staying at the hotel and a great alternative to all the massive chain hotels and the chaos of Waikiki.

I joined my friend who always stays here on business and I loved the ambiance and upscale feel of the hotel. The bar and restaurant is awesome with a great outdoor terrace. The food is spectacular along with the morning coffee bar. The pool is nice but small. It's not a place for kids, but upscale adults-which I like. One block from the beach and all the top hotels!! The staff is so friendly and professional too!

We were a group of 4 ladies enjoying 10 nights in Waikiki. The Laylow was a perfect & central spot for us to explore Waikiki. The hotel is well run, clean & modern. The pool was compact but comfortable & heated. I would highly recommend this hotel as the rooms were spacious & modern. The location was on Kuhio St right at The International Market Place. The bar also has a good happy hour.

Checked in and was upgraded to a corner room, as a platinum member we were given food vouchers for each day, it was nice to able to choose which meal we applied them too.The hotel is a block and half off the beach, but we were there to tour the island and do some site seeing, and the central location to shops restaurants made this a perfect location, and more affordable than beach front.Clean spacious rooms, modern and up to date with a mini fridge made this perfect for our vacation

We chose the Laylow for 1 night post cruise since we had already stayed closer to Waikiki Beach precruise. It is about 3 short blocks to the beach, in the busy shopping and dining area. A car is not necessary if you are staying in the Waikiki area, and the city bus and trolley can be easily accessed from the hotel. We arrived in the morning and were pleasantly surprised and ecstatic that we could check in early. There is an escalator, stairs or elevator to enter this hotel from street level. The lobby has a nice bar, coffee shop and pool. We were given a king size room on the 6th floor with a small balcony which looked onto a garage. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom had nice toiletries. There is a daily resort fee of $33.34 which included a welcome basket that included chips, 2 water bottles, small chocolate bar, 2 pairs of flip flops, and a small rubber duck, as well as nightly entertainment, shave ice (at 1p) , and ukulele lessons on certain days. The pool area is well done. It has a complimentary water dispenser with cups and fruit, cabanas in the shade as well as adjustable, cabana style beds in the sun, and lounge chairs in the pool. Cocktail waitress circle regularly if you want to buy drinks. This is a great hotel for couples, families or business. We would recommend it.

Booked a last min trip and opted for the junior suite for the space. Pros: good location albeit in the most touristy part of the island. The decor is chic and minimalistic. Cons: Desptie of the obvious no water shortage, this Marriott chain opted for the non adjustable water conservation shower head. This is my biggest pet peeve.. Nothing worst then taking a shower w pressure of a 70 year old man's bladder w an enlarged prostate!! nitpick: despite paying the premium rate through the hotel website, they stuck me right next to the elevator so I had the pleasure of listening to the elevator door 24/7....ding... ding....'ding...

Our family really enjoyed our stay at The Laylow. Centrally located and near everything that we needed. Great restaurants nearby. Nice spacious room and the staff was very friendly. We enjoyed the shave ice while playing at the pool. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.

This is my new Go-to hotel when staying in Waikiki. This hotel is not on the water, but it is in a great location and has a really good vibe. The staff have always been kind and attentive to my every need. I have stayed at this property at least 10 nights since June 2018.Big shouts to Sheila at the Front Desk. Sheila was so sweet and attentive after having endured a tongue lashing from a Guest who was never going to be satisfied. She was very helpful in getting me the room I wanted and making me feel welcome.Pros: Good location! Front Desk staff is efficient and friendly. Valet staff is fast! Fun pool scene! Excellent outside bar area! Very hip! Everything the W brand struggles to be!Cons: Coffee in the lobby is WAY too expensive! (Go next door for a cup of Kona blend at half the price.). No in-room coffee makers. Actually, a hotel branded in The Autograph Collection should have basic complimentary morning coffee service in the lobby. They measure the alcohol at the bar. (I just find that so NOT classy!). Location: Its on Kuhio Avenue, which has crime issues late at night. You just need to have good situational awareness when walking around this area of Waikiki. RESORT FEES! I hate resort fees! I find that such an insulting rip-off. This property should include the cost of value added amenities into the nightly rates. In the case of The Laylow, I am not quite sure what that extra $20.00 daily gets me, since this is a conventional city hotel by all standards and not a resort.
user_name:
alternateview
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The check in service was fast and the front staff was welcoming. Our room was very clean! When we requested for additional towels the housekeeping staff was fast in bringing it up in our room. They are friendly and courteous. My son loves swimming in the heated pool even though we were there in a rainy weather. We love our stay in this hotel and can't wait for the next time we can come back.

The decor is full on island Mid Century Modern - super cool! The staff was so helpful and pleasant. Everyone there made us feel so welcome it was hard to leave. My husband only wants to stay at this hotel for all of our visits to Waikiki. We had a room on the executive level so there were snacks, light meals and drinks available.Definitely recommend the Laylow.

Let me start this review by saying I have stayed at other Autograph properties before coming here and came into this with certain expectations. That aside, the inside of the hotel is beautifully done although quite quaint. I did like how this property is a bit tucked away off Kuhio ave but yet smack dab in the middle of Waikiki; kind of gives it it's "lawlow" feel. We got a Deluxe Corner Suite and were given the corner of the hotel facing Kuhio ave and the parking garage next to the pool. The room itself is BEAUTIFUL. They really have done a wonderful job with these rooms compared to what this hotel used to be. If this hotel was somewhere tucked away on the beach and a little bigger, it would be HEAVEN. This room had a very comfortable king bed, a queen daybed (essentially your couch), a little reading corner of sorts, and two balconies. The one thing that shocked me about this room was the bathroom. It was TINY and just standard shower, sink, and a toilet. Most properties would not have a "Delux Corner Suite" that's just got a standard hotel bathroom, let alone a tiny one. The Hideaway (the on-property restaurant and bar and cafe). This place is excellent. The food is amazing. Chicken Satay and Kalua pig egg rolls were some of our favorites. Even the service is great; very warm and welcoming but also on top of things. Bartenders are very friendly and knowledgeable in their craft. Drinks were great. My parters favorite drink is a "pain killer" and she mentioned they were pretty darn good. BONUS: it's on their happy hour menu. They also have nightly music. We were only there a few days mid-week so we go the live music vibe. On Thursdays-Saturdays they have live DJ's. The woman who was singing while we were there was AMAZING. Hey voice was powerful, on key, and the song choices were perfect for the lowkey vibe of the hideaway. Overall, this part of the hotel is on point. The pool is...well... small... This part is SO hard to review because you can tell they really tried. I mean it looks quite beautiful for what/where it is but it's tiny. The water went up to about waste high to me in the deep end and I'm about 5'9". It also is right next door to a massive garage that's got some pretty loud fans coming from it that you can help but notice their humming sound in the background. There also surprisingly isn't much of a pool service. They do come around every once in a while but if you want a drink you just need to take a short walk over to the bar to order your drink. Some positives are the in-pool chairs that are always awesome to relax in. There are about 9 day beds and some chairs on the side of the pool, with two "cabanas' at the end. Everything is first come first serve so if you want your pool time you've got to snag your spot. You can't reserve anything (believe me I tried). There is a massive building that towers over the pool so for a few hours during afternoon the pool is in complete shade followed by about another hour of sun, then it disappears behind the next building. So, again it's really hard to review because it's just the location in this case, not much to do with the grounds or staff or anything else. I did have a couple issues with house keeping. When we checked in to our suite, there was a dirty diaper just sitting on the floor. Kind of gross. We called down and they had someone come up. What surprised me was that we did not get the vibe that they were sorry there was a nasty dirty diaper left in our suite. Just came up, grabbed it, and left. Our second night we planned an amazing dinner at a local stake house. I highly recommend stopping at Mortons to anyone whose hungry for amazing steak. Anyway, when we got back from the pool to get ready for dinner the room wasn't cleaned ( we were gone from about (12:00pm-5pm and yes we did take the do not disturb sign off when we left). So, I called down and they said they would send somebody up. We left and went for a walk and came back about 45 minutes later as we were really pressed for time at this point. The house keeper literally just came in made the bed, and replaced towels. Didn't clean a single thing or take out any of the trash or room service items from the morning. Again, we were in the "Delux corner suite". I actually went downstairs to make their manage aware of this, she did apologize and offered to make it right by sending someone up but by that point I just was over it and wanted to spend time in the room. Over all this location has some great highs but it certainly has it's limitations. The staff are all great, the food is awesome and reasonable price, drinks are fantastic, pool is cool and hip but just in bad location, and the rooms are beautiful. Only thing that keeps it from being "Very good" is just the limitations of the property because of it's location and quaintness.

First time in Hawaii, and so glad we picked The Laylow. This is right in the middle of Waikiki, close to shops, restaurants, the beach, etc. The hotel itself is updated and our room was very clean, spacious, and comfortable. We loved the pool as well, right off the lobby with available food and drink service from Hideout - which also gave us a fantastic dinner (and the best Mai Tai I had on the island). Above all, management and staff from The Laylow and Hideout were so helpful and aware. Kelly gave great recommendations for everything to do around the area. When we return, we're staying here!

Great hotel, very cool vibe. close to shops and short walk to beach. Great rooms, pool Is on the small side and often in shade but apart from that it has really good facilities. Kym the manager is awesome .Definitely worth the stay!

The Laylow is a unique property in the middle of all the action in Honolulu. Our 14th floor room was spectacular, with plenty of space and great views. We really enjoyed the live entertainment at the Hideout each evening, the food was excellent and the employees were very helpful.

We returned for our second visit to the LayLow in December 2018. Once again, the stay was awesome. The room was great, and the service was outstanding. The entire staff made us feel very special. We were especially impressed with their attention to detail. Everything from the welcome basket in our room, helpful concierge, and very attentive parking staff help make this a great place to stay in Waikiki. Will definitely return as soon as we can.

This time i was really misled by nice pictures and positive TA reviews when choosing the hotel. The biggest disappointment was the pool area. - the pool is tiny and it is surrounded by big concrete buildings, one of them being a car parking house, in summary not much vacation atmosphere at all. Only a few sunbeds around the pool and even those are not movable to catch the few moments of sunshine when it happens to get into the pool area between the big concrete blocks... The car parking house next to the pool area creates a big noise, disturbing both during day time and especially in the night (couldn’t sleep with open windows because of that). On the positive - the rooms were fine and the service was fine, no complaints about that, just they cannot compensate the disadvantages of the property itself.You could possibly consider this hotel when travelling with children and for some reason want to avoid larger hotels on the beach. While the pool is tiny, it could still fit a couple of kids (and it mostly was occupied by kids) and the kids usually don’t care that much about the surroundings. Also, you could consider this hotel, if you don’t want to spend any time on pool or beach, otherwise it would clearly make sense to choose one of the beachfront hotels. However, considering a large number of positive reviews, there must be a market segment for this hotel as well, even if i don’t quite get it.

The hotel is a gem of mid-century modern design and decor. It appears to be recently redone and is in immaculate shape. The staff is very helpful and nice. The gift basket in the room was a very nice touch, as was the shave-ice in the afternoons. The food at the bar/restaurant was outstanding and the prices were reasonable for the area. Overall, I would highly recommend the Laylow!

I wrote a very negative review last year, but gave the hotel another try after being contacted by management and urged to give them another chance. This stay was superb. Just to give an idea of the changes, last time Marriott's 4pm late checkout guarantee for elites wasn't recognized at all, even when taking up the issue with a manage. This time, I was proactively asked if I needed late checkout when I checked in. More generally, the hotel was very new last time, and the staff seemed far better trained this time. The room we received was excellent for our family of five, it's preferable to get a room on a higher floor if you can. The hotel breakfast is excellent, even if the $30 voucher for two for elites still won't quite cover it for most, I believe the menu at least makes that possible. The pool is small, but adequate for a family looking to splash around a bit, and the free shave ice at 1 and frozen grapes at 4 were much appreciated. The location is really excellent, right near many restaurants, shops, a Long's Drug Store, booths selling Hawaii tchachkas in the alley, food trucks, and even a McDonald's if the kids are sick of "local" food, but still close to the beach. There is a very popular and reasonably priced udon restaurant across the street, though we weren't fond of the food. The only two criticism I have is that the music downstairs, while ending reasonably early, might disturb guests who have just arrived from the mainland or Asia and are not yet on Hawaii time in their sleep schedule. Also, whomever designed the hotel should have provided for more than 2 elevators, they are always busy and when, like last year, one is out of service, it's a disaster. Hawaii rental cars are pricey, and the hotel charges $40 for parking, so we found it was cheaper and more efficient to get around by Uber and taxi (Uber was actually usually more expensive than taxis in most places, and unlike in most places minivan taxis that fit five are plentiful).

Nice enough as mid-price/mid-luxury options go in Honolulu. The staff were soooo Aloha! Right smack dab in the middle of the Waikiki chaos, if you’re into that kind of thing . Only real glitch was check-in - they did NOT have rooms ready by check in time even for elite status members. Might’ve been because of the holidays but the poor staff were left to placate the weary guests and management was nowhere to be seen. Next time offer free double espresso half decaf skim yak’s milk/soy lattes or whatever... AT LEAST!
user_name:
RTinNYC
New York City, New York

review_body: I stayed here on New Year's Eve because as you may know, Hawaii turns into a war zone with all the illegal fireworks being set off in the neighborhoods. I have a dog and as you dog owners know, dogs hate fireworks. So I think the expense of getting a hotel room at a pet friendly hotel in Waikiki for one night is worth it as I personally do not think it is a good idea to sedate my dog. I do realize because of the holiday the room rate was exorbitant, but it was a worthwhile expense for my dog. I have stayed in pet friendly hotels in the past and this hotel's pet policy is pretty easy. You don't have to notify them ahead of time that you will be bringing a pet. Pretty much any pet is welcome as long as the weight does not exceed 50 lbs and its one pet per room. There is a $150 pet fee per stay. So if you stay one day or 7 days its the same fee. I always book hotels on the hotels website, never through travel websites, this is to reduce the chances of them messing up the reservation. So in this case, there was no mysterious "lost" reservations. I made the reservation back in September and their cancellation policy was absolute, no refund at all for canceling, period, it didn't matter how far in advance you cancel. Understandable since it was a holiday weekend. I also compared prices with other pet friendly hotels and they were pretty much around the same price.Checking in was pretty simple, there was a line when we entered the lobby at about 3:15pm and more people lined up behind us. There were three people (max amount) working at the front desk and they were doing their best to keep up. The wait was about 15-20 minutes, check in was pretty usual and simple even with the dog. There was a lady passing out skewers of fresh pineapple to the people who were waiting. The woman who checked us in explained everything to us well and we were headed up to our room in another 15 minutes. I overheard some other guests complaining about how long the elevators take, but I did not feel that the wait for them was out of the ordinary. There were only two elevators and stairs that were easily accessible. The common areas were clean and neat even when it was a rush in the lobby. I did not make use of any of the hotels facilities or services other than the valet parking which is $39 per day.I no longer feel it necessary to stay awake until midnight to celebrate bringing in the new year. I pretty much planned to be in bed and asleep by 10pm. That worked out according to plan. That would have not been possible either if I stayed at home as people set off fireworks well into the wee hours of the morning. We went out to dinner, left the dog in the room, came back and she was there cuddled up in my bathrobe that I left on the bed. The hotel gives you a sign to hang on the door notifying anyone outside in the hallway that there is a pet in the room. I took a nice relaxing shower got into the bed and promptly fell asleep, we did not even hear the fireworks show that they do in Waikiki every new years eve. I woke up at about 6am. The room was clean, comfortable and spacious. I got the standard room with two king beds in it. The bed and pillows were very comfortable. The room temperature did not have to be adjusted at all while we were there, it remained at a steady comfortable temperature during the day and night time. The room was on the third floor with a balcony that had two chairs on it and there was a pretty crappy view, but I wasn't there for the view. I am not sure if they designate specific floors or rooms to guests with pets, I did not ask. The bathroom only had a shower in it, no tub. I like that there was no tub.
