The shower was sizable and had sliding glass doors that covered the whole shower from wall to wall which was great because I hate those showers that have the half door on them. There was a small refrigerator, no coffee machine or kettle that I noticed. They had a basket with flip flops for use and some snacks and bottles of water. There was no indication that they charged you for it so I believe it was all complimentary. We drank the water, but did not use anything else. They gave us a card that allowed us $50 credit on activities in the hotel but we did not use it.The employees that I did interact with were professional and friendly and I did not have a problem with any of them. I believe if you have the pet sign hanging on the door housekeeping does not enter the room, you have to take the pet with you if you want the room cleaned. We only stayed one night so it really didn't matter.I would stay here again specifically to be able to bring a pet with me, though I feel it would be a good choice to stay without a pet and for a longer stay. The hotel is pretty centrally located in Waikiki and walking distance to many restaurants, bars and entertainment places. There are bus stops close by if you don't want to rent a car and taxis galore in Waikiki and of course Uber.

I stayed at this property over the holidays and it is ALWAYS my favorite hotel in Waikiki, the manager Ashley was awesome she even gave me her personalized list of to do’s around the island. I can’t wait to return !

I am a frequent traveler, and this place missed a few of the critical needs from my stand-point. The mini fridge did not have a freezer compartment. There was no microwave in the room, and also no laundry facilities other than coin-operated laundromat in the neighborhood. Also, while there was a pool, there was no jacuzzi. Room was smaller than other comparable hotels, and there was no covered foyer for temporarily parking and unloading. When we arrived, it was raining, and we had to unload our bags in the rain. The location was decent with lots of places to go by foot including the Waikiki beach.

Scam! This place is a Scam!!! Let's me start of by saying that I am a very frequent traveler. I have never been soo disappointed with a hotel in my life. 13 of us couples stayed at this hotel from dec 29- Jan 2nd at a 300% the regular rate due to the holidays. The min we got there we had issues, 1st they couldn't find our reservations, next they said the room ain't ready, keep on mind check in is at 3 and we got there 3:30... 10 out of the 13 couples had the same issue. We ended up eating at the hide out at the hotel which you can see my review for that as well... another 1 Star.... finally we got to room an hour or so later... they held on to our bags and when the bags arrived at the room my LV bag had random scratches on it that were not there before. The pool size was misleading from pictures all together. The next night we went out by the time we got back someone from room service came into the room and STOLE 2 rings that were made over 60 years ago... I had to file a police report but the hotel failed to even take this seriously. I even suggested for them to come to look through the room and our bags.... other couples which will post reviews soon will tell you about their room door being cracked open when they came back from New Year's Eve party which again makes no sense. The room service ladies walked into the room 4 times with out even knocking as rude as it gets. Room service stoped cleaning our room completely after I reported the stolen rings. No one from management even bother to reach out to me. This place is a motel 6 with a face lift at prices of major hotels that are beach front. What a joke... on top of it all they also stole a Gucci cologne but I didn't even care about that but that wasn't take seriously other. I am giving it a 1 Star and not a straight zero Bc the girl in the front desk Ashley has been really trying to help even though management clearly could of cared less. Note - there are thieves working here, room service will always get your order wrong, over priced and quality of food is trash. Management could care less you are spending 500$ a night.... no real costumer service. Next door to roof top which is load and will keep you up at night. You can see more about this at TripAdvisor in the next couple of days from all of my friends and you can see their reviews where somewhat similar. Don't do it, avoid the headache, any other hotel would of been better. I can't believe I lost a whole day of this vacation just between looking for the rings, filling up police / hotel reviews and dealing with all of this. Aka RUN AWAY AS FAST AS POSSIBLE, this place is a Scam! We didn’t have hot water for 2 days and the ceiling of the bathrooms were molded!!!

On the upside the property is centrally located & we could walk to most if not all the spots as well as the bus stops, it appears to be recently updated & the rooms were spacious with outstanding bathrooms. Extraordinary staff with special thanks to housekeeping & front desk. On the negative, while we were on the10th floor it was noisy, the elevators are extremely slow & we waited over 15 minutes on 2 occasions for the elevator to arrive, the garbage pickup every morning at 5:30am was not exactly the best wake-up call. It is expensive & with the tax (I know they can't control that but it was another 25% on top of the room rate) we were paying nearly $450 a night which in our opinion & based on our overall experience was not a good return on investment.

The hotel is well maintained, modern and the best staff you can find, the location is very good, close to beach and in center of Waikiki, The only problem is that most rooms have the multiple levels parking view. If I could get a room with a nice view, this hotel would be my first choice for future trips.

Room service in the restaurant had one great meal item. The wygu beef hamburger. It was delicious. Sampled it multiple times during our visit. Beyond that, the food menu is mediocre. The breakfast dishes are not appropriate for most tastes And limited to four Or five items, with no inclination for substitutions. There’s no cereal, oatmeal, Toast, rice, etc. that would appeal to many of their clients. Housekeeping left the room is immaculate every day. And they were very friendly when you met them in the hallway. The coffee barista‘s were also fabulous communicators. We’ll come back, but not plan on breakfast!

Convenient location, Sandwiched between the Intl Marketplace and Dukes Lane on Kūhiō Ave. Rooms were Euro-style, low platform beds. Bathrooms were spacious for a hotel room, with a walk-in all-glass shower. A nice welcome basket in our room filled with flip flops, taro chips, candy bar and bottles of water. Pool was small, long and narrow. Shave ice served in open air lobby every day at 1:00. Live music on weekends in the lobby area. However, the most difficult part was the inconsistent customer service. No option to store luggage, and valet at times were slow, even when we called ahead. Front desk staff service were inexperienced or maybe they didn’t care, sometimes nice, couldn’t figure out the invoice, and made no effort to fix the problems. The floor lamp light in our room was broken, reported it 3 times before maintenance came to room to say it couldn’t be fixed. No ceiling light, the only light was the small light next to bed. No offer to remedy the inconvenience ( and we were there for 7 days). For the category of this hotel, and as double Platinum, we expected better service.

We needed a hotel to house my traveling family of 9 until we got on a cruse the next day and we stayed at the Laylow. What a little gem! It was a very modern pretty open air hotel with a nice little bar. Our room was perfect for my 5 pple and my parents and sister stayed in another room that was your average room. Our room had a pull out bed, regular bed and sofa bed with a breakfast nook and two balconies. View was of the street but that was OK. My ONLY complaint is that coffee from the coffee bar is not complementary. I travel for work and even an the large hotels you can get a starter cup of coffee before you strike out to go get breakfast. That seemed petty as I really wanted a cup off brewed coffee. Conveniently, there is a Starbucks down the street as well as a food court which was great for dinner the night before. Its not on the beach, but we walked down to it and had some drinks while the kids played in the (freezing) water.

We loved the location of this hotel. In the heart of Waikiki, with a short 5 minute walk to the beach. Great restaurants and shopping all around. We especially loved the 2 king beds for our family of four (with two teen boys). It was perfect! The hotel pool was small, but awesome. The rooms were fresh and updated. Great customer service. We would definitely stay again!

Location was good, middle of downtown Waikiki however the staff and food were not of a 4 star hotel. Front desk staff was young and difficult and multiple times did not relay the request for my car to the valet. The all seemed inexperienced and in need of structure. I am a platinum marriott guest and expected more on the service end. Food on site was 2 star. Rooms were good and along the lines of the expectations.
user_name:
meister420
New York City, New York

review_body: Great hotel with very welcoming staff at front office and the bar/restaurant. The pool area looked great but was pretty busy most days and we were out and about at all the nearby shops, beaches and eateries. We did eat brekky here each day and one meal was ample for two. Drinks and nibbles in the evening were also very enjoyable. We had two adults and two teenagers in one room and with luggage but was cozy but we were only there to sleep. Beds and pillows were amazing. Beautiful shower although bathroom quite small for Four - but that was our choice. Would highly recommend for location and ambience.

Love the smaller scale of this Marriott property - fantastic location, we were able to walk to shopping, beach, and restaurants. Rooms were spacious, lobby was fresh and we enjoyed the live music in the lounge each evening. All employees were kind and eager to help. I definitely recommend this hotel!

Our trip to Hawaii was to be a once in a lifetime, lets start our retirement trip. We wanted to see a variety of sites/islands so we spent time on two islands in 3 different hotels. Ashley the Front Office Manager made our stay EXTRA special by acknowledging my lifetime Platinum Elite status and really taking care of us. The hotel while not on the waterfront was perfect for us to explore the city. They daily resort charge, which I really hate, actually gave you something vs other hotels which then charge you more for waterfront chairs, cabanas, etc. The daily music selection in the bar area was fabulous and Lindsey the bartender was super nice/interesting/accommodating. We walked the entire Honolulu area and enjoyed cooling off in the pool mid-afternoon. Being a boutique hotel it was not packed with families with kids and in general did not feel so crowded as other hotels. EXCELLENT couples getaway location IMO!

We have just arrived and have settled into this nice hotel. The hotel is very modern, clean, and trendy. The facilities are well kept and the hotel is centrally located. Upon arrival the valet greeted us and someone assisted us with our luggage. Check in was easy and we were presented with pineapple and cool towels refresh while we waited a brief time for our suite to be ready. My wife and I choose to book here due to the package that we booked which included parking, destination fee, and a resort credit. Here is where we felt mislead... our confirmation stated a $50 resort credit, but upon arrival, we were notified it was only good for food and beverage. This was very disappointing as we wanted to bring home a few items to commemorate our trip to Hawaii specifically from this hotel and their branded items at that. I even presented confirmation that stated a resort credit vs. food and beverage credit only to be told that hotel management would not honor our confirmation paperwork. I do feel mislead regardless of how nice the hotel is and how friendly the staff is, I feel as though it was a bait and switch offer. I was hoping this would be the hotel we would recommend to family and friends and be one we would return to year after year, but this sour taste makes me think otherwise.

This place is fantastic. We had a corner room on the 5th floor - it was comfortable, large and stylishly decorated. Our only issue was with the lighting - its low and I couldn't read at night. The food at the Hideaway was excellent (the Poke Wonton Tacos are perfection) and the drinks were well poured and the bar staff were all great to talk to. The pool area is small but perfectly formed and the location is excellent. So, you should stay here.

As yearly visitors to beautiful Waikiki, we decided to spread our wings and try something different this vacay... And weren’t we pleasantly surprised.  This wonderful establishment takes you back in time to personalised service and a real ‘holiday’ feel. From the moment the vibrant staff greeted us we just knew we were in for a good week. The welcoming gift basket of Thongs and other goodies was a bonus.  The hotel and rooms decor are faultless. Kudos to the re-design team that got this refurbishment spot-on. An almost 60’s ish Deco design that befits Hawaii, our 12th Floor room was spacious and had a comfy bed too. The furniture, side tables and accessories were fab too. Our room had everything! The bathroom was well appointed and spacious  The Pool was surprisingly cool and cute too. Trendy and comfy like the rest of the Hotel, it served its purpose. It’s not the biggest but perfect for relaxing in for the midday sun periods. A bonus was the free Shaved Ice treats daily and the daily free poolside mocktails, a real treat. There is fresh fruit infused ice water throughout the hotel which is a plus. The poolside 24 hour modern Fitness Gym is small but most importantly clean and tidy. A bonus.  The Hideout Bar & Cafe in the entry Lobby was terrific too. The coffee was amongst the best in Waikiki. A daily must, even if not staying here. We started our day with breakfast at the Bar, usually entertained by the friendly Lindsey. Lunch and Dinner are also served here as well, along with Night Time entertainment.  I highly recommend this fine Hotel. It’s location on buzzing Kuhio is ideal (only 7 mins from lobby to beach sand) but it’s the vibrant staff and trendy fit-out that make it a must. I could not fault one Employee, but kudos to Lindsey and Richard for their time and attitude.  Not many downsides too. The rooms do take a while to get cleaned and the loud rubbish-bin removal trucks at 5am in Dukes Lane are unavoidable.  Do yourself a favour and Enjoy the real Hawaii. Thank You LayLow

Located on Kuhio next to the International Market Place, you are close to everything. Welcoming staff everywhere: front desk, restaurant, cleaning staff. It was nice relaxing poolside after a morning of walking miles. Please note that the pool is only 3 feet deep.Great breakfasts. The rooms are well designed and are decent in size. All and all an attractive hotel

We made a last minute booking at the Laylow upon finding out about picketing workers and the noise at our first choice. We are so glad we changed, from the minute we stepped up to reception we were warmly welcomed, warm face cloths and pineapple were supplied straight away and booking in was a breeze. Our room was spotlessly clean, and we were pleasantly surprised with a gift basket of snacks and jandals (thongs, flip flops). The Laylow have a top notch fire alarm system, which we can attest to, being woke up in the early hours of the morning, with siren and voice alarm right in your room. Clear concise instructions were issued, essential when you are located on the 12th floor as we were. Disappointing to see people poking their heads out the door, not moving and still being in the same position when you finally get back to your room. We highly recommend this super quiet, friendly, clean hotel. It has a great pool area, with fruit supplied and shaved ice. A true relaxed holiday accommodation. Thanks everyone for an awesome stay.

Liked the hotel, great service. The restaurant and bar the Hideout, is a locals spot, with good food and drinks and live music. The pool is small the gym small, but neither is crowded.note: if they offer you the 15$ coupons, take the points, the coupons are just too much trouble and they make you feel cheap.otherwise, highly recommend

We spent a week at the Laylow Hotel in Honolulu - November 22-29 and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. This property is a block off Waikiki beach but that was a plus in that it was quieter than the beachfront hotels and the staff was excellent. Our room was clean and well appointed - the modern retro was actually pretty cool. We were on the 15th floor which is the executive level but it isn’t the normal exec level you find at most Marriotts. There was a counter with coffee and juice and a few snacks throughout the day. It would have been nice to have bottled water. The airline had broken a handle on one of our suitcases and we asked courteous bellman Curt if he could get someone to help with repairs and in a short time, Jr arrived, took the case and repaired it within the hour. Another plus was the free shaved ice every day between 1:00 and 2:00. There were lots of choices to eat away from the beach and it was only steps through the International Marketplace to the beach and the Holiday parade the day after Thanksgiving. I would rate this as an excellent value for the money. I would call it a boutique hotel because of the overall size of the place. We would definately return in the future.

My wife and I stayed here for 4 nights. The room was spacious and clean, and they even gave us a welcome pack with snacks and flip flops! The hotel is in a great location being close to the beach and shops. Would definitely stay here again.

Everything about this hotel is top notch and most importantly management team has worked very hard to make that way and really goes above and beyond to make every stay special and attend to every guest. Great team of people and super responsive, we had some issues in a previous stay and management could not have been more responsive and addresses every issue and then some. Extremely impressive, will be back on an annual basis and am a loyal customer for life !!! Thank you to Robert, Ashley, Hicham and team.

We were not sure quite what to expect. This was our first stay at an Autograph collection property. We walked there from Marriott Waikiki and met Summer at the front desk. We checked in then and Summer called when our room was ready which was a nice touch. The room bath amenities are generous and the room layout very comfortable, although if you are a tall person get ready to ‘lay low’ when you turn in. All furnishings are pretty low to the ground.The Hideout restaurant food was quite good. Try the egg rolls, you won’t be disappointed.One caveat, the music playing, whether live or recorded is quite loud and can be a little distracting.The entire front desk staff is very friendly and accommodating. We enjoyed our short two night stay and would definitely consider a return trip.

Stayed here for two nights. Hotel is in an excellent location (near to all the shops). Service and hotel decor was very good. Only let downs were that the aircon was noisy and musty smell in hallway and room. Other that it is a great hotel. Must try the cafe!

My daughter and I stayed here in Feb On our dream trip together. .Block from Waikiki beach .Amazing place and staff and food.Music at night Fire pots to sit around with a drink in Hand .Shopping all around and plenty of food outlets .totally recommend.Amazing place

We enjoyed our stay at the Laylow and it met all of our expectations. This is a great place to stay if you are using the hotel as home base and doing a lot of excursions away. This is NOT a resort hotel so I wouldn’t stay here if you plan to spend a lot of time at the pool or at the beach as the pool is quite small and the beach is a few blocks away (which is OK if you don’t mind the walk). There are other hotels that serve “resort” needs better. With that said, the Laylow is very centrally located. It’s one block to the main strip and easy access to get in and out of Waikiki by car (or Uber). For our annual trips to Oahu we usually stay a week in Waikiki and a week on the West Coast to get the best of both worlds so this hotel served our needs well. It’s also very new so everything is clean and up to date.We had a corner suite on the 14th floor. We were above the restaurant and street so there was a lot of noise until about 2-3AM. I slept with earplugs on but my family seemed OK with it. The layout for the suite was weird as there was a table area in one corner that was partitioned off from the rest of the room. Surely there must be a better way to use the space? The bathroom was quite small for the size of room and there was no bathtub, nor laundry line to dry swimwear and only one sink.Service was prompt for all of our needs and the room was well appointed. We had complimentary gift basket at check in that included Flip-Flops and some snacks and water to get us through the first night as we checked in quite late. There’s a small fridge that works well (many room fridges don’t keep things cold enough).The breakfasts at the restaurant was good too – detail review of the Hideout is separate. The pool was a bit cold and is a long rectangle meant originally for doing laps. They do have towel service and occasionally staff members would come by and offer free poolside treats like frozen fruit. Fitness equipment was good as well. Bell Desk and Valet were prompt and Concierge was able to answer all of our questions. If the price was right we would definitely stay here again!

Hotel design and ambience is great. Nice bar, decent pool, live music at night - great location and cute rooms. No question here is the thing: there is a construction going on right now november 2018 (while i’m writing this) and will be going on for the next few months - drilling, hammering you name it. Its unbearable if you’re planing on working from your room. so its 7pm on friday and i can still hear them hammering. hotel staff doesn’t care and says its not their problem because its a restaurant in the building not associated with them. This is hard to believe as its literally under he escalator. my point is that they should at the minimum let their clients know that this is happening right now and there will be noise. . . But of course they don’t. for $300 a night save yourself a headache and find something near by. you can hear it in front back of the hotel 1 star due to unprofessionalism, not even “we apologize for the inconvenience” and tough sh$$ attitude from the front desk.

This hotel is so beautiful! We came for our honeymoon and had zero things planned to do since we were so busy wedding planning. The concierge Meena was amazing and helped us figure out several days of activities in about 30 minutes with our $50 activity credit. There was a little hiccup with one of our activities (the bus couldn’t come pick us up due to a road closure, not the hotel’s fault) and we went back to visit another concierge, Gabby I think?, who immediately helped us book a different thing to do that day. Such great service from every person we encountered. The restaurant was also really great, both the food and atmosphere. We didn’t want to leave!

Too many good things to say!!! We loved our time at the Laylow and will definitely return! The staff were all wonderful! Great amenities and location! Very cool and comfortable “vibes”! Special thanks to Summer (front desk), Morgan (pool), and Taylor (bar)! See you again soon!I even dropped a business card in hopes of doing some mural work there... hint hint

Nice spacious rooms with balcony. Decor modern Hawaiian style. Good pool area and gym. Only 2 lifts so can wait a while for one to arrive. Sound proofing between rooms and the corridor should be better for a hotel of this standard.

Beautiful, warm, not crazed, delicious food. Ask for a ground floor room facing the pool - 201 or close - and you get a patio with hanging hammock chairs just steps from the in-water lounges, amazing for kids if you have them! Mine stayed home but they would’ve adored it!

Visited the restaurant and bar at this property. Best mai tai in this part of the islands, good food too, although some of the salads are a bit dry and seemed lacking in dressing. The pool seemed bigger bigger online though the pool area itself is nicely presented.

This small boutique hotel is part of Marriott’s Autograph Collection, a group that I recently discovered and thoroughly enjoy. Just two blocks from Waikiki Beach and down the street from the International Marketplace, the location is great. The valet greeter is at street level but the open-air lobby, bar, restaurant and pool are up an elevator, away from the street noise. The landscaping includes lots of palms and two sandy fire pits with comfortable seating areas. The mid-century Hawaiian decor extends into the guest rooms, most of which have balconies. From my top floor balcony I had a glimpse of the ocean and the sunset. The menu at the Hideout restaurant includes fresh fish and other local items. I especially appreciated that the espresso bar opens at 4:00 am, a real gift to visitors from other time zones. The staff is young, enthusiastic and helpful. I’ll be back on my next trip to Honolulu.

The balcony only has enough room to stand, and we overlooked a concrete wall, a multi storey car park and main road. Until at least 9.30pm every night you hear the music from a nearby restaurant, so no piece n quiet. And no sleep in either, with cleaners knocking at your door from 9.30am. Simply, small, clean rooms and in the heart of Waikiki, so easy walking distance to anywhere you want to go. Small pool area to enjoy if that’s your thing. I struggled for phone internet reception in my room, so I decided to try the hotels internet, and that was a waste of time, you couldn’t download a thing it was so slow. Me personally will not stay here again, plenty of other choices in Waikiki to choose from.

I had a one-night stay for a quick business trip.Pros: 1) The decor of the hotel is absolutely charming; retro mid-century modern/Hawaiian motifs work very well here. 2) I really liked the open-air lobby area and how it was set above the hustle and bustle of Kuhio Street. 3) The staff were all very nice. 4) Having the International Market Place right next door is great; what a treat to have that within steps of the hotel!Cons: 1) I booked an executive suite directly on the SPG/Marriott website, but when I checked in I learned that they oversold executive suites and that they were putting me in a junior suite. I did pre-check-in around 2:30pm and wandered around the area for the next 30 minutes until check-in. When I returned at 3pm, I learned that there was a further delay in my room by 30-45 minutes. Considering that I had to get ready for a 5pm meeting, I was not pleased. I was given a junior suite on a lower floor (not the executive floors as I wanted), but with access to the executive lounge. I was given a $50 credit for the restaurant, which I did not need or want since I would be eating out and leaving very early the next morning. The staff kindly gave me points in exchange for the credit since I told them that I wouldn't have any time to use it. 2) The hotel phone system was down. Every time I called guest services to have the valet bring my car around, the line would go dead. I had to use my cell phone to call the front desk. They said they were having problems with the phone system in the entire hotel, but this persisted for at least 12 hours.Summary: I have SPG Gold status, but it didn't seem to matter. I travel extensively, and I have never had a hotel bump me down in rooms because the hotel was oversold. I initially booked an "Executive level, Executive Suite, King, Sofa bed, Waikiki view, Partial ocean view, High floor" room. I ended up with a Junior Suite with no partial ocean view. I tried The Laylow as a new hotel option for this business trip in Honolulu, but I'm afraid that I haven't found a good business hotel yet. I fully accept that Honolulu is primarily and overwhelmingly a vacation destination, but there's still business to be done! I would reconsider staying at The Laylow only for vacation.

We enjoyed a two night stay at the Laylow and thoroughly enjoyed it. A lovely boutique hotel in a convenient location with a superior level of personalization and service quality that we didn’t receive in hotels that cost 50% more.We were welcomed to our room with a gift that included flip-flops, water, chocolate, chips and candy (see photo). Our package also included champagne and a $50 daily dining credit.The room was well appointed and comfortable. We were very pleased to have feather and firm pillows to choose from already in the room.We dined at the Hideout restaurant on-site for breakfast and evening cocktails. Both experiences very positive. I can definitely recommend the pancakes for breakfast and sitting fireside for the evening. The coffee was excellent and made from a real espresso machine not a drip filter bulk brew scenario. Level 15 where we stayed also included a snack and beverage station that had a coffee machine, fresh fruit, snacks, plain water and sparkling water. A very nice convenience and benefit.Located beside the International Market Place, you can walk to Waikiki beach in less that 10 minutes and many restaurants.We would certainly stay again.

The Laylow is a beautiful hotel, with loads of well-designed spaces—from the lobby and pool area to the restaurant and rooms. It’s truly what Instagram dreams are made of. We stayed in an executive level suite, which had some daily freebies—continental breakfast (fruit, juice, coffee) and snacks during the day. Nothing major, but it was a nice additional touch. The room was clean, comfortable, and pretty spacious. Our room also had gorgeous ocean views. It was mesmerizing to watch the ocean from our room in the evenings. And the location was great too. The hotel is only a few blocks away from Waikiki beach and a short drive from other sights in the area (like Magic Island, for example). Staff were generally friendly and professional.There were a few small negatives during our stay. First, the hotel staff was not always immediately responsive. It took a while to get someone to come up and make up the daybed on our first night (3 of us slept in the room, requiring use of the daybed for sleeping). On another day no one answered the front desk number for a solid 15 minutes. And on our Saturday night stay, it took quite a long time for the valet to bring our car around (well past the time they told us it would take when we called down). We felt these were relatively minor inconveniences relative to the positives of the hotel. So, despite these, we would return again in the future.
user_name:
Nikki607
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I had a great time at this hotel. It’s simple yet sophisticated, low key and plus it’s central to everything, even Waikiki beach.The staff is very polite and courteous!!! I’d definitely stay here again

Stayed at this property a few weeks ago. To sum it up, if you are a traveler with no loyalty to a program or no elite status you will enjoy the property. It is a nice property with friendly staff in a super convenient location. Just beware as they do charge an exorbitant resort fee without providing any resort amenities. I know many complain about resort fees, but I don’t have a problem with them when they actually give you something worth the fee like beach chairs/umbrellas like many beach properties do. At this place nope. The resort fee gives you free shaved ice and a fruit basket to pick out of. Total scam. Honestly best to avoid this place.If you are a platinum member expecting any of your benefits to be honored, you should avoid this place as it is obvious the management does everything they can to skirt around the member benefits. As a platinum premier, I wasn’t even offered an upgraded room (which as a platinum is GUARANTEED IF AVAILABLE) at check in when there was virtually every suite type available for the length of my stay. Executive level, junior suite, family suite, and corner suites. When I mentioned this, their excuse was that they we’re not available for upgrade. If they don’t intend to honor the program then why even bother branding as a Marriott? The manager was hostile when and claimed the site has a glitch showing those rooms which was nonsense because later in the evening I overheard people checking in being offered a suite for a fee to upgrade. Totally shady business practices. What’s even worse is they sell executives level rooms when there’s is not even a lounge. They have a pantry basically offering room tempurate water and coffee and that’s about it. I spend a lot of money at Marriott/SPG properties with the promise of being granted certain benefits in return (when they are available). Being lied to, to avoid granting those benefits is not only frustrating, but leaves a black mark on the program. Total scam management running this property.

We spent a couple of nights in Waikiki before heading to Aulani. Our first time staying at an AC property. Nice boutique feel. Views are not a strong point of the Laylow due to it's location. To our surprise, our room on the Ho’okipa level had a partial view of the ocean. Walking distance to everywhere Waikiki was a huge plus. No problem with rideshare pickup and drop-off. National Car Rental located right next door at the Hyatt Centric Waikiki if you need a rental. Staffs are friendly and attentive. Room service was quick. Welcome basket was a nice touch and you can exchange for different sizes of flip flops at the lobby gift shop. We enjoyed our quick dips in the pool and you've gotta love the complimentary shave ice. Perks for Elites are mostly negligible. Mahalo!

Other hotels should follow their example. The Laylow basically has their own brand, the colorful palm tree leaves. The rooms are dressed up in a modern style which I love, and it came with a free goodie basket with stuff I could actually use. Everything is carefully designed. I love the wall decals and lobby. On the 16th and 17th floor, there is a breakfast bar with amazing croissants and cinnamon rolls, complete with fruit, a coffee machine, and pastry bags. Its in the center of a lot of shopping malls and food places, like Marukame Udon. Visit. You won’t be disappointed.

This was my first visit in the Laylow, Waikiki. It is in a great location right next to the international market and across the street from the best Udon on the island! The rooms are well appointed, large, and very welcoming. You can tell this was an older hotel that Marriott re-purposed, but in this case it really works! The staff was excellent, especially at their restaurant, the Hideout. I have been to other Autograph collection hotels with Marriott and I love how the Hideout has a large outdoor area to dine with lots of plants and a wide variety of seating. You can eat inside, sit on a comfy couch outside, or find a secluded corner to sip coffee and drinks. It was an excellent experience all around!

A lovely hotel - great location (next to International Marketplace), only a block or so walk to the beach, well appointed rooms which were very clean and tidy, the property is modern but relaxing at the same time. Welcome basket a lovely gesture. Staff were very friendly and welcoming, nothing was too much trouble. Lovely pool and bar areas. We were able to see fireworks on a Friday night which was a bonus - I think they were from a hotel closer to the beach, but we had a great view. We booked an executive level room which was nice being on a high floor, some street noise but we knew there probably would be staying on a reasonably busy street. The complimentary food and non-alcoholic beverages offered were not quite what we were expecting, it would be more realistic to advertise them as snacks as it was quite a limited offering. For the extra you pay I would be unlikely to go for the executive room option again, but overall it was a lovely stay.

This place is absolutely amazing!!! I had a cabana room opening up to the pool and I was so happy I went for that option. The room was adorably decorated and big....the pool although small was my favorite pool I’ve been to! It was never too crowded and the chairs sitting in water are genius. I’ve read people complaining about the noise you hear in the cabana rooms and about limited sun time at the pool....they are just being negative....it’s absolutely not true. I’m a light sleeper and not a morning person and I had the best rest at this hotel. If you simply move your position there is sun for hours at the pool. The bar and restaurant, “The Hideout”, has delicious and creative craft cocktails and the food is awesome. I kept ordering the same things over and over which I probably shouldn’t have but I just could not get enough of the poke and the buckwheat pancakes with macadamia nut butter and Kona coffee syrup! I’mSure everything else is tasty as well. I enjoyed the daytime gal bartenders. I would give this place 10 stars if I could and I cannot wait to return!

This place does live up to its reviews! From check in, to restaurant, to concierge, to cleaners - everyone was wonderful. Pool is lovely very relaxing. It also is in a great location. We don’t want to leave.

Really great staff, very friendly and relaxed feeling about the place. Close to beach and shops. Suggest avoiding second floor as it can be a little noisy with the bar and fitness suite along the corridor.

First time staying here. Staff was very friendly and helpful and they are really trying hard to make this a wonderful place to stay. The food was outstanding and location is good. While it’s not on the beach it’s close enough. Pool is a little small but loved the lounge chairs submerged in pool. Also liked the decor of the hotel and beds were very comfortable.

Very good location in Honolulu close to everything!!! Cool Boutique hotel. Good breakfast, nice taste. Friendly staff. Valet parking is a very good option for this downtown location. We would do it again!

Its been sometime since I have been to the Laylow hotel. It was the Birthday and my first time visiting. The staff when I arrived was amazing. They seen me struggling with my bags up the escalator and did not hesitate to help me into my room. Checking in, Rachel was absolutely amazing. She was so nice and told me what was around the hotel and the different types of activities me and my girl friend can enjoy. She put me in a room matching my birthday! how cool is that?! The room was fairly big and my room was cleaned spotless every time I left the room. Hospitality game was def on point. Coming from a hospitality background myself, I would def give them a A++ Like I said its been some time since I have last gone. I just finally found the time to write them the review they deserve. Also if Rachel is there she deserves everything good towards her way! Thank you again Laylow Hotel! You will def be seeing me again soon!

Stayed for four days for combination business and fun trip in October. Loved the low-key vibe and fun decor. The rooms are a fine size, not huge, but not tiny, and highly functional (we were working, and it was easy to do so at desk or couch in room). The SPG levels have free coffee, juice, water, ice and snacks which was super helpful. The staff is so nice, and the just the feeling of the place is wonderful. It is relaxed and somehow like you are visiting a friend's house who is chill. It barely feels like a hotel, except there is a fun bar and yummy restaurant on site. You might feel like you never want to leave...

Love this hotel...kind of a gem hidden inside Waikiki!To start off, we arrived way early into Honolulu (like 8:30am) and drove to the Laylow by 11am. Had notified the hotel earlier of our situation and was told they would put a note in the system of our early arrival. Being a Rewards Platinum member, not only did they allow us to check-in at 11am but they also upgraded us to the executive level. WOW!First thing my wife and I noticed about the hotel was the decoration...quite modern, seem like a lot of fun even at the smallest detail. For example, the room card for the executive level was different, has a reflective coating to make it look like its made of metal. The staff said the hotel likes to stand out and be different...they certainly made their point in my opinion. Checked into the room and we found a welcome basket full of snacks, postcard and two slippers. Fun!Room was very nice...not too big and not small either. About the right size. Service was perfect, even though we stayed only 1 night. Staff was friendly on check-in, was very helpful and answered with a smile whenever we had a question. There was a snack station on our level that not only was it constantly filled throughout the day, but it changes from time to time. I still think about the Macadamia Chocolate Chip cookies that was available...should have taken them all for the rest of our trip. ;o)Location was perfect...in Waikiki and the shoreline and shopping were all within a few minutes walking distance. The Laylow is practically next to the International Market. Already told the staff upon checkout that we certainly would stay there next time we visit Waikiki.

We had the pleasure of staying at the Laylow in late September for 4 nights. As some others have noted, the hotel has a cool relaxing vibe when you enter. After a long flight we felt like were stepping in to great place to relax upon our arrival. Front staff were welcoming and helpful in getting us to our room. Our room was fantastic, we had a corner room with glimpses of Waikiki beach from our balconies. Room was spaciousness with a comfy bed and large bathroom.Prior to our arrival we worked with a concierge at the hotel, Meena. In a word, she was incredible! Prior to arrival, we talked to her about what we wanted to do, and she came up with a great plan. She was very knowledgeable about the Hawaian Islands and had many options for us to choose from. All of the activities were fun and allowed us to experience both Oahu and later Kauai, while leaving us time to enjoy the beach, sleep in, shop,etc. When we needed dinner recommendations on Oahu she had great recommendations and made reservations for us. Meena truly made us feel special during our visit to the hotel.We had lunch at the hotel on the day of our departure to Kauai and had a great burger and fries, and of course a cocktail or two. We spent the last day at the hotel lounging poolside waiting for our flight, The pool while not larger provides a great lounging experience. Definitely recommend the Laylow. Great location in Waikiki, with a short walk to the beach, shopping next door and tons of places to eat. Cool vibe, comfy room and great staff — definitely will return!

I stayed at the Laylow for 2 nights during a business trip to Hawaii I was so impressed I felt I needed to write a review. The staff couldn’t be more welcoming, my room was so clean and the welcome basket is beyond any 5 star hotel I have stayed at. I’m a very picky hotel guest and can find many things wrong with hotels and I didn’t have 1 single issue at this hotel. The location is perfect and the ramen restaurant across the street is superb!! I highly recommend this gem of a hotel!

If you are looking for something different in Waikiki, I definitely recommend the Laylow. The hotel is entirely retro vintage Hawaii from the lobby to the rooms. They also have the best roof top bar for night life in town. I recommend this location for adults looking to dine, shop and party in Waikiki.

Stayed with my 4 yr old twins and husband in September. The location is great! Right next to the international market place and a short walk to the beach. The pool is small but perfect for my kids ( they could touch bottom! ) and open to 10pm. They serve shave ice at 1 pm and give complimentary juice at poolside. The rooms are spacious and you can get one with 2 kings. Only complaint is there is an extra person charge over 2 people. Only thing that not family friendly about the place.

We stayed one night at the Laylow before hopping on our 7 day Hawaiian cruise. Everyone was so helpful from the baggage guys to front desk. We were greeted at the front desk and provided a delicious bowl of fresh cut pineapple. Our corner suite was clean, comfortable and spacious. There was a bowl of goodies welcoming us as well as warm robes. It was very peaceful reading on the balcony and watching the sunset from our room. The restaurant was excellent we enjoyed a mahi-mahi dinner with coconut rice and fresh green beans. Our server was very attentive. It was a perfect place to stay and I would love to come back soon.

Room basic but ok Noise expected due to locationNo hot water on arrivalAs usual cr/card details held on booking in - however on returning home 6 days later & checking spending found over NZ$1500 had been debited to c/card by Laylow - supposed to be in case we wrecked the room !!! - still waiting for my money to be refunded - was not told of any major security money to be heldAlso on checking out they tried to charge me US$350 for something we never got

I didn't spend much time at the hotel as I was always out doing something but the bed was comfortable, it was clean, and very nicely furnished. They have a nice restaurant on site and the staff were all very friendly.

Having been totally refurbished we were very happy with our corner room on level 14 with glimpses of the ocean.The pool was very inviting and the location to shops, restaurant and transport were all very handy

My wife and I were looking for somewhere to eat and found this little gem up the stairs at the Laylow hotel. The food was fantastic and the wonton taco’s were amazing, the Mai Tai was also great. Nothing much is cheap in Waikiki for an Australian, and this isn’t an exception. The service is what you would expect and the food quality was awesome.. not much of a view but, but the food and drink make up for it.

Recently started for 3 nights at the Laylow. Querky boutique hotel. Extremely friendly staff who gave us a wonderful warm welcome. Nice rooms with modern decor. Good central location and not far too beach. Would stay again

We booked the Laylow through an agent and were very pleased with our stay for many reasons. All of the team were absolutely fantastic, from the servers in the Hideout (the hotel’s restaurant) and the concierge, to the reception and management team. The food at the Hideout is excellent, huge breakfast portions and brilliantly cooked/prepared. The hotel is beautifully clean, and their communication regarding preparations during a tropical storm were second to none. Great modern touches such as USB charging points at various stations in the bedroom, plus a lovely welcome basket including flip flops and beach towels available to sign out.The only complaint I have is that there’s literally nowhere in the bathroom to hang towels!Everyone was incredibly helpful and did their utmost to create a welcoming stay for us. Would definitely recommend and stay again.

The last time I stayed in the hotel was in the 1990s and man it was a dump. It looked like it hadn't been renovated since Brady Bumch went to Hawaii. This time though - what a difference. Everything has had a major overhaul. It's modern, reasonable and well located. The gift basket and free shave ice are nice touches. The place has a great vibe and an amazing staff. You feel like you are on a nice holiday. Casual genuine friendly service is the order of the day. The Laylow team delivers. Breakfast has is hearty and plentiful. I like to name my favorite staff in of my reviews and here it's Kayla, part of the breakfast team. Granted, the whole team at the hotel is pretty switched on but Kayla remembered our names after a grueling breakfast service and took the time to chat when she could.They were packed the first day we were there and although it wasn't perfect - the team's attitude and service made up for it. This is a well run hotel. Location is convenient and close enough to the beach and right by the Bus. You can save some coin if you want to! I'll stay here again.

Great hotel in amongst some boring and dated hotels. Refreshingly modern and up to date rooms and facilities. Good bathroom and shower. Comfy bed. All you needed including cute box of goodies. Hotel in good central location. Excellent on-site restaurant with awesome coffee. Staff very friendly and helpful.

Only stayed one night but the rooms are very comfortable and the staff is really friendly. I want to call out Victoria who from check in to check to check out couldn't do more to help. Also, shout out to Julie and Amanda for their help also. The bar area is really nice and a great place to chill and have a cocktail. Julie and Amanda behind the bar are great fun and have the patience of a saint for some customer :) . It's a great location and the fact that the lobby is off the street makes it a really nice place to relax. The pool is small but functional. The gym is a bit limited but again functional. Rooms are recently refurbished and very comfortable. The welcome basket is awesome!!. There are free shaved ices which are great from 1-2 every day. These were really good. The staff for me were awesome here and made the stay very enjoyable.
user_name:
Mossnyc
New York City, New York

review_body: I am so glad I chose to stay at the Laylow. It had everything we could want and more.- The pool looked small initially, but never felt small. There were never more than 3-4 people in the pool at a time. There were a choice of chairs (lounges, cabanas, chairs with tables), sunscreen and water. Free mocktails were served by the pool one day and staff can around with cool water to spray on us.- Hideout bar was great for food, coffee and drinks. The atmosphere was fantastic, I loved the lounges by the firepit.- The rooms had everything we needed. We had a view of diamond head to one side and the Royal Hawaiian to the other (and a car park straight ahead, but we didn't book a room with a view, so I was pretty happy). There were no towel rails in the bathroom but we made do with door handles. The lighting was also a little low in the room, but fine in the bathroom.- The location was about 2-3 minute walk to the beach, next to an ABC shop and Dukes Markets. Other shops (Macys, Nordstom, Rip Curl, International Marketplace, the Royal Hawaiian Centre etc) were about 1 minute away.- Extra perks included free shaved ice at 1pm daily, a welcome basket with thongs/flip flops/slippahs, water, snacks etc. And I'm pretty sure it's the most instagrammable hotel in waikiki

After the last few years of alternating between the Royal Hawaiian and the Moana Surfrider for my annual trip to Waikiki, I decided to stay somewhere a little more low key this time, and chose the Laylow after considering a few others. It was a bit of an experiment .... I wanted to see whether it would really diminish my experience by not staying at a fancy place right on the beach (and bonus, spend a lot less on the room).It was a great choice, what I loved about the Laylow was its proximity to shopping and restaurants and the trolley stop on Kuhio, breakfast at the Hideout was amazing (avocado toast with smoked salmon!!), the rooms were so fun with all the Hawaiian accessories and gift basket, great service at the pool, friendly housekeepers. I stayed on the Ho’okipa level which has the espresso machine, pastries/fruit/treats set out throughout the day, and a highlight for me was SPARKLING WATER ON TAP!!! This was so awesome, I need this in my house! The view from my room on the 15th floor looked out over the International Marketplace and over the top of the banyan tree you could see the Moana Surfrider and the ocean beyond.Bottom line, I loved the Laylow. The only thing I really missed from the RH was being able to sit under a pink umbrella at the beach ...but renting a beach set from Waikiki Beach Services was practically equivalent.I definitely recommend the Laylow.

The hotel is nice and updated. The atmosphere was great. Lots of amenities included. Parking was valet only. We were out most of the day but it was great coming back at night. the pool looked nice but we never used it.

Stayed 5 nights. Nice room, not far from Waikiki beach without being right on the beach, comfortable beds, only complaint was booking error that resulted in some hassle. Had booked at Marriott.com but was received notification prior to trip that booking had been billed in full. Spent considerable time on the phone trying to work it out. Thought it was settled, but when I arrived at the hotel, I was told again that the reservation was from a 3rd party, even though my statement clearly showed it was booked directly with Marriott. Hotel was lovely but had only been open a short while when I booked. If they can sort out the booking problems, this would be a nice place to stay again. Loved the Marukame Udon noodle shop across the street.

Nice place to ‘laylow’.Great location and staff were amazing. The rooms were really comfortable and the layout of the hotel was great. Every staff member greeted you with a warm hello every time you would see them. Will definitely stay again .

Check-in was very pleasant, Joey was informative about what the hotel had to offer. The dissatisfaction that I had during my stay was the Destination Fee (29USD/night). I can understand the fee if they offered more, but it was lacking compared to if I stayed at a Marriott Resort.You’re offered one (1) food basket for the duration of your stay. That already doesn’t constitute the per night destination fee. If you get one every day, that would be great. It felt like an AirBnB; everything was manual. Asking for mugs in the morning, asking for hot water (eventually gave us a kettle), need to ask for utensils and no microwave. They had 4 cruisers available, so you’d be out of luck if you didn’t take one before the rush of people going out.Service by the staff was excellent from top to bottom. Quick to respond to a request from the room. Overall, the hotel is good but fell short of expectation compared to other competing hotels in the old Category 8/new Category 6 hotels in O’ahu. Tip: Buy a few gallon water jugs.

Stepping into The Laylow, we immediately recognize the hotel put in a lot of thought into the retro decor and the hotel was very well-maintained. We booked two rooms and both were spacious and had a Hawaiian charm to it. Laylow charges a resort fee, but the fee includes a welcome basket, a nice touch filled with flipflops for both guests, delicious snacks and water. Breakfast assortment was plentiful, I had the North Shore Eggs Benedict, and it was delicious! This boutique hotel is a nice oasis in the heart of Waikiki!

The Lawlow is a real surprise and a perfect stay in Honolulu. The Hawaiian retro decor is chic, rooms are spacious and bright. The hotel got it right without being too literal. The Laylow have thought about everything for the traveler - USB power ports by the bedside, fast wi-fi, smart TV, robes and very nice bathroom toiletries. The nice basket of treats they provide in the room is a nice touch.The staff is amazing and it’s all about service from the time you check-in, sit by the pool or have a drink or meal at the hideout restaurant. The menu is contemporary Hawaiian flavors and lots of healthy choices. Try the loco moco and mimosa at breakfast! Don’t forget the afternoon shave ice in the lobby, which is a refreshing way to be greeted after being out all day.It’s the perfect location right next to the new International Market for shopping, new contemporary restaurants and food halls. Waikiki beach is just minutes away.You won’t go wrong at the Laylow.

Aloha! We just finished a great staycation at the Laylow in Waikiki. Tucked just above the craziness of Kuhio and Kalakaua avenues, this boutique hotel indirectly anchors the recently renovated International Marketplace shopping center. When you arrive you'll have to go up an escalator or elevator to reach the main lobby, concierge, coffee bar, pool, bar and restaurant. They really did a great job with lobby decor so that the ambiance separates you from the noisy hustle of Kuhio Avenue below. Check in was a breeze and we were able to get a room on the 16th floor with partial ocean view, partial mountain view and full Waikiki views. When you exit the elevator on floor 16, you are greeted by a small coffee/water/snack station that was fully stocked throughout our stay, The pastries change between morning, afternoon and night. The coffee machine does tend to brew on the loud side, so I recommend a room just a bit away from that area.Our room was a delight. Super clean, airy with a nice contemporary tropical design. And with books on the shelves! They offer a welcome basket that included locally made chips, chocolates, water and two pairs of room slippers. And a toy rubber ducky! The A/C was nice and cold and from morning, noon and night we barely heard traffic from the down below. Nor could we hear the live music coming from the lobby bar at night. Dining options are slim but the restaurant/bar below called The Hideout served a really good breakfast. The shopping centers next door will open up your food options a bit. They do however offer room service.Overall, we would definitely stay at this property again. We really enjoyed our stay largely because of its size. It's not a gigantic mega resort. The staff here were incredibly friendly and super accommodating! We recommend this property for adults but during our stay we did see a few younger guests. Checkout their Instagram to get a good vibe of this place. Hope this mini review helps! Aloha!

This was my husband's favorite hotel in all of Hawaii. It was a nice oasis away from the hussle and bussle of Wakiki. The rooftop bar had a good laid back atmosphere. We had breakfast at the hotel and found the service exceptional and the food to be very tasty. The food was not your normal American breakfast options; they had several local/Hawaiian dishes. The concierge booked our excursions for us. They were great to work with. They were very attentive and did a great job explaining our options as well as telling us about things on the other islands that they would recommend.The location is great and close to many excellent restaurant choices. We had stayed a few days on a different part of a Oahu and was finishing our trip to Oahu in Wakiki. We were able to drop off the rental car in town right next to the hotel and avoid paying the valet parking fees that the hotel charges. If you don't want a car the whole time, this is one thing to consider. There are quite a few car rental places near the hotel.My one disappointing factor of this hotel is that with gold status (now platinum premier) I didn't feel like this meant anything to this hotel nor do I recall if they recognized my status when I checked in. I was more recognized at the Marriott Kauai than I was here. I ended up on a room on a lower level right next to the elevator, which is completely fine. The room was just one of the regular rooms and I thought it was perfect; very nice/modern Hawaiian. We had friends also staying at this hotel at the same time as us (who do not have status) and they were upgraded to a nicer room and had access to the executive lounge on the top floor. I wasn't even informed about the executive lounge.
user_name:
Skigal08
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Of all the hotels I have stayed in during travel to Waikiki this beats any of the "mega" resorts. Quaint, unique and such a super staff I will pick this on my future adventures. It gives you all the access to shopping, eating and Waikiki you may need without the big hotel feeling. Staff at the bar, restaurant, check-in, room service was exceptional!

We spent our last night in Hawaii here before heading to the airport for our flight home. We enjoyed hanging out by the pool, especially with the daily drink samples at noon and the shaved ice at 1. We were glad we got out early to get seats and the option for shade. The appetizers we ordered by the pool were tasty as well. Quick walk to the beach and plenty of places to eat nearby!

What a brilliant hotel. Modern and friendly! The spacious rooms provide plenty of space to relax and enjoy the Aloha mood. Stylishly decked out, fresh and new.The bar and deck area is perfect for lounging around. The best mixologists are well prepared to serve up your favourite holiday cocktail or suggest something brilliantly different. A vibrant space that really made the stay fun. Guests and visitors alike flock the space, making it lively and fun, but not overcrowded.The Laylow is perfectly located next to the International Market Place. Some delicious dining and bar options just a moment away. An excellent stay overall. I’d happily return.

We stayed at the newly renovated Laylow. It was previously the Aqua, and it went through a $60 million renovation and is managed by Marriott. The new theme is traditional Hawaiian, with a modern spin.The positives are the aloha, the amenities and the location. For example, we arrived a little over an hour before checkin. Our room was not ready, but Sheila at the front desk was kind enough to get us a room right away. There was a difference in price so she made it worth our while to change. We were happy to change because our daughters were really tired and needed a quiet place to take a nap. The amenities include a welcome basket that inlcudes slippers, a rubber ducky and a couple of bottles of water. Additionally, they offer ukele lessons, free shave ice, and free frozen fruit. Lastly, Laylow is located right next door to the hot shopping mall, The International Marketplace, and across the street from Marukame Udon, an inexpensive place to grab a meal.The only downsides are the location can get a lot of foot traffic because of the International Marketplace, and it seemed liked the elevators were slow. However, we noticed that the foot traffic died down during the week vs the weekend.All in all, a very pleasant experience vs the Vive and Hyatt Place up the street. Both of those places have their issues. I would have no problem staying at the Laylow again the next time I am in Waikiki.

We are a family of 3, 2 adults & a 5 yr old. We stayed for 6 nights in a ho’okipa level king deluxe (club room). We were celebrating a special occasion & arrived to the most incredible welcome gifts (see pics)! The rooms here are amazing, comfiest beds we’ve ever slept in. Location incredible, staff incredible (can’t do enough for you) & we will return. We had booked some sightseeing from home but the rest via the concierge who was incredibly helpful but could have explained a little more about the luau we were recommended. All in all one of the best holidays for all 3 of us as a family & 10/10 for the Laylow! Thank you Mr Friedl & all staff at the Laylow

My wife and I stayed here in March 2018 for our 7th anniversary. I cant say enough good about this hotel. Extremely friendly and helpful staff. Wonderful rooms and very nice restaurant. This hotel is in a great location near many other restaurant's and an easy walk to the beach. We plan on staying here again on our next visit.

They’ve done a great job with this hotel. Very modern styling and have utilised the space they have well. All of Waikiki’s main shops and restaurants are a short stroll away. Staff are friendly and efficient, the whole main floor where check in, hideout and the pool area is nicely presented.We didn’t eat at hideout though the menu looked good. Coffee was actually great and as I come to Hawaii a lot for business I will be coming back here to get my fix as it is very close to the quality I get back home.Bar area was relaxed and had a great feel. They do a daily happy hour(s) and have some form of good quality live music. The painkiller cocktail was delicious.We stayed in a junior suite which was quite large for a hotel room. Lovely design, great bathroom with good amenities. Wifi was reliable and speedy. No problem streaming video.The only cons were that the room let a large amount of light in. We were on the 4th floor facing dukes lane and the car park lights were extremely bright so bring your eyepatches until they put in better blackout curtains.It was also a bit noisy at both night and morning but that can also be a pro because of its fantastic location and a bit of noise is to be expected.

A formerly tired, old hotel has found new life as a stylish boutique hotel in the heart of the Waikiki action but with a solitude rarely found. The Laylow offers a great alternative to the more ubiquitous branded hotels in Waikiki - even though it's part of Marriott's Autograph Collection, you'll find no signs of Marriott branding and sales pitches here. The experience begins with valet or drop off on busy Kuhio Ave but a tall escalator ride up takes you to the relaxed atmosphere of an open air lanai, pool and reception lobby well above street level. Small in scale but high in style and character. Low-key but very helpful staff are available to meet your needs. Music permeates public areas and tempts you to take a deep breath. Pony up to the bar for crafted cocktails or custom coffees from the barista serving select procured roasts.Inside rooms are comfortable, contemporary furnishings and good use of valuable space. All upper floor rooms have balconies while pool cabanas get wicker swing pods. Mini fridges included but I couldn't get temp below 48. I also couldn't get the AC system to adjust as much as I wanted - but then I also didn't ask anyone for help. Plenty of spots to plug in devices but no in-room bluetooth speaker to use (glad I brought my own).I've only ever stayed in the Pool Cabana rooms - of which there are only 4 - and line up along the pool deck. If you need only a King bed and want easy in and out to pool and bar, these are must-have rooms for you!The Laylow may not be for everyone. Small kids will probably be bored but older children could appreciate the laid back attitude. Definitely great for couples or business traveler. There's typically a waitress serving the pool but you may be best doing more self-service which is an easy walk to the bar. You won't get nickel and dimed here - all pool lounges and cabanas are first come at no extra cost. Chilled Lemon water provided poolside. Pool is small but good enough for cool-down plunges. Biggest complaint here is the droning mechanical noise emanating from the adjoining International Marketplace Garage which abuts the pool deck. Poolside music helps. Rooms are well insulated though so with doors closed, you won't hear anything.Weekend nights have DJs and live music on the lanai. One restaurant serves breakfast/lunch/dinner. Being close to the Int'l Marketplace affords many benefits such as easy in-out shopping access, great food court alternatives, and tour shuttles/trolleys along Kuhio. I definitely recommend The Laylow for value, style, comfort and location as an alternative to larger resorts if that's how you roll. Mahalo!

Stayed here twice now. My only issue is that I have had noise problems here once. but aside from that this place is awesome. Close to Waikiki, in a great location. A great place to explore Hawaii from.

My family spent five nights at the Laylow Autograph Collection Hotel in the last week of July 2018 and loved it. The location was ideal for Waikiki area, the decor was unique, the room was clean, the A/C worked well, the beds were comfortable, and most importantly the staff made us feel welcome from the first minute to the last. We had a blast here! Thank you.

After a sub par stay at the Ritz in Maui, the Laylow was a breath of fresh air and less than half the cost. My favorite things about it were:- 2 Kings in one room, great for groups of 4; no other hotel I know does this- Cute welcome basket, I love my Laylow flip flops- Hideout Restaurant - food was amazing!!! Ate breakfast and lunch there. Fresh and flavorful. Would come back here for a regular meal.- Friendly and competent staff - front desk handled our large group well, and were really polite. When I forgot an item at the hotel, they promptly found the item and helped to ship it back- the best decor ever-- whoever was their interior designer person deserves an award!! So Hawaiian, modern, and chic- clean, comfortable rooms- fast valet- convenient- great price/valueI've stayed at many hotels as I travel a lot for work and this is one of my favorite hotels ever!Mahalo!I'm sooo glad

Victoria took care of us from check-in to checkout. She made sure our room and stay were perfect. We celebrated our 14th wedding anniversary and Victoria helped us make it memorable and relaxing.Kimmy in the gift shop was very helpful too.Overall, this is one of my favorite hotels. I am a Marriott Platinum Elite member. Victoria made us feel platinum all the way. I will definitely try to stay here again.
user_name:
SPGenthusiast
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: We chose this hotel because it offered two king beds per room and was a short walk to both the beach and shopping. The staff were friendly, especially the concierges who were very helpful. The Laylow offers a charming welcome basket which includes free flip flops and snacks - we were pleasantly surprised with this! Shaved ice was provided daily for hotel guests. Check in and check out were uneventful.

We had trouble getting into our room after a long haul flight. Staff were not at all accommodating and my children fell asleep in the reception area after waiting for hours for our room. We were never offered a drink in the nearby cafe restaurant or for the children to jump in the pool. My husband approached the concierge on one occasion where the woman didn’t bother to make eye contact and was hopeless. When we returned a week later to stay the night before an early morning flight home the hotel had lost our pre-booked and pre-paid reservation. After blaming our travel agent and trying to blame us we were sent up to a room. We are a family of 5 and the room had one bed and a day bed. Our travel agent was in contact with us by then and confirmed that everything had been confirmed at her end of things. As we had already stayed the previous week in a room that accommodated us all it was obvious that The Laylow had lost our booking and given our room to someone else. The Laylow then tried to say they would charge us to upgrade to a larger room. We ended up 5 people in a room with two beds. Our travel agent offered to move us to another hotel which we would have gladly done however it was late and we had an early start. Shame on the front desk and management staff. That was our last night in Hawaii. My children were either stressed or so tired they said they would sleep on the floor. And we had already paid for the room. I would not recommend staying here. It’s completely overrated and the facilities are beyond basic with not even a kettle in the room. Fifteen floors of patterned wallpaper does not make for a boutique hotel or a boutique experience. The attitude of the front desk staff was disgusting. What a shame the Hideout cafe/restaurant is attached to this hotel. The staff and food there was amazing. My recommendation would be to pop in for lunch or dinner at The Hideout but stay elsewhere.

We visited our son's room at the Laylow after eating dinner next door at the International Market Place. He had a lovely suite with a king bed, sofa, separate eating area behind a screen, and a balcony. The bathroom had been redone, but it was really very small, a surprise considering the other features of the room. There was a nice pool and lounge area on the lobby floor.

The Laylow is a charming boutique hotel that is modern and is full of Hawaii style. Our room was very modern but had a lot of nice touches like local books and artwork. The room was functional with a modern bathroom, plenty of storage space and a refrigerator. The bed was very comfortable. We had a room overlooking the pool with a balcony.The locations is awesome. A few minute walk to the beach, it is located next to a modernized mall and a grocery store is nearby. There are a ton of restaurants within walking distance. Towels are provided so you can enjoy the beach.The food was above scale for a hotel. We ate breakfast everyday in the hotel and the service and food were both outstanding. We do not usually et dinners in a hotel but because the breakfast was good we decided to give it a try. Glad we did as the food quality and service carried over.What sets this hotel apart is the little things provided. I mentioned the towels. But they also had free shaved ice or ukulele lessons at a set time. They really cater to the aloha experience!

Lovely hotel, service was good and staff friendly, room was excellent, location very central to shops and close to beach. BUT beware of unauthorised charges once you check out and finalise your account. An additional charge was made on my card after we had left the hotel and have tried to contact the hotel for explanation, but I have received no responses to my several emails. Very disappointed.

If you prefer a upscale, not on the beach, boutique hotel, there is no better place in Waikiki that the Laylow. They have a great team providing the best in hospitality. Kudo's to Ben who not only was a great host but allowed us to borrow the freezer space so we could bring home Portuguese sausage. My hotel of choice now!

Fab boutique hotel in the heart of Waikiki. Can not fault the staff or the Service. We stayed in a corner suite ( hubby & I and grown daughter ) and was certainly spacious enough for us. King bed and Sofa bed. Nice bathroom and two balcony’s. In the room we had a basket of free goodies ( couple pairs of flip flops , snacks etc ) The Resort / Amenity fee included the shaved ice every afternoon which was a good little treat. Pool area is only small but in Waikiki it’s all about the beach ( 5 min walk ) Plenty of places to eat and drink near the hotel. The Marukame Udon place across the street is a MUST and such a good value. There is always a line and for good reason. For cheap authentic cocktails and Hawaiian vibe check out Cuckoo Coconut Bar. Would certainly recommend The Laylow to anyone looking a fun, funky Waikiki Hotel.

We enjoyed a lovely visit at The Laylow. The hotel is mid-century modern Hawaii, it was a choice that provided a nice local flair to one of my favourite design styles. Our room was clean and comfortable with a balcony that overlooked the pool. We were on the third floor and did not find the pool to be noisy. The hotel has live music in the evenings and we enjoyed sitting on our balcony and listening to the music. We also had a pretty good view of fireworks from the beach one evening, at least the ones able to go above the buildings. I was particularly impressed with the friendly professionalism of the staff. Everyone with whom I interacted was attentive, friendly and was able to address my query or concern. Because we opted for breakfast during our stay, we had the opportunity to interact with the servers in the restaurant. They were very good and one was one of the best at the job that I have experienced anywhere. He managed to be available without hovering, engaging and entertaining without being intrusive and helped to make the mornings he was working a nice start to the day. The breakfasts were great. We were three and had five nights at the hotel so we divided and conquered the menu so that we could try everything. I loved the delicious savoury oatmeal and the buckwheat pancakes were light and the contrast with the macadamia nuts and kona coffee maple syrup accent was a delight. I wasn't entirely sure what to expect from the loco moco but I enjoyed it. The meat was tender and flavourful, the only minor glitch was that the sunny side up eggs were slightly less cooked than I prefer but I was able to quickly remedy it by flipping them over into the hot gravy. Our daughter who is not a foodie and rather picky also enjoyed her breakfasts. We enjoyed the restaurant enough that we opted to have our last dinner in Honolulu there. When it was time to go our daughter didn't want to leave (and neither did I).

This hotel is located on Kuhio Ave, next to the International Markets and not too far from the beach.If you’re not too fussed about having direct beach views, then I’d have no hesitation in recommending this hotel. This is the second stay we have had here and each time we have been greeted with a cute little welcome gift in our room. The room itself is absolutely beautiful. Love he décor, and the bed was very comfortable. We booked an Executive Room staying on the Ho'okipa level. Our view from the 11th floor looked out over the top of the car park to the International Markets (so not that appealing to some) but we could see glimpses of the ocean which was totally fine for us. We didn't really stay here for the views. There was a coffee station available to guests on this floor and basic snacks through the day - I wouldn't call this a continental breakfast as advertised. Nothing over the top amazing, and often there was no milk for the coffee etc, but it was a handy treat none-the-less. Loved the restaurant downstairs. They make great food and make the best barista coffee! The staff are always so friendly, welcoming and helpful and I was super impressed that they had our room ready when we arrived at 8am after a 10 hour flight! We were so grateful for that, and didn't expect that at all. We would stay here again in future without question.

The staff at the hotel were all very kind and accommodating. Anything we needed they provided. We liked that they provided little treats throughout the day like shave ice at 1pm. However, there were some downfalls. Such as the pool being filthy. We tried to go a few times but just couldn’t do it. We were glad to have the beach so close. We Also don’t like that we have to pay $25 for the daily activity fee. We didn’t see the benefit. Also, you receive a $50 credit, however we weren’t able to use it because it’s only towards certain activities that cost an arm and leg or we had already booked personally. So we felt a bit ripped off on that aspect. We also recommended that you don’t pay the $40 a day to park there. Park at the Ross parking lot around the corner for $25. It’s a quick 5 minute walk back to the hotel. The Laylow is in a great location to get anywhere quickly.

I am sorry to have to give a bad review to this hotel because it was super cute, in a great location and the people who worked there were wonderful. I could NOT stay here again though because the mattresses in our room were horrible. Not bad, horrible! We had 2 queen beds and each one was like sleeping in a canoe. Even the pillows were so gigantic that we had to roll up a towel to make a pillow because you couldn’t sleep on those either.
