I called down to see if we could get thinner pillows and they said they didn’t have any. The last night we were there I literally slept on the floor because the bed was so bad I couldn’t do it again. If you don’t mind really bad beds, everything else about this boutique hotel is great!

We arrived after a long flight to a friendly staff. Our room was ready, and we were not disappointed. The rooms are spacious, immaculate, and have plenty of storage for a week long stay. The location is good, not right on the beach, but it is a quick walk down the street. It is central to everything, including restaurants and shopping. If you have a car, you can easily drive the whole island from here with no problem. The valet staff are amazing, and the concierges are very helpful; Meena and Gabrielle helped us throughout our stay and ensured we saw the highlights of Oahu before we left. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Very nice hotel. Part of the Marriott group. Small pool but nice lounges both by and in the pool. Poolside shave ice and punch served daily. Nice room - clean and fresh. Short walk to Waikiki and international center. Parking $39Facility fee $29

I have stayed in lots of hotels and this is my favourite. Lovely large rooms, nice pool with a one block location to beaches.The best thing though is the staff, from every facet of the hotel these people make the place the best. If in Waikiki there is nowhere else to stay.

Stayed at the Laylow for six days in July and it ticked all of the boxesThe rooms were lovely and comfortable with Uber cool fitoutsThe staff are extremely friendly and most important they are efficient. From the front desk to the tour desk, restaurant and gift shop they are greatPool area is comfy and a good little gymSpecial mention to the tour desk lady. She booked our Pearl Harbour tickets and when we returned and let her know just as an FYI that the submarine was closed, she insisted on calling and getting us a partial refundNow that’s service!

This was our second hotel in Wakiki. We were only able to get several nights at the Hale Koa, and we were pleasantly surprised at the great location. Right in the middle of the Wakiki shopping district and less than two blocks from the beach. Great modern vibe. We requested two king beds since we were traveling with two teenagers. Beds were wonderful; room was very clean; bathroom was modern and nice but on the small side. Staff was friendly and accommodating. Room was cleaned promptly and early. Did not eat in the restaurant, but has drinks in the cool and relaxing rooftop garden area. Pool was only disappointing feature, wish it was larger and deeper. Great hotel for couple.

Stayed 5 nights during July 4th week.The good: The staff all around was very friendly and very helpful. The pool is great (although very hot in the middle of the day as there is limited shade. Good bar and nice little perks like the welcome basket, shaved ice, cruisers, etc.The bad: Two staff complaints. One was the restaurant. Very slow service and not responsive to requests (asked for water and took over 10 min. asked for syrup for pancakes and they half gone by the time it arrived - and it was NOT busy - 6 tables total).Second is maid service. The room is VERY basic. No coffee maker. So they sent one up - Krug style. First was broken, second dumped half the coffee into the cup. Staff never replaced the coffee - even when I put in a request. Also, never replaced glass wear, or picked up dirty bar glasses from the room. Back to the room. Marriott prides itself on trying to save the planet by asking you to hang towels if you don't want them washed, if you don't want sheets changed, etc. Well they designed a bathroom with ZERO hooks! No place to put a face towel or bathtowels other than the floor when you have 4 people in the room. IF there was two people, you could get creative and hang them in the closet or shower door when both done.

A hotel with such great style and amazing service to top it off. Perfect location too! I’m in love with their boho theme print thats seen throughout the hotel- wallpaper in rooms, towel rentals to even straws in the drinks. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

The breezy, casual atmosphere at the Laylow was perfect for our night in Honolulu. Great location to food and shopping and a comfortable bed in a good sized room. Everyone we met who worked there was happy, helpful and very nice. This was an easy stop for the beginning of our trip.

My stay here at laylow waikiki was good until the valet service scratched and damaged my rental car. The incident was reported and logged by the management and they said they will take care of it but never did. I called and emailed several times and they assured they will take care of it but it’s been over a year now, the rental company claims department is still calling me for payment for damages done by laylow waikiki valet. I’d definitely not here during my next visit.

Thoroughly enjoyed the hotel and all it has to offer. My room was spacious and it felt "new". Location is GREAT! Unfortunately, housekeeping is not the best. They forgot to clean my room one day. I had left my room at 10 AM and was out until 11 PM and was disappointed that my room wasn't touched. It was my last night and I was checking out the next day, so I just let it go. When I told the front desk clerk at check out, he just looked at me and said sorry and then crickets...... that's one thing they need to get a grip on.

Stayed here in early June for 1 night. It's not directly on the beach but a short walk over. The rooms have a really unique feel to them, which I like. Didn't have time to go to the pool but that looked nice as well. We also had a really nice breakfast downstairs at their restaurant. The only negative I found was that I didn't find the concierge to be super helpful (the front desk ended up being more so) and we didn't know about the resort credit until it was too late to use it. Some hotels send before arrival emails on things to do with the credit, which would have been nice. Overall, I would highly recommend this place and wish I stayed longer.

I would have given 5-stars; however, housekeeping missed the mark. Staying on the 8th floor from June 29 until today. Left the room at 10 AM, returned at 230 PM -- room not made up and housekeeping didn't even come back to check on the room or my needs. Since I was only staying one more night, I didn't say anything, but will when I check out. The front desk was excellent and friendly. If you want to go to bed early .... don't get a room on Kuhio. Music is blasted until 12 midnight. I would stay again; however, it seems like housekeeping has a lazy staff and I am not the only one to complain about it in the reviews.

This is our first stay in Hawaii and we got attracted to the Laylow because of a great deal on Wotif. Laylow is very centrally located in Waikiki, just one block away from the famous Waikiki beach strip. It has been recently renovated just over a year ago.We got here early after an overnight flight. We were unable to check in straight the way because the night before was full and that's fair enough. The receptionist was great she took care of all our luggages while we cruise around the shops nearby. There are plenty of eateries and shops around the Laylow. The Udon shop opposite the road is constantly full with a huge line outside. Luckily we managed to try it on the first day.We checked in later in the afternoon. Our double room consists of two huge King beds. They were slightly soft but reasonably comfortable. The room also has several books regarding Hawaii, a ukelele, and an empty bar fridge which I prefer instead of having a whole heap of minibar stuff that we don't use. No kettle in the which is a little unusual. Bathroom has a nice shower with 4 different types of configs. The balcony is narrow and frankly not very usable especially on the 11th floor where we at.Laylow has a nice pool on the ground floor, it is narrow and right next to the main building which again worked out quite well it created nice shelter from the blazing sun. There are certain free items each day they serve as part of the resort amenties such as shaved ice etc. We never tried the restaurant as there are so many eateries around. The international food alley is closeby and also a Japanese food alley on the other side.The location is perfect if you would like to base your stay in Waikiki. The bus stops are close by they can get you to most tourist destinations.All the staff we encountered during our stay were friendly and very helpful. Have not encountered one issue from check in till check out.Overall we enjoyed our stay here very much. If we decide to stay in Waikiki again we would certainly consider staying here again.

My husband and I loved everything about this hotel! It is conveniently located, close to shops, restaurants and the Royal Hawaiian beach beachfront. The upper floor is what you should spring for. The water dispensers and coffee are more useful than the cool views when it’s blazing hot outside. And the lounge/bar is fun day or night. We will be back!

We loved this boutique hotel. We had one glitch when we arrived as there was no bellman and we couldn’t find the elevator to get to the registration area. However, the rest of the stay was lovely. Room was spacious. The restaurant provided great food and wonderful service. The pool is a little small for the size of the hotel, but nice. While not on the beach, it is central to everything. The concierge service rocked. We had several wonderful excursions. Do call ahead to arrange activities. We would come back. Aloha!!

I've stayed at The Laylow four or five times over the last eight months and was very happy with the hotel the first few times. However, the last couple of visits have been very disappointing due to poor service. Yesterday I was out of my room from 10am to 2:30pm, and upon returning to the room, I found it had not been cleaned. I freshened up and left the hotel again a little after 3pm, stopped by the front desk to ask if I could get housekeeping to visit my room, and was told housekeeping technically had until 6pm to clean the room. I returned to the room just before 7pm and still no visit from housekeeping. I changed for dinner and left the hotel, stopped by the front desk to say I was disappointed, left a business card and room number, and as of 8:30am today, no voice mail, email or note acknowledging my complaint. Very disappointed in the management here at The Laylow.

So glad we chose this boutique hotel! Rooms clean and spacious. Just a couple blocks from Waikiki but in the heart of restaurants and shopping. Great little market next door. Beautiful pool area for relaxing. Super friendly and helpful staff! Allowed us to store luggage on site for the day we checked out since floor got didn’t leave til evening. Highly recommend!

We stayed for one night in June at the tail end of our trip to Oahu. We arrived early and were ready to drop off our luggage and hit the beach, but the friendly receptionist performed some magic so that we were able to go to our room right away. Our executive level room was wonderful—comfortable, beautiful decor, nice little balconies, fantastic bathroom with wonderful smelling bath products, and a nice welcome basket with snacks and flip-flops. The snack bar on the executive level was very nice and convenient—coffee, juice, and pastries. The only issues I had with the room: 1) No hooks in the bathroom. Nowhere to hang a towel or swimsuits. 2) The walls our a bit thin. We could hear the next room through the wall by the bed, but it wasn't much of a problem.The location was great—far enough away from the madness, but just a short walk from Waikiki Beach. Tons of food and shopping options nearby, although you'd do well to eat at the onsite restaurant, The Hideout. Great food and drinks, and just a lovely spot to relax. We didn't spend time at the pool, but it looked very inviting, if small. If you're limiting your stay to Honolulu you might want to forgo a rental car from the airport. Parking is VERY expensive and the valet stand tends to be backed up.We will definitely return to the Laylow. It is a fun, hip hotel, with a lot of character, and great service. This was our first experience with a Autograph Collection hotel and it was so pleasant, we are trying another one on our next trip.

Stayed here for 5 nights in early June. Really nice place , Cool retro vibe. So handy to shopping, next door to Nordstrom rack One way and the international market place the other way, Beach a short stroll too. Loads of good eateries around. Especially the noodle place opposite the hotel. Would definitely recommend this place . We are a couple in our early sixties and loved the Dj playing on the weekends and live music through the week around the bar areas.

The Lay Low has some serious potential, the location is perfect, right next door to the remodeled International Market and a block away from the beach. Unfortunately, it falls short in almost every other area.RoomThe room and build out of this hotel is absolutely gorgeous. Lots of little aesthetic details like a ukulele in the room and the interesting Hawaiian books on the book shelf. Unfortunately, the nice buildout was the best thing about the room. My husband and I stayed in, the "cabana room" right next to the pool, it was a little bit of a nightmare. The hanging chairs outside are absolutely darling, but other guests would use them, which made for awkward moments opening the slider in the morning. Our room, room 212, was a hallway and another room away from the gym, which doesn't seem like a big deal, but the floor is so poorly insulated that we could actually feel and hear people using the treadmill and worse than that were the guys slamming their weights down during their workouts starting around 5 am. It was so loud that I thought the noise was coming from above our room. My husband figured out what was going on and went over and asked one guy to stop slamming his weights as he was literally throwing them down after each set. We called the front desk a few other times to ask them to intervene, but with a 24 hour gym, we were up at 5 most mornings, very unpleasant. The AC unit was also very loud and had a difficult time keeping the room cool, so it would be on for 5 minutes, then off for 30 seconds and then back on. Lastly, there are literally no hooks in this room, not even in the bathroom. This made hanging up wet bathing suits and towels an issue.ServiceAll of the staff we encountered were very friendly. The downfall is that though everyone was friendly, there was a definite lack of efficiency and attention to detail. We ordered room service most mornings and there was not one time that the order was delivered correctly, an item was missing each time. I asked specifically if the chicken papaya salad had cilantro as an ingredient and was assured it did not, the salad was delivered with cilantro as one of the main ingredients. We ordered room service and asked for it to be delivered to the pool area, this request was also overlooked. An item of clothing went missing from our room. I asked three different employees to look into finding it and never heard back from one. Upon departure, I inquired once again and was told that they would contact me by phone. After a week of being home with no correspondence, I called and spoke with a manager who assured me that he would look into the matter and get back to me, I never heard back. I called back two weeks later and spoke with another front desk employee who assured me that she would look into it and call me back, nothing. Horrible customer service. The sheets were not changed once during our stay and the room was not vacuumed. We had to call to request more toilet paper and toiletries as they were not consistently restocked.Room ServiceThe food at the hotel is delicious! The food all tastes very fresh and it is obvious that quality ingredients are used. The tuna poke bowl was a favorite as were the mac nut sticky bun and fruit bowl. Though the food is all very tasty, every single item is delivered in disposable packaging delivered in a bag. For a beautiful boutique hotel on an island that is striving toward eco friendliness, this was a complete shock. My husband and I felt bad after each meal looking at all of the waste created. It is really unfortunate that the hotel can't come up with some sort of room service plan that doesn't involve creating so much waste. PoolThe pool area is darling with lots of greenery, complimentary fruit and shave ice. However, the pool itself is tiny, with little seating. There are only 32 spots for sitting or lounging around the pool, 22 spots are loungers, which makes for few spots when the sun is out. The pool is surrounded by high rise buildings, so the it gets sun from about 11-2. It is bordered by a parking garage on one side, and for some reason there were a lot of loud motorcycles revving their engines in the garage which was not relaxing. I will not be returning to the Laylow. Hopefully they will read this review and make some improvements.

We stayed here last year because it’s one of the newer hotels in Waikiki. We had a few issues at the time to which originally we were not going to come back here. After my trip advisor review, the GM Robert reached out and offered me to contact him directly to see if they could make it right. I really have to give these guys a shout out because they did. The service was fantastic and we had no issues whatsoever this time. We really like this hotel as it’s off the main strip but still within 5 minutes walking distance to Waikiki beach. Our favourite at this hotel is the bar/restaurant area. They did a really nice job and created a very cool atmosphere. Live music during weeknights of very high caliber! The service staff is also outstanding! Being a hotelier myself, I’m impressed on the follow up by this hotel. Usually you get a blah blah response...we’ve noted your concerns and do better next time... and nothing happens. These guys really tried hard to make our stay the second time outstanding and they did. We’ll be back. Thank you to Robert and his team. PS. They also fixed the platinum status issues. As a platinum Marriott member they give out 15$ daily food vouchers per person in lieu of free breakfast which is more than adequate!

We stayed here for 5 nights and just loved the location. We were in Honolulu to shop and it’s located in a great spot. You have Nordstrom rack a few doors down and Ross outlet store just around the corner, but also all the high street shops as well.We would stay again! The only negative was that there is no tea and coffee making facilities in the room.

We were a group of four and it was our first time staying at this hotel property (our favourites include the Halekulani, the Hyatt Regency Waikiki, and the Sheraton Waikiki). Some of things we enjoyed: the hotel is conveniently located close to the Waikiki strip and close to shopping and food (for example, it's just across the street from Marukame Udon); housekeeping is relatively quick to bring up requested items like additional towels; and Joey at check-in was very friendly and welcoming. However, we were placed on the third floor, and loud music blared every night from the hotel lobby. Forget trying to relax in the hotel room anytime before 11 pm when the music finally turns off, and that balcony? We were staring out over Duke's Lane into the parking lot, and being so close to street level was definitely a turnoff. We ate breakfast at the hotel restaurant several times, and the service at the hotel restaurant was overall lackadaisical. If you're looking for a self-serve, modern vibe, this is the place for you. If you want a nicer, quieter, more premium hotel experience, I highly suggest you go elsewhere.

Stayed for 6 days and wanted to avoid the $40 per day parking fee (on top of $29 per day destination fee) so we parked 5 minutes away and took a Lyft once per day and night and paid about $6.50 per ride. We saved about $175. We always found parking in the residential neighborhoods. Ps...happy hour is 4:30-6:30 at the hotel.

I literally cannot fault this place - it’s new, modern, well located, great pool, great bar etc etc - the location is perfect for the beach, shopping and restaurants - we didn’t once need a taxi during our stay, we could get everywhere on foot - this is the best place for couples or friends to stay without kids - recommend to all

Nice modern hotel, located in a great central spot in Waikiki. Only issue is noisy at night if in pool side room. Good bar and food area. Pool ok, little bit small. The ground floor pool side rooms ok, aside from the noise of an evening, and lack of privacy from other pool guests.Id recommend a short stay if wanting to see or fo lots in Waikiki.

If you don't mind being a SMIDGE off the beach, this is in a good location for shopping & restaurants. The BEST thing about this hotel, though, was the staff. I was very pleasantly surprised when we picked up the car from the valet very early in the morning and they loaded us up with beach supplies - chairs, towels, boogie boards - everything we needed for a great day on the North Shore! I've never had a hotel do that for us before & we loved it. Anything else we needed (toothbrush, extra towels) was delivered promptly. We didn't have a chance to check out the bar area, but it looked & sounded great. The pool area also looked cool.

We made our reservation at the Lay Low on fairly short notice and I was encouraged by the mostly positive reviews I found before booking. I would say this hotel met our families needs but we were far from blown away. The staff were all very friendly and had lots of smiles for their guests. Our room was large, comfortable and clean. The Hideout restaurant and bar has a nice atmosphere and very good food at prices that were on par with other similar establishments in the area. The hotel has a great location a couple block walk to the beach and tons of shopping and restaurant choices also within a couple blocks. This is an urban area though so peace and quiet is not happening. Live music, party goers and sirens punctuate the evening hours. The room sound proofing was very good so we could not hear our neighbors or hall noise but even on the 11th floor we could here music through the closed balcony door. Light sleepers will want white noise or earplugs or something. The views from the hotel are also urban, parking garages, shopping malls and other hotels are more prevalent than ocean and mountain view. I find it annoying that "fancier" hotels provide less for their guests than lower end hotels of the same brand. You won't find in room coffee or basic coffee available in the lobby without a hefty price tag. The top two executive floors have a coffee machine for guests of those floors. Since there is no real executive lounge gold/platinum members get a daily credit to the Hideout that will most likely leave you with out of pocket expense if you want to use it. There is no business center but the front desk will print boarding passes for you. We never got our internet service working correctly. We couldn't use the Hideout patio seating off the lobby to have our daughter eat a Subway sandwich because it is part of the bar so they wouldn't allow outside food. The $29 a day resort fee is absolutely ridiculous. This is a hotel and not a resort. I've been to many Marriott resorts and this hotel does not have even a small percentage of the amenities and activities available at an actual resort. The least pleasant part of our stay was the couple of days that the hallway on floor 11 smelled like a wet dog (or worse.) I don't know if something terrible happened to the carpet or they cleaned it as part of routine maintenance but I saw a staff member shampooing it and until it completely dried out it was gag worthy. Not what one expects from a nice hotel. We didn't even bother complaining as the couple of small things we had asked for like an extra blanket the first night were never taken care of. We stayed for 7 nights. We are loyal to the Marriott brand but I doubt we would choose this property again. We were expecting a 4+ star experience but it was just average.

Just stayed at the Laylow hotel! The hotel was centrally located as it was facing Kuhio Avenue instead of the busy Kalakaua Avenue, and within walking distance to shopping areas, markets and restaurants Highly recommend eating breakfast at the Hideout as we tried most of the items and they were all delicious. Hideout bar was also great, which included great drinks and live music. Gave them a 4 star as we mentioned during our booking that we were celebrating our anniversary and they didn’t do anything special.

I really wanted to like this hotel. My friend and I make an annual trip to Oahu for Memorial Day and were looking forward to staying at the laylow. Unfortunately the hotel did not meet out expectations. I'll start with the positives:The renovation they underwent last year turned out really nice on the physical spaces, especially the bar area down stairs and the "midcentury" touches in the rooms. The shave ice (covered by destination fee) was goodThe hotel is next door to the international marketplace and a very easy walk to the beach.The Welcome basket was nice (also covered by destination fee)The toiletries were niceUnfortunately the night club across the street is super loud and they don't close until 4 in the morning. We got woken up a couple nights at their closing time, once because patrons were fighting with cops and once because the music is so loudThe views from the rooms are not great. If you are on a high enough floor you can see a pocket of ocean, but if you are below the 10th floor you will have a view of a parking lot. The reception area is very small so we had to wait a bit to have a couple of issues fixed.I'm not too fussy with the gold elite stuff but they offer extra points or a $30/room credit for breakfast which if you're traveling in a pair will likely leave you having to go out of pocket if you want to eat at the restaurant for breakfast. The destination fee also includes "frozen poolside treats" which was literally a single frozen grape for us. The pool area was not cleaned regularly either. The remainder of someone's lunch was left out for almost 2 hours with nobody taking it. It's a decent value, especially if you are a AAA member and maybe if you don't mind some noise and a small pool it could be worth it but there are definitely better options.

Thoroughly loved our stay here, our room was in the higher floors with 2 balconies (1 facing the main street and the other faced the side but had water views of Waikiki beach in the distance).They have activities during the day that make your stay more fun, eg the snowcone; and their bar restaurant area has live music each night. The bar restaurant is a little oasis in the main street and open nearly 24/7.

I am a traveler with discerning tastes. I very much appreciated: - Central location 3 doors from the International Market Place. - Humongous guest room. - Nice welcome basket. - Extremely clean (I pulled all the sheets/covers off and inspected down to the mattress) -- white, clean no dust, no bedbugs or other critters. Beach towels for borrowing at no fee. - Smart fridge. - Big flat screen. - The shower is large enough for 2. Water is hot, good pressure, the shower head is adjustable. - Quality toiletries products (I used with no side effects on my sensitive skin and face).- Very quiet (I didn't see many families, which I appreciated as a solo traveler).To be improved:- Air conditioning in my unit would not stay on auto, so I was up and down for both nights to adjust.- The carpets in the hall and elevator could use a good cleaning (not dirty or smelly but dingy for sure).- The lighting is not good at all. Too dark in the room even with all the lights. Also, the lamp on the bedside table needs to be replaced. It's so cool it's not functional.- The walls in the room also needed to be cleaned.- No in-room coffee or tea maker.- No bathtub. :(All rooms in all hotels were over $200/night during my time there. I was blessed to get it for less than $200. I wouldn't pay more than $150 if I visited again.I might try another hotel when I went again.

Located in Waikiki, about a 10-min walk from the beach. That in itself will add $25 / day of "transient tax" to your bill, besides the resort tax of $29/day. The latter gives you access to wifi, the pool, and a basket of goodies, which is not worth $10. The basket comes with 2 bottles of water, which are NOT replenished everyday. I thought for a $29 a day resort fee that was unacceptable. Staff are friendly. Reception desk is really small so it can get backed up really easy. Room was on the small side, bed was comfortable though the mattress needs to be replaced. AC works well. Safe and small fridge in room. No slippers, robes or coffee/tea available in room. Bathroom was ok, toiletries were fine, nice towels and nice shower though the pressure was low. My room had a view to a parking structure and I could hear loud live music every night coming from the mall next door. Restaurant has happy hour everyday. Wine I was served had gone bad so they had to change it, which was not a problem. Food was nice. The mall next door has good local fast food and nice restaurants on the third floor. Not a bad place to stay but for the price and added fees it could certainly do more for the guests, that's why I'm giving an average rating.

The hotel itself is beautiful and the rooms are great. They are modern and close to everything. The key negative was that they stuffed up my laundry so when I got it back it wasn’t cleaned. Wouldn’t have been a big deal but I’d sent out all my clothes as we had just landed in Honolulu from 2 weeks in Japan and I needed my clothing washed. Manager stated they wouldn’t charge me but I did get charged and I didn’t have the time to tell the front counter I wasn’t meant to be billed I needed to get to the airport. Would I stay there again? Probably..

We stayed two nights following a cruise. As we arrived quite early in the morning our room was not ready until mid-afternoon but they stored our luggage for us. Our room was on the 12th floor with a tiny balcony from which we could see the ocean in the distance. We also looked over the car park next door which was fine as we were above the parked cars.The room was lovely and had some quirky additions that others have mentioned, ie the basket of goodies with chips, fruit chews, flip flops and a rubber duckie! The bed was comfortable but very low to the floor and the bathroom well equipped. The smart TV was huge and provided all services you might need. I found a wonderful Mark Twain book on Hawaii in the bookshelf and knew two days would not be enough time to read it and sightsee as well. I asked if I might buy the book and the shop downstairs willingly obliged. What a treat! He's written so many fabulous travel books. There were a number of other articles available for sale in the shop too.The bar and coffee shop near Reception was attractive, bright and airy but service was a bit slow. especially when we only ordered coffee. The pool looked inviting but we didn't swim. The location of the Laylow is great! Two blocks from Waikiki beach, an easy walk. The surrounding shops and restaurants are great with such a variety to choose from. Dukes Lane market is worth a look then continue across the road and down to the beach. The International Marketplace is also nearby. Buses to Ala Moana Mall are close by on Kuhio Avenue and are frequent. We were impressed with Laylow and knew we made the right decision to stay here. We would stay again.

Location was great, right beside a shopping mall and Nordstrom Rack. There are restaurants around, famous Udon place right across the street. A few blocks away from Waikiki Beach. The staff was awesome, help us plan a Luau and car rental to drive around the island. The room had a cool vibe, they provide some local snacks and flip-flops. There are coffee and snacks in the hall by the elevators. They have live music almost every night at the bar, the coffee bar was quite nice as well.

My wife and I stayed at the Laylow off Waikiki for our honeymoon. The check-in process was quick and we were in our room on the 10th floor quickly. The lobby/pool/restaurant area of the hotel is located above the street level so the hotel is hidden from the sidewalk except for the valet (which can make it more difficult for Uber/Lyft drivers to find, but it wasn't ever an issue during the day). Our room was opposite of the pool and faced a parking structure. Both sides of the hotel face parking, but if you stay poolside and on a high floor you may have some partial ocean views. We did not care for the 10th Floor room as it was pretty noisy from Duke's Lane so after our first night we asked the front desk if there were any poolside rooms available, and they had a room on the Executive Level (floors 15 and 16) which include coffee, water and snacks. We told the front desk we were celebrating our honeymoon and they upgraded us to the executive level. Our new room was on the 16th floor facing the pool and had a great partial view of the ocean. The snacks and filtered water available were also great; each morning there was a new breakfast item available (cinnamon rolls, chocolate croissants, ect) with orange juice, snacks in the afternoon and cookies in the evening. The pool is very nice (although we didn't spend much time there with all the great beaches in Oahu!), but it was nice to get back and spend a few minutes relaxing in the warm salt water. The pool closes at 10pm and after 8pm it's more difficult to get towels (ask the front desk). The towels came in handy during the trip as we just checked out 2-4 each morning, took them to the beach and returned them each evening. The hotel staff was always very friendly and accommodating. When we switched rooms we forgot we had left a couple of items in a drawer and the staff went and grabbed them and kept them at the front desk until we returned from the beach. They also moved our packed bags to our new room for us, and has champagne and flower petals in our new room which was a great surprise! Each room gets a welcome basket upon check-in, which had sandals, chocolate, hi-chew candy chips and water. One final suggestion I'll make relates to the $50 credit you get to use for activities through the hotel's concierge - we sat with him and went through some options for the credit but they were all very expensive. In particular, we were planning to go to the Pearl Harbor memorial and the hotel option was an all-day deal with trips to all 4 pearl harbor sites and was much more expensive than what it costs to do the self-guided tours at each of the 4 locations. We ended up taking an Uber, going to the Arizona Memorial, USS Missouri and USS Bowfin for less than $100, and didn't take an entire day! Overall the hotel experience was excellent and we'd highly recommend it! It was great staying close to Waikiki while staying somewhat secluded.

Visiting Honolulu for the first time, I was pleased with The Laylow (Autograph Collection) as our home base for the week. The front desk staff provided great service and we truly enjoyed the evening entertainment at the Hideout restaurant. The hotel is centrally located in Waikiki near all the major shopping destination and just a short walk to the beach. The next time I come to Hawaii, I will definitely stay here.

We just checked in and I am writing this review from the hotel room. We booked a junior suite on Expedia for three nights. We decided to book a suite because we wanted a bigger, nicer room. We were given room 601, right next to the elevator, with a view of the parking garage next door. When we mentioned that to the front desk, they said all the junior suites are next to the elevator. Um....okay, that’s really lame and stupid. It would be helpful if they mention that on the website somewhere or give us the option of being in a non elevator suite. We heard a constant loud hum in the room, but couldn’t locate where it’s coming from. Could be the elevator, hard to tell. The hum is still there even when we are in the hallway, so it isn’t just our room. We called the front desk telling them the issue, they said they will send an engineer up and see what the issue is. I don’t know if the engineer actually came, because we left the room shortly after to go to the beach. When we came back a few hours later, the hum was still here. We went to the front desk and couldn’t locate the gentlemen that told us about sending an engineer earlier. So we talked to the lady at the front desk about the issue. No help from her. She treated us as if we are trying to stay here on points and didn’t deserve their attention and help. She gave us two options, we could downgrade to a normal room, but we wouldn’t get the difference in price back or any other form of credits. Or we could pay extra to upgrade to the corner suite. It was very frustrating because we were not trying to get a free upgrade here! We wanted a room that we could sleep in, without a loud and constant hum. And we wanted what we paid for. They basically want us to pay extra to solve a problem that is ENTIRELY, 100% on the hotel. The front desk staff were totally unhelpful. Are they new? I don’t know. Maybe they are trainees. But they didn’t act like they are in the hospitality business. Anyway, we ended up paying extra to upgrade to a non elevator suite in the corner on the 12th floor. The new suite is very nice and doesn’t face the garage and doesn’t have a constant loud hum. Also we had better treatment at the Hyatt we stayed earlier on points. Very disappointing so far and I have three nights to go. Hopefully no issues come up, I don’t want to deal with the front desks people again.

Two king size beds, very rare! And this is perfect for family trip! The bed is a bit on soft side, but no complaint about the size! One Ukulele in each room, and a good one, my two sons had a lot of fun with it. A welcome package on arrival, two bottle of waters, two pairs of flip flop, a pack of chips, a small pack of chocolate, a cute bath duck.Free shave ice at 1pm is a plus, taste very good. We enjoyed it every day. The pool is pretty small, but the lounge chair in the water is fun, my younger son had fun sliding down from it to the pool. If you want more sunshine, be there before 3PM. Nice location, center to everything in Waikiki, to the beach, to the shopping center, to ABC store (right next door), to restaurant (the popular udon noodle restaurant is right across the street). A few cons:1. Almost no place to hang stuff in the bathroom, no hooks.2. Pretty loud music at night but will stop around 10. Sound proof of the room is very good, could hardly hear any neighbors. 3. No good views from the balcony (we are facing a parking structure), on Sunday, we did see reflection of the firework on a glass wall LOL.All in all, a very good stay and sure will come back again!

We absolutely loved our stay at the Laylow, the decor and ambience were amazing and it really is tucked away from the world, so it seems.Some highlights from our stay were our welcome basket - I needed the new flip flops too - the free bike rentals - the frozen fruit served around the pool, the late night entertainment at the hideout, and the mocktails by the pool.The rooms and beds are super comfy, we enjoyed our stay and the staff were super friendly. The coffee shop downstairs can hook you up in the am, but please note, the food and drinks are a little pricey.Was a little disappointed at the size of the pool, but once you get to location, it makes since! The cabanas are cute, and they have chairs in the water, which is awesome!The location is within walking distance some cool spots and easily gets to the beach. Since you can check out the bikes, you can go to the park too! They even have an expedia travel guide in house to help you plan any adventures during your stay! All in all - it was a great location, and great visit! Thank you!

Well what a great hotel for families in Waikiki. Could not recommend it higher if you want a great value, family style, hipster, refurbished, close to the beach hotel. Awesome staff from check in to check out. Rooms (corner suites) are large for a hotel that can be configured for four people, two adults and two children. Breakfast and meals superb as is the coffee. Close to lots of shopping and a shower trip to the beach. Love this place and would be back if we get the chance.

This hotel has a great location and the overall experience was quite good, but it could be great if it made some key improvements. First of all, wifi was terrible. I never was able to get speed of more than 1Mbps, which is not fast enough to do normal browsing. Ironically, I kept getting a message saying that I was at the “highest speed” for wifi as a result of my Gold status, so I can’t imagine the poor people suffering from even slower speed. For a cool hotel seeking people who want to relax, fast wifi is absolutely critical. Neighboring shopping malls had much better connections. I had a large, well-designed room, but there were a few big problems. The bed was way too soft. The shower pressure was weak and the shower head angle could not be adjusted. When I first checked in, the air conditioning was way too strong and couldn’t be adjusted, so maintenance had to come in and fix it. The front desk did not have a fax, so I had to go to a local UPS store, which is inexcusable. The restaurant design and layout were really suitable to relaxing, but the coffee was terrible and the breakfast menu could be much better. Finally, there was no laundry/dry cleaning service on Sunday. This is terrible for an upscale hotel. If only they would fix all of these problems, I would strongly recommend this hotel.

I can’t recommend this hotel enough. The rooms are newly refurbished, clean and modern with a great balcony. The restaurant bar area is dreamy, with great food and live music every night. Located right next to the International Market Place, it’s a quick walk to the beach. Staff were super helpful. Coffee bar was open really early which was great when we had activities with an early start. A++ with nothing negative to note at all! Thanks The Laylow - we will be back!

Nothing to complain about. Rooms clean and quiet. Car Valet quick if you order by phone. I enjoyed having a playable ukulele in the room and the book on Hawaii modern architecture was very interesting.

This is not a good hotel to stay at.I checked in on a Sunday night with an upset stomach. To my surprise, in the middle of the night after a visit to the bathroom, I discovered that the water was no longer working.Upon stepping outside to talk to the front desk, I noticed a note on the door about scheduled water shutdown maintenance for five more hours. Given that this is scheduled maintenance, the fact that they did not note this during check-in indicated a deliberate managerial decision to hide this from guests.The front desk was even more callous and unsympathetic. When I noted that I had an upset stomach, they did not offer bottled water, they did not offer alternate accommodations, nor did they even offer an apology. They simply said 'don't flush.'This is the most disrespectful thing that has ever been said to me by hotel staff. Because if someone has an upset stomach and cannot flush the toilet, you are basically asking them to vomit into a toilet full of their own diarrhea. They had a choice to try to make the situation right, and the option they selected was 'don't flush.'I would not recommend this hotel. It is impossible to imagine that they genuinely care about the quality of your stay given that they don't even care if you are living in sanitary conditions.
user_name:
myt1320
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: We spent one night here with our two teenage boys and the hotel was very much enjoyed by all. It has a very cool relaxed vibe without being pretentious and the staff are lovely. The room had two comfortable kingsize beds , great welcome basket, lovely bathroom and quiet air con. The only thing missing was tea/coffee in the room but there's a lovely area downstairs to get great coffee. Rooms were very quiet considering the hotel is right in amongst it all. Dont stay here if you want amazing views as rooms have an urban outlook, but do stay here if you want a calm oasis amongst the madness! Amazing location for eating / shopping /transport and one block back from the beach.

Really nice place and great location. Next to the International Market for shopping and food. You can walk to many restaurants, beach and shopping from here. The food/bar at the hotel is good too. Only one grumpy waitress but the rest were excellent here. A place to keep in mind for fellow Marriott Vacation Owners.

Absolutely gorgeous hotel, five minutes walk from Waikiki beach. Rooms are huge and clean (loved the cool wooden walls in the shower!), the bar has a great service and very good cocktails. Special mention for the reception guys, always helpful, and for Meena who helped us organising our excursions in the best possibile way.

After previously staying in a large branded hotel on the beach we opted for here. It’s one block back and it was a great choice. The room was very thoughtfully done, very clean and a good size (2 king beds). The staff were really helpful and the atmosphere is nice and relaxed. The bar has a cool vibe and great selection of local beers. The coffee is also great and the flat white was as good as you’ll get in NZ and a welcome change from the typical watery drip coffee elsewhere! Would definitely stay again!

Stayed here since we found it in the Marriott portfolio, hadn't been there (we have business in Honolulu about once a year), it looked fun/different and said it was recently renovated. Had a great stay.1. Staff. Super friendly and welcoming. 2. Atmosphere. Not something we normally pay much attention to, or seek out. Yet clearly this place seeks to feel lively. The pool is "cool" enough for young adults, without being off-putting to families or older folks. So it's not a crazy party atmosphere, yet it's alive. The retro furnishing feed the feel of the place.3. Room. Our opinion is definitely influenced by the free upgrade based upon Marriott status. Wow. Huge corner suite room. We did not pay attention to how many it is permitted to sleep, yet 5 would be easy. King bed, queen futon, and a sofa. And a small dining table, and plenty of closet space. Very new, sleek bathroom with walk-in shower. Mini-fridge (although one of those hotel types where you can't adjust the temp/stays at about 42 degrees...fine for beer, maybe not cold enough for some foods). Super clean and fresh/in great repair.4. Welcome basket. Lots of reviews note this. It is a nice touch. 5. Location. Since we are there for business, we prefer Kuhio Ave or the side streets to the noise of Kaulakau Ave. Hotel is directly across the street from the super popular Udon place that has lines out the door most of the day. Easy walk to anywhere in Waikiki. Minor Con's:1. (Noise). IF one is a light sleeper, perhaps the live music from the restaurant/bar or pool could annoy you. Band is done by 10 Su-Th; and midnight Fri and Sat. I was one floor above the bar, with a lanai overlooking the bar area. I could hear the music, yet slept just fine. A friend had a room overlooking the pool, and noted the live music was fairly audible there too. Didn't bother us, yet can see how some might not like it. If that's the case, ask for a room on the opposite side from the pool (you'll be looking at a pedestrian alley, yet should be quiet....trade the cool pool view for less noise).2. Resort fee. So this is clearly advertised so its not a surprise. It's just a pet peeve of ours. Just charge what you need to for the room, period. Travelers get hit with so many add on fees (layers of lodging taxes, layers of rental car taxes), a resort fee feels like a gouge, whereas, it if was in the room rate, we'd never know. Management ties the fee to the welcome basket, and some freebies poolside during the day (which we don't use, and imagine few guests do....who travels to Hawaii to be sitting around the pool at noon...guests are touring the island, at the beach, etc). Neutral observations. 1. For Marriott gold/platinum, if the room upgrade is available, it's a huge perk. Didn't look up the rack rate difference in cost for the corner suite, yet it's clearly a much larger room. The hotel also offers a $15/day restaurant credit or 750/day in bongo points. We had a great stay and will hope they have vacancy for our next trip. Mahalo.

Totally in love with our stay at this hotel over spring break, it was my first time in Hawaii so I had high hopes and expectations and this hotel met them all! The hotel is retro, the decoration is so pretty everywhere, every corner is photo-worthy. Hawaiians are such sweet and friendly and cheerful people, I totally fell in love with the staff at this hotel. We had such a romantic and wonderful time, I cant say enough good things!

I always stay in luxury hotels whenever I travel, I have spent 2 nights in this hotel and I loved it! It definitely is a Marriott brand property. The hotel's approximately 10 minutes walk from Waikiki beach itself and is very convenient to shopping and restaurant areas. I definitely recommend this place, and would definitely go back for their welcome basket waiting for you in the room. :) A 5* service shout out for Hokulani!!!

Laylow Waikiki is simply amazing, we are 2 days into our stay and so glad we chose The Laylow. Its all the little touches that make this boutiqe Hotel great.Right next door to The International Market Place.Highly recommend Executive level room with complimentary Coffee fresh fruit and daily baked pastries.Food at Hideout is awesome too. Rooms are well appointed clean and beds are very comfortable.Balcony is also a bonus. Loving the Laylow.

Great little hotel. Nice staff, good bar and faciliites, overall clean and tidy. Good location. Lovely welcome basket in the room. Rooms very well appointed. Would stay here again in a heart beat. Only comment would be that the room doors need to have a soft close put on them - can be very noisey with doors slamming.

This is one of the nicest hotels we have stayed in. Highly recommend it! Location is perfect, staff was friendly and helpful, allowing us to check in early and upgrading us to a corner suite. They offer free shave ice from 1-2, and they're delicious. The room is fun, cute, and very clean. Bed is so soft! Nice robes.There was a basket of goodies in our room that included his and hers flip flops, chips, water, candy, cookies, post cards, and a rubber ducky! Interesting books in the room about Hawaii and it's history, myths, etc. The complimentary bath products smell amazing!! I asked if they sold them and they don't, but generously offered to send a few more of each up to our room. Our suite has 2 balconies, one facing the ocean and one on the other side looking down to the pool. Shopping close by is plentiful, might wanna bring an extra suitcase. Haha. I usually don't write reviews, but I loved this place so much I had to.

We stayed at The Laylow post cruise of the Hawaiian Islands. The hotel and staff are outstanding. The hotel is very new with hip/ bohemian boutique style accommodation. Two blocks from Waikiki Beach, you are around the corner from the International Market place. A coffee/ cafe is housed on site. DJ/ Live music is played at night till midnight on the outside terrace around a fire pit.

My experience at the Laylow was positive. The rooms were pristine and sizeable and the beds very comfortable. As a relatively young hotel (it celebrated its 1st birthday during my stay), it is modern and tasteful. Because it is not on the main strip, but only 1 street behind it, it wasn't run mad with guests and passers-through. Very much appreciated that the cafe is staffed from a ridiculously early hour allowing coffee to be purchased prior to setting out early for Oahu exploration. I highly recommend the Laylow for its service, ambiance, cleanliness, location and convenience.

The Laylow was a welcome surprise when we checked in. The rooms are bright and clean, modern bathrooms was a plus!Glass wine /beer fridge in room. No tea making facilities.The pool area is great, and you are well looked after with offerings of free non alcohol cocktails, shaved flavored ice, and other things.Their restaurant and bar area is fabulous, and staff are very friendly. You are next door to ABC shop for buying your water or bits and pieces you may require- medications, chips snacks etc.About 4 doors down is the new international market shopping center, which is full of amazing stores and restaurants up stairs. This leads through to the main shopping strip.It’s a short walk to,the beach.Each room has a ukulele and free lessons are given 3 nights a week at the pretty outdoor bar area.I was very impressed with this hotel and plan to be going back there on my next visit. ( my 6th).

We spent two weekends in Honolulu as a family of 4 (kids 15 and 9), was a stopover to Maui. The hotel has a retro feel that is fun to spend time around vs looking to get in and out quick. The crowd in the Hideout (hotel bar/restaurant) was a good mix and lively - all ages, families, couples, parties - very fun. The staff working the bar/restaurant were very friendly, especially at 4am at the coffee bar - thank you! The Laylow was an excellent choice, the room with 2 queen beds worked very well. We had no problem with noise in the room, very clean hotel despite being close to the beach. On one weekend, 1 of 2 elevators was malfunctioning creating massive delays up and down - would expect after a $60 million (amount quoted in newspaper) renovation this would not be the case - the staff could have acknowledged this a bit better, desk staff seemed irritated when it was mentioned morning of March 28 (overall small thing given the rest). Concierge evening of March 26 was very helpful. The renovation itself is excellent.

Great little newly renovated boutique hotel in the heart of Waikiki. Right around the corner from International Marketplace, Waikiki Shopping Plaza and the Royal Hawaiian hotel. Nice staff, great pool, fun little treats throughout the day.

Location can't be beat. Super convenient right on Kuhio next to International Market Place. Rooms can be loud due to live music both from lobby and from international market place. Issue with housekeeping. Hotel has been open less than a year and room are already stained on the carpet and sofas in multiple rooms. Assistant Manager was very helpful in helping me find a cleaner room.

We really enjoyed this hotel... it is in a great location. Close to everything.. the rooms were great! We had a king bed with a queen and twin day bed.. the pool is located by the lobby. It is a smaller pool but nice. No views from the rooms Would stay here again!!

We saw the Laylow on our last trip to Waikiki, and enjoyed she rooftop bar. For this trip, we took a room with our son who is 10. Grearmiscentury modern style with a hint of vintage aloha. They have roots in Post modern Waikiki it brought up the style quite a bit!We loved our very comfortable double king room the only exceptions the loud dragging of furniture that woke up every morning from 5:30-6:30am Pool was chic and we love the other amenities too. Also loved the caring service.Locations everything! We will be back, and won't stay in 312, hopefully a quieter room.

We stayed at the Lay Low for 10 nights. The hotel is about a year old and is centrally located beside the new International Market on Kuhio. Kuhio has improved a lot with the new development. The hotel staff was excellent. The rooms are clean and modern with touches of old 70's design which was very nice. The pool is smaller but great for kids as it is only 3ft deep. Restaurant is nice and has live music most of the week. The only negative is expensive parking at $35/night.

I recently stayed at the Laylow and wow - what a cool, friendly place! Located a block away from the beach and in the middle of great shopping, the Laylow offers a fresh stay in Honolulu. The hotel was recently renovated with Hawaiian flair and wonderfully, 1 or 2 king-size bed(s) in each room. As a lifetime platinum MARRIOTT member, I was offered a $15 voucher per person per day at the Hideout, their onsite restaurant. The Hideout has a very cool vibe and delicious food. Over the course of my stay, I enjoyed the Loco Moco, Omelette and Mac nut pancakes. Would eat again and again! Great service and special kudos to Kirtus, Jeffrey, and his team! Best Marriott or SPG property in Hawaii!

Such a nice little hotel. We really enjoyed this hotel and it's location. The rooms are nice and they have a fun little gift basket full of treats. The bed and pillows were AMAZING! I would definitely stay there again!

Robert and his team have turned this property around since its acquisition like nothing else. As a seasoned traveler I have highest expectations which were fully met by the attentive and friendly staff that went beyond to make my stay as pleasant as it could be. Unlike the many dated properties in HNL the Laylow encapsulates its guests in a warm and friendly blanket of hospitality while staying professional, classy and modern at all times. Coming from California the breakfast choices felt like home, the artisan barista beats any Starbucks and the complimentary drink tastings at the pool want you to stay forever.

This was a very clean and updated hotel, with very comfortable beds. The staff were very accommodating and respectful. The location is nice, despite being a couple blocks from Waikiki beach, with many food options close by, including the in-hotel restaurant, which offers great food at market-competitive prices. We would gladly stay here again.There is a beautiful pool on the main level of the hotel, but it only gets a few ours of sun during the day (most of the time the sun is blocked by nearby buildings).In addition, they have some very well thought-out accessible rooms. Although we did not require this type of accommodation ourselves, it was refreshing to see such accessible rooms available to those that may require it. This includes: wheelchair friendly rooms (low counters, wheel-in unobstructed shower, lower level shelves, wheelchair-height peephole, accessible transition to balcony) and rooms buzzers which activate lights for hearing impaired guests. (see photos)

We really enjoyed our 6 day stay. The outstanding feature was the incredibly friendly and competent staff. In particular Hicham Elazzouzi of the front office. He seemed to be everywhere on many occasions helping guests from his station at the front office to assisting the valet and on one occasion the housekeeping staff. Gabriella and Richard in the travel office were also very helpful.

Very nice Marriott hotel in the middle of Waikiki- great comfortable beds and updated modern baths. Great drip coffee at bar in the morning and superb lemon drop martini at the bar at night. Recommend

I happen to stumble upon this place because I was interested in seeing the hotel. Very urban! Food, service and staff was awesome. You would never know that you are directly above the street. I will go back. They had a DJ as well.

We booked this hotel last minute, for the last night of our one week visit to the North Shore, where we had been in an airbnb flat. We loved this funky boutique hotel, so close to the action of Waikiki. The beds and rooms were very comfortable with high-end linens and amenities and we slept great. We will definitely look to stay here again if we need a hotel near Waikiki for a night or two.

This hotel was a lovely little boutique hotel. Staff were friendly, rooms were nice, it was a great location and had a great bar connected to the hotel with live entertainment. Some minor downsides;- upon our arrival, at about 7.30am local time, we were greeted by about 4 boys who helped us get our bags out of the taxi, they stated they’d bring our bags up if we were about to check in. It was still early, there were no other guests around. We checked in with no issues and were informed our bags would be brought up. We had to call reception about 4 times and at least an hour later our bags were finally brought up. We were very unsure what took so long as it was early in the morning and the boys were just standing around when we arrived- we paid for an “ocean view” room. Based on the location of this hotel I was skeptical as to how an ocean view was possible - I thought a partial ocean view perhaps would be a better title. Our room had a very very very minimal view of the sea. If we weren’t so tired and jet lagged I would have contacted reception stating it wasn’t an ocean view room at all, rather a view of a carpark with a tiny bit of ocean. But after waiting 1+ hour for our bags I wasn’t in the mood- housekeeping was poor. They attended to our room each day, however they did not change our sheets. 4 days in we requested with reception that our sheets be changed. Reception was surprised this hadn’t been done, and wrote a note requesting it be done the next day. The next day passed and still no sheet change. Once again we spoke with reception. The next day and still no sheet change, this is 6 days in to our 10 day stay. We don’t expect fresh sheets daily but in a 4 star hotel we’d expect a couple of sheet changes. The next day two of us were in the room when house keeping came around and we had to ask them to change the sheets, they obviously weren’t impressed with this- the pool was a little small for the size of the hotel, and it was very shallow. Coming up to about my waist at best. Nonetheless it was pleasant, had some comfortable seating and each day there was a complimentary pool drink as well as shaved ice Overall a pleasant hotel, very funky however some room for improvement!

I had to book a room at the last minute and chose this property based on the operator that picked up the phone. She was much more pleasant than when I called Waikiki Marriott property. Upon my arrival my company credit card had a hold on my card and I was almost not able to check in. With already having a hard time before arrival with transportstion and flying with a cold, I was miserable. Alyssa at the front desk was AMAZING. I could not believe the length of time she soent on me and how attentive she was to get me in in my room. She was SO patient while I was trying to sort it out with my company and offered to speak with her manager and gave me additional options. She could have easily pushed me off the side or not deal with me but she didn't. I really appreciate this. When I travel or shop, it's all about the service for me. Thank you to the manager in back for making it possible for me to stay. As I walked out my last day I thanked the staff (different staff) but really want the property manager to know that this meant a whole lot. I recommend this property. The location is great and the staff from the housekeepers, front desk and bell boy were all amazing. Hope I get a change to stay with you guys again. Thank you for the cool basket!

I booked a cabana room to have easy access to the pool. The description on Marriott.com listed "pool cabana" as part of the room. When we arrived, we found out that the cabana wasn't a reserved cabana but rather a hanging chair on the balcony that wasn't private. While they were supposed to be for our use, people could easily walk over to them and use them, and did. The hotel can argue the definition of cabana, but I think most people would expect an actual cabana over a hanging chair the way it's advertised. The real lay down cabanas at the pool, which there were only two, were first come first served and were not included in the room as described. I consider the advertising to be misleading, so understand it's a hanging chair that they're calling a cabana, and it's not private, outside of the hotel potentially putting a "reserved' sign on them which people ignored. We had some other problems with the locks on the sliding doors and ended up changing rooms. The locks were not working properly, and we ended up having engineering coming into the room. After they worked on it for about 30 minutes, we decided to change rooms. My partner cut his finger on the door, so we were just ready to move. The hotel moved us to a 2 bedroom king room on the 11th floor but offered no refund or compensation for my partner's bleeding knuckle. While the manager on duty did initially say they would do something, he spoke to the general manager and came back and changed the story. They gave us bandaids and offered only to file an accident report. While I understand insurance is the issue, they should have simply made a gesture of a rate decrease or a drink, just something to smooth out the experience. We found the resolution to be inadequate and cold. I'm a Platinum Elite member with Marriott, so I expected them to handle it better. Other comments about Platinum Elite benefits are spot on. Don't expect to be upgraded and expect a $15.00 food and beverage credit per day per person that can be applied over Club benefits or free breakfast. While the hotel has been remodeled and is a good location, I found it to be just average and the experience we had overall means I wouldn't recommend or return to this hotel. Having been to Waikiki many times, there are many other better options.

Stayed here for a business trip. The room was very nice and clean. My room faced a parking garage on top of a restaurant, which has live music until 9PM nightly, but did not impact me. The gift basket was a nice touch. The hotel is two blocks from the beach and in a good location for shopping and restaurants. The bar and lounge are reasonably priced. I didn’t use the pool, but it looked great!I will probably stay here again next time I travel here.Recommended!

We booked a last minute stay after a flood in our apartment forced us to move out. Hokulani was extremely helpful on the phone to help us know how to get the best rate; she also honestly answered questions about the suitability of this hotel for my family which I really appreciated. For example, I asked if the hotel was loud because I have small children; she said there was live music there for the weekend and that she would place us in a room higher up to minimize the noise. She followed through with a great room on the 9th floor and the opposite side from where the music was. The hotel has a nice feel, modern but classic Hawaii at the same time, with nice little perks (small gift basket in the room, shave ice for the kids, apple cider by the pool) and comfortable furnishings. It was great for our family. It's also nicely located in Waikiki near food options, walking distance to the beach, easy to find. My one criticism (which is not unique to this property) is the now prevalent practice of charging a 'resort fee' for a hotel. It's sort of like the bag fee when flying...it used to be part of the service of flying to check a bag for free; likewise, the resort fee I think goes for things that used to be standard (like expecting to be able to use a towel at the pool) - actually, I'm not even sure what it's for. But all in all, so happy with our choice of the Laylow and feeling so grateful we picked this property after our very stressful incident at our home. We will be back if we ever have need of a local hotel in the future.

Great stay in Waikiki at Marriott’s Laylow, Autograph Collection property. Excellent location just steps away from Duke’s Lane where there are no shortage of good restaurants and shopping available. The room was clean, spacious, and comfortable with hip furniture and modern decor. The restaurant at the hotel served great food for breakfast and dinner alike. The pool was a bit small for the property although the gym had just about everything one needs for a good workout which included an ample amount of free weights as well as aerobic equipment. Customer service there were superb in all areas of the hotel from checkin to checkout. Kudos go out to Sheila and Summer at the front desk as well as Edgar and Daisy in the restaurant. Everyone I came in contact was exceptionally professional, friendly, and helpful. I would highly recommend this hotel for couples and families alike.

I stumbled upon this gem while looking at Marriott hotels for our stay. It was a risk to stay here because I've stayed at several Marriott properties but never an 'autograph collection' one. Because of this property, I now fully trust the entire Autograph Collection line! From the very start, the open-air lobby blew our minds away. So stunning! The gift basket was a very nice surprise as well, and they even let us trade out our flip flops for better sizes! The location of the hotel was by far one of the best parts. We could walk anywhere for food or souvenirs or breakfast or to Waikiki beach!! And our teenagers could walk around safely while still staying very close to the hotel.The hotel staff, especially Patricia and Genesis, were extremely accommodating. She really prepared me for what to expect although I was still blown away.I did not pick this location for the pool, but my girls actually loved it. It's small but I think that's actually one of the reasons they loved it??And I was also surprised by the valet service! Not only did they ask us to schedule when our car is needed every day so we didn't have to call down, but they loaned us boogie boards and bikes! It was the PERFECT idea to stay downtown Waikiki and then travel out each day for excursions. The beds..... oh my goodness the beds.....LOVED the design of the rooms.We hung out at the 'Hideout' every evening! Open air hangout area where you can also grab drinks and food. It was so cozy with the fire pits and live music. And we could see the bustle of the street below yet feel calm and relaxed up on the second floor!If we stay on Oahu next year, I am hands down staying here again. Just hope all these good reviews dont increase their prices too much!!!

We stayed twice. On the way to New Zealand and on the way back from Bora Bora. The beds are extremely comfortable. We appreciated the snack basket with flip flops even! We were on the 15th floor and there was a drink/snack/ice area in the hall by the elevator. One morning there was ham/cheese croissants and another day there were fresh chocolate croissants. Delicious. It's really a subtle boutique hotel. Quick check-in...check-out. A short walk from all of the designer shops. Lovely stay.

Here for a 5 night stay to celebrate birthday. Upon check-in, they did acknowledge my platinum elite status and birthday celebration. However, there is no offer of any complimentary upgrades. There is no lounge access but instead provided $15 vouchers per person per night. They said that the executive level “lounge” is only available to guests staying at those level and not for any platinum members. My marriott profile has high floor listed as a preference. They gave me a room on the 9th floor (out of 16) and told me that it is a high floor. The $15 per person voucher barely covers the cost of an entree as half of the breakfast entrees are over $15. There is also this confusing line item added as a service charge which was explained to me as something internal between the hotel and servers whenever vouchers are used and is normally taken off the total cost of bill. But do double check to make sure it is not included as part of the total due. My recent stay at an autograph collection hotel in Miami (Turnberry Isle), free breakfast is actually “free” - includes beverages and tax gratuity is included. In this case, these vouchers are merely discounts. The one good thing is that you can use these vouchers for breakfast, lunch, or dinner but no alcoholic beverages. You just have to use it on the specific date listed on the voucher. The platinum arrival gift of $10 can be used during the stay and on alcohol. Don’t expect any freebies from hotel for birthday. No acknowledgement or anything. But that’s okay... I didn’t even bother to say anything. Valet parking per day is $35 plus tax. What they called “destination fee” is another $25 per day. Essentially what you are paying is the E Komo Mai basket, pool towels, and daily shaved ice. There are other daily poolside delights listed as perks, but they are often unavailable. I waited for the drink sample one day but was told they are not ready... I approached the front desk about it and they said they will bring it up to the food and beverage manager. The day before, the frozen fruit bites was a no show either. Don’t list amenities as part of the reason for this daily destination fee but then fail to deliver. Now despite these short comings, I do love the location of this hotel and proximity to great restaurants and shopping. The starbucks reserve and kona coffee purveyor is just a block away and the beach is a quick 5 mins walk. The valet attendants as well as the staff and servers are all really nice and attentive. The housekeeping service is efficient. The management just need to up the level if they want to entice ritz carlton/marriott/spg members to pick this hotel when visiting oahu.

This is a great, laid back boutique hotel in the heart of Waikiki, 2 blocks from the beach. We had a corner suit that was spacious and comfortable with 2 balconies. The hotel is new and modern. The pool area is small. The lobby has an open layout and opens to a patio/bar area that has a resort feel. Close to restaurants and shopping. The hotel staff is very pleasant and helpful. Overall, a great pick. Would recommend for both vacation and business stay.

Stayed here for a week with my family in February 2018. Executive summary: great place!Pros:Comfortable beds, spacious room, fluffy towels, very clean, bathrobes, friendly service, excellent location if you are looking for something not on beach front. Great insulation for noise reduction. In room systems are top notch. Extra touches that made it special: e komo mai gift basket, ukelele in room (mine was hopelessly out of tune, so I could not play it), shave ice every afternoonGreat coffee shop -would have liked more options than just pastries, I like some protein in morning- but they serve stumptown coffee, which is my favorite. They also start at 5 a.m., which is great when you are still on mainland time.The Hideout is a lovely bar and restaurant that goes from morning to night. Evenings are lively with entertainment and ukelele lessons and great cocktails.The pool is small but great, and the hanging chairs are cute and fun.More about location: everything you could possibly want is right outside, including groceries, an ABC, a mall with shopping, dining and a nightly mini luau. Buses go right by, and there is a food truck court and laundromat 1 block away. Waikiki beach is 1.5 blocks away. The hotel provides beach towels, so just grab one and go! Super fun and easy.Cons:Only a few tiny things that did not ruin anything, but that were slightly annoying: there are no hooks in the bathroom, and the elevators can be a bottleneck during busy times. No one likes resort fees, and the parking is $35 per day, valet only

This was probably my favorite hotel of a 2 week stay with two being at luxury resorts. I just loved the personality of the place, the food, drinks and service. The rooms were large we booked two rooms with double king beds literally unheard of. They were roomy enough the bath large enough only shower but that is usually what I use, modern and upscale sweet smelling amenities. The welcome basket an added bonus, loved the flip flops and food. Would have liked a coffee pot however got coupons to use in coffee, restaurant, bar area that could be used any time of the day for marriott status. Coffee was good at bistro, I like latte's and the fact it was pouring one morning was wonderful to just eat in. Breakfast was truly delicious we probably tried every morning entree with 5 of us in a 4 night period. Twice we ate dinner there while our adult children went someone else. Was really good especially the short rib and burger. Service each time was great for us.Happy hour is really great and discounted food and drinks we had them twice, great place to meet up with our friends. The spring rolls are especially good and the flat bread.There are so many shops and restaurants in the area and a short stroll to the beach, valet was on spot each time. The price of the rooms were really reasonable for a large city. They truly did a great remodel of the building, has a great modern vibe.The pool area is nice with comfy large lounges and we sat talking with friends most nights there. The fact they give you beach towels is also a plus!We all said if we come back we'd stay here again. Just a fabulous place.

Stayed here with 2 of my gfs for a girls trip. The hotel exceeded our expectations. I primarily chose it for the location (which is excellent by the way), but it was also an amazing hotel. There’s a cute welcome basket in the room when you first arrive. Also, it’s very well done with the decor and very clean and modern. The pool was small but appropriate for the area and they were serving free shaved ice when I was there. The location was excellent and we walked everywhere from our hotel. Overall, very impressed. Would stay here again and also recommend it to a friend.

We stayed here on the recommendation of friends. We arrived at 8am, we got early check in and a complimentary upgrade. They also accommodated our friends to be in the room next to us. Staff were welcoming, the room a generous size. View of car park but we weren't there to be in the room! Pool was divine we had no issues with getting a cabana, and poolside service was great. Breakfast was included and absolutely amazing. Cocktails are too good, and the firepit beside the bar is a stunning way to spend the evening. Contact the concierge before you arrive to arrange airport transport and activities (they sell out). We didn't, but the concierge made everything happen for us last minute anyway. Room was great, Netflix on tv a great way to unwind at night. Housekeeping was a little late in the day, but to be honest that is clutching at straws to find a fault. Location is amazing, right next to International Market Place and ABC store. It is an oasis amongst the hustle and bustle of the tourist strip. We will be back, cannot recommend this hotel highly enough!

This hotel was the true gem of our trip. Having been a loyal Marriott Rewards member for many years and with good status, we were lucky to receive an upgrade to a corner room on both stays of this particular trip. This room was slightly larger, and definitely one of the more "homely" hotel rooms I have ever experienced.The hotel had held three Amazon packages that had been delivered in the days before our arrival, and these were promptly put into our room after our check-in.The pool and the coffee shop are located on the first floor beside the reception, and they have a very pleasant feel to them. The busy main streets (Kuhio and Kalakaua) are literally down the escalator, but up here you feel removed from the hustle and the bustle.
