The staff are friendly and positive, and they are happy to assist with any request you may have.The GM and his management team have made a habit of being present in the lobby at various times during the day, and it is very easy to strike up a conversation, address concerns, or to give praise. On that latter note, I wanted to give a positive mention to Marianne in the coffee shop and to Stephanie at the front desk, they both went above and beyond in terms of personable service and making us feel welcome.In short, this hotel was an excellent find. It seems that the building had been a less desirable property prior to the renovation and subsequent opening as the Laylow Hotel. It is very clear that everyone at this property is now working hard to win the hearts and minds of those travelers who may be associating something more average with this address. I wish them success, and I can recommend this hotel wholeheartedly.

This hotel did not live up to my expectations. I understood where it was going, but it definitely needs improvement. When we arrived, there were no seats by the pool. We had to do a stake out to get a seat. The layout is poor and does not maximize use of the space. The hallways smelled terrible. The service in the restaurant was so slow. There is no assistance in getting to the airport. Essentially, this is a motel at a high end price. The only redeeming quality is the location.

THIS HOTEL WAS AMAZING!!!I literally can't say anything bad!!! The rooms WHERE BEAUTIFUL and TRENDY! Your instagram will love you for booking it! The staff where beyond amazing and accommodating the pool is perfect if you don't want to go to the beach but the beach is soooo close its about a 5 min walk! The restaurant and bar where amazing great great food and such a wicked vibe! The general manager of the restaurant was so nice and accommodating we have nothing but great things to say about him. The view from the room isnt the best, but we didn't pay for a room! but just go to the beach for an epic view and amazing sunsets! HAVE THE BEST TIME IF YOU BOOK THIS! YOU WILL NOT REGRET IT!

Aloha!Just returned from a lovely visit to Oahu in which I stayed 5 nights at this property. Upon arrival I was instantly impressed. The location is perfect. It's very modern, chic & put me in the mind of a "boutique" hotel. Gabby & Victoria are absolutely awesome!!! Also Milan, he works at the Hideout, is the bomb!  Now, there were some things that I had an issue with. The main one being the $25/day amenity fee. I knew upfront that I'd be paying this amenity fee, so it wasn't a shock once I checked in. However, I assumed it would have included a few bottled waters EVERY day...boy was I wrong! There was a cute little basket filled with goodies, flip flops & 2 bottled waters. That is all of the water you'll be getting from the property throughout your stay. I spent over $100 on the amenity fee and I feel like bottled water on a daily basis should have been included! Also, while the room does include a mini fridge it does not come with a microwave. I was okay with that too, once again I assumed that there was one available for guests to use in a "common/vending" area. Well I was wrong on that too. We spent a countless amount of money on food, brought back leftovers only to be told there was no where we could heat our food up. Laylow, please use some of the $25 amenity fee money to purchase a microwave for guests to use. The room also does not include a coffee maker, this wasn't a big deal because I don't drink coffee. However, I would've liked having something available to make hot tea in the evenings. The only resolution was to get hot water from the restaurant on site....what an inconvenience!Housekeeping ~ they definitely need to work on this! When I leave my room around 9am on a daily basis & don't return until well after 3pm, I expect to come back to my room being cleaned. I was there 5 nights/6 days...4 of those days I had to request housekeeping service. I just don't understand what they were doing, every time I saw the housekeeping crew they were in the hallways in clusters of 4-5 people. They need to do less socializing & more cleaning. That is ridiculous to charge what this property charges but not have their housekeeping up to par!All in all, I would give the Laylow another chance. I really hope that they pay attention to these reviews & consider making some changes that will result in this being the PERFECT property to stay at. (Hint, water every day & microwave in common area) Mahalo!

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. The entire staff crew were very friendly and made the stay great! The food is tasty at the hideout & we enjoyed a free breakfast with our hotel package ($50)per meal. The coffee is surprising good also ( we from melbourne so we know the best coffee ). The pool is nice, it lacks a bit of vibe but it’s pretty good and the water is quite warm. The rooms are comfortable ( except for the pillows). The rooms are also wheelchair friendly - for those with such requirements. Free flip flops on arrival. Well done!

I look at a lot of properties on trip advisor. I cross reference everything here. I almost didn’t stay at the Laylow because the guest pictures always look so dark and uninviting (I later came to figure out why), but after an Air BnB nightmare, it was close to where we were supposed to stay and they had a room available at the 13th hour. When we pulled up to the property it’s instantly appealing. From the friendly valet guys to the awesome tiki torches and music coming from the rooftop. Up the stairs to the super quaint lobby, with the ocean breeze coming in, the amazing pool and indoor swings. I was already in love. The front desk staff was so amazing. They always had good attitudes and helpful. Our room was on the 14th floor. We had a nice balcony with a slight view of the ocean and nice view of Diamond Head. The room was very well decorated and the lights were very warm and romantic (hints the pictures). There was also an amazing welcome basket full of goodies. Hideout: the food was to die for. We ate there at least once a day. You have to try the North Shore Crab cakes...help Jesus. Lol. And the rooftop patio makes you want to sip drinks and never leave. I wish I would have been able to take advantage of all the other hotel amenities like the ukulele lessons, the bikes, and pool. But too much exploring the island. I did however love that you could check out beach towels and the $50 excursion voucher. Overall, super staff, beautiful property, yummy food. I’m looking forward to staying at another one of their properties.

We stayed at the Laylow after attending a conference in Maui. We wanted to see Oahu and extend our trip. This was 1st time to Hawaii and 1st time in Honolulu. Laylow is the perfect urban, chic hotel. It is not on the beach but is a short easy walk to the Waikiki public beach. The pool is totally relaxed with ample chairs and loungers. Bar/food service at the pool could have been more attentive but was adequate. This is not a resort. Its a nice boutique style hotel for people more concerned with exploring this awesome city and beach than lounging at hotel. That said, the beds are super comfortable. The welcome basket, decor, rooftop bar and vibe of this place exude relaxation. The valet staff were quick, efficient and very polite. Front desk got us into our room early and extended check out by an hour. I am a Marriott rewards member and others have complained about their status not being recognized. All I can say is this is not a "chain" style hotel. Its unique and funky. Embrace it and worry about you Marriott status when you are in Idaho or aome other less interesting place. As an aside, I would not recommend for kids/families...its just not that kind of place.

I stayed at the Laylow for the first time in January 2018 for business. It was convenient as it is right next door to the backside of the International Market-many restaurants and great shopping. It's a couple of blocks in from the beach, but a great value and everything you need. Staff was friendly and helpful. I actually had the pool to myself one evening. It's a Marriott property and even the bath products were surprisingly nice. Very modern, but with a Hawaii decor and ambience.

My husband and I stayed at the Laylow in December 2017 and had a wonderful time! The hotel is convenient to everything in Waikiki Beach. Walk right out of the hotel and great restaurants and shopping abounds! Every room comes with a beautiful welcome basket stocked with Laylow flip flops and snacks! Such a nice touch! The lobby was always bustling but we never heard any noise in our room. Great pool and fun bar but best of all they have phenomenal staff and wonderful service! The valet staff was especially on point and beyond friendly. Kudos to Allen who gave us fantastic restaurant tips! We will definitely stay at the Laylow when we return to Honolulu!

We visit 3 islands in 16 days, staying at 6 different hotels in 5 different areas. The Lay Low was our favorite and about the middle range in price. The customer service was super and attentive, the room was spotless, unlike most hotels in Hawaii the AC didn’t struggle to keep up. The bar was hopping and you there are plenty of other food and shopping options close by. This is our third Autograph Collection stay in the last year and we love them!
user_name:
Sheila/R M
Fort Walton Beach, Florida

review_body: From the free flip flops in the room, along with the tropical treats, ukele & friendly staff, this is a real find. It's not one of the gargantuan hotels, but it was convenient to everything & we could wait for our rides while watching from up[stairs in the indoor/outdoor bar/lounge seating area. The staff helped us plan our excursions (Pearl Harbor, hiking Diamond Head, visiting the Palace, eating at Lady Pigs - VIetnamese Polynesian fusion - outstanding. My 83-year-old mother came with us & agreed it was a terrific stay. DUring the one rainy day, I used the clean, small gym did shopping at the nearby Mall, which had several unique ice cream places to choose from!

Spent a weekend in Honolulu at the Marriott Laylow hotel 2 blocks off Waikiki Beach. The hotel was very well keep and very convenient for sight seeing the Punchbowl, Pearl Harbor, and the Diamond Head Crater state park. Used Marriott Reward points for the 2 days prior to heading to the North Shore for a conference. We were well cared for. I highly recommend this hotel!

Excellent hotel in every sense of the word. Location, Decor, Service and Ambience all very well curated. Loved our time at the hotel - we had a corner suite on the executive floor which was great for working in as well as relaxing. Great pool, clean hotel, bar fun and lively with live music.
user_name:
DBinNY
New York City, New York

review_body: We enjoyed our stay at this new hotel in Waikiki. The location was great, central to shops and restaurants, and an easy walk to the beach. We happened to be checking in while they had the free shave ice in the lobby, which was a nice touch. As a gold elite member, we were provided with a $15 food voucher per person per day to use at the Hideout restaurant on property. We chose to use them for breakfast, but you could use them at any time of the day, just not on alcohol. We still had to pay some in cash both days, as the menu items were on the expensive side. If you wanted to keep to the $15 it could be done, you would just have to stick to ordering "sides" off the menu. We were also upgraded to a corner king suite, which was very spacious - with 2 balconies, a table for eating in the corner, a couch and sitting area. The welcome baskets were a nice touch - we were able to exchange for the correct size flip flops at the shop in the lobby. One downside - this is the first hotel I have ever stayed out where there was no computer available for the guests to use to print boarding passes. I had to email my boarding pass to the person at the front desk and they had to print them for me.

The Laylow is a nice place in Waikiki. Was there from 12/23-28/2017. It is close to Waikiki Beach, about a 6-7 minute walk. There was only one working elevator, hopefully it is fixed now. The front desk told patrons "they were working fix it," but we were told it was down before we arrived and when we left, there was still only one working elevator. This caused lines and long waits in the lobby. The Hideout restaurant located inside the hotel has great breakfast, I was not impressed with their dinner. The cleaning staff were very nice. TR Fire Grill located inside the Hilton Garden Inn has the best dinner.

Let me say that I am a designer for Starwood, and other luxury (hate that word) hotel brands and I was looking for well designed hotel without a ridiculous price. I love this hotel having stayed there three nights. The location is central for eating and shopping. The concierge was super helpful booking two trips for us last minute. The design fun mid-century inspired that embraces the history of the authentic hotel in a fun yet sophisticated way from the custom artwork and collections to the smallest detail like the soap trays and ceramic name tags. Definitely not your big corporate hotel. The services and staff were all positive helpful and friendly. We had a street facing corner room on the 4th floor. The only issue some may have is that you could hear the noise from the street until about 11 but that did not keep us up. Overall, a really good relaxed vibe and I would highly recommend this for anyone wanting a more designer experience on the down low.

Went to The Lay low hotel on a recommendation from a friend.... Awesome place Clean, New and friendly! Kamaaina rates great food... I recommend highly! Two blocks from the beach and all the conveniences of downtown Honolulu and Waikiki Beach:)

My husband and I stayed at Laylow. As a frequent visitor to Hawaii, I was excited to hear about this new hotel. As we were traveling with a baby, the room size was priority instead of it being ocean front. The hotel website is beautiful, and the price was right. I thought we got the right hotel for us.Our stay at Laylow, unfortunately, started "low". A month before our arrival, Laylow's customer service representative and I corresponded so that we can have a corner room on Executive Floor facing the ocean. We also requested a crib and a kettle. On our arrival day, our flight got delayed and we were checking in much later than we planned. I called Laylow right away and explained the situation. It sounded as if everything was taken care of - however, regardless of my efforts, our stay did not start smoothly. We arrived at a hotel and was welcomed by a somewhat happy lady for the check in. My Marriott Gold status was not even acknowledged (and no voucher for Gold members was offered.) Being too tired to argue, we went to our room. Our room was not what we promised via email -- the room was completely on a opposite side of the room we requested. No crib. No kettle. No welcome basket. Dirty sink. No confirmation of baby sitter (I was calling Concierge more than 4 days to confirm this.) I called the front desk but she was unwilling to do anything to solve the situation. Feeling desperate, I reached out to Marriott International and luckily they contacted me right away to get me connected to the Assistant Manager. The assistant manager (I forgot her name) was very helpful and tried her best to accommodate what was promised. She assigned us to the right room, sent us some champagne with freshly baked pineapple cake with a hand written card, and made sure that we got food vouchers. From this point on, our stay became more enjoyable. Despite all the disappointment we experienced on Day 1, there are some positive sides which I need to mention. First, yes, the executive floor lounge is underwhelming but their pastry is pretty delicious. Please have cinnamon roll, chocolate croissant, and sticky bun, more often, though. They were much better than the ham and cheese croissants. Second, the room is quite spacious for a hotel in Waikiki. With adjacent windows of the corner opening to two sides, we never felt cramped during the stay. Third, there are some really good staff, including front desk staff (if not all) and assistant manager, working at this property. Please do keep them! Fourth, the pool-side cabana was very nice for a family with a little one. As a newish hotel, the hotel needs to work on some issues, however. First, some front desk staff needs better training or find some other line of work. I was frankly surprised when she, I withhold the name here, was not willing to help us out all when I contacted upon arrival. Second, although people at concierge are nice, and I understood that they are busy, it would have been nicer if they could have confirmed reservation promptly. Third, the food at Hideout is good - but it lost its flavor when the room dining was served in a plastic container with plastic utensils. I would suggest using porcelain plates and metal utensils, instead. Fourth, the bathroom on the lobby floor (the one accessible from the swimming pool), was not clean often times. I recommend sending the cleaning crew more often.

For better or worse, Waikiki is a unique place; it's a beach, it's a city, it's a tourist zone. Most tourist-hotels jockey for position to be as close to the beach as possible, and the ones that retreat one block inland to Kuhio Ave are generic or business-oriented. The Laylow, along with the nearby Hyatt Centric, are the exceptions to this. The Laylow offers everything a leisure traveler should expect from a mid-range hotel. Good service, a clean/comfortable room, good pool, good bar/restaurant. That being said, it is not a resort: no spa, no luau, etc. (which the nearby resorts will gladly offer to non-guests). Despite being in an urban environment, our room on the 10th floor had zero street noise at night, but you could hear the sounds of the city during the day while on the balcony (duh).The same situation can be described for Hyatt Centric, and it really comes down to personal preference. If you want something sleek/sexy, Hyatt Centric may be better for you. If you want a fun (almost campy) "I'm in Hawaii" feel, go to The Laylow. As a tie-breaker, the Laylow is closer to the International Marketplace, which not only offers great food/shopping options, it also provides as comfortable and convenient route to the beach.As a Marriott Gold, I was treated well; they provided dining vouchers and a generous room upgrade. The only complaint I have about the hotel was the elevators. There are only two on the property (no service elevator) and they routinely required a 3-5 minute wait during the day. I considered this to be a nuisance instead of a showstopper though.If you don't want to pay beachfront prices and don't mind a bit of extra walking, but still want a fun/comfortable place to stay, you can't go wrong with The Laylow.

My family and I came over from Kauai for just a couple days in Honolulu expecting to see and do as much as we could. As soon as we stepped into the LayLow we didn't want to leave. The rooms are decorated brilliantly with mid century modern furniture and Hawaiian colors. Free flip flops provided in your room to walk across the street to the beach. Excellent coffee and Kona Coffee Purveyors right next door. My personal favorite was the sofa style loungers at the pool, perfect for a nap or a tan, while you wait for complimentary pineapple-coconut water served right to you. For a laylow, chill stay in the busy city of Honolulu, I would chose LayLow everytime!

My husband and I travel to Hawaii every year, and so far The Laylow, Autograph Collection has been the worst nightmare. Upon check-in, I had to ask for a complimentary room upgrade with my gold status, but she kept insisting that she wasn't able to verify my status which never happened to me. I had to browse to pull my account information online, and she complained how the system was odd. The next two days were nightmare. Like other reviewers mentioned, the pool music was very LOUD. They started to play before 8AM, and we were awake due to the disturbing loud music. Second day, he heard the drill sound and thought there was construction going on upstairs and we couldn't resist anymore after few hours of consistent drilling, so I asked the front if we could change the room, but I was told that there wasn't any available (When I checked online at Marriott website, I was able to see the vacant rooms though). The front desk receptionists were very uninformative and kept repeating that the noise was from the escalator repair (YES! the escalator also had a problem and didn't work) even though the room we were assigned at opposite end, and the noise was coming from the up-stair. I even video taped it. They only have two elevators, and one wasn't working the whole time we were there along with the escalator, so it took 10-15 minutes to just catch the elevator. Third day we were there, there was a fire alarm and announcement that it wasn't drill but real. I was in shower and panicked. We just got out and I just had wrapped myself with the bath towel, and guess what? it was an error!This place is a joke. I travel alot, and I've never experienced something like thisMy expectation for any Autograph Collection hotels are ZERO. Poor customer service, poor accommodation, poor maintenance, and poor management. I never want to come back and won't stay here.

This was a great find when looking for a hotel in Waikiki. While not on the water, it is only a short walk to the beach and a lot great restaurants. The welcome dish of fresh pineapple was especially refreshing after a long flight. The staff was very helpful and accommodating throughout my stay. They took care of any issues and were very helpful in any questions I may have had. There was a very nice welcome basket in the room of island snacks and event zories (flip-flops). The only issues that were encountered was loud music coming up from the nearby International Market but it usually quit by 10:00PM and while there, one of the elevators was not working. This caused long lines for accessing the remaining elevator either going up or down. Other than that, the rooms were nicely furnished. I really loved the shampoo and body bath that were provided, wish I could have found it in the gift shop. I'll be back.

To be honest, I did not know what to expect since this was a business trip and I was not the one who booked the room. I must say I was pleasantly surprised. Right in the heart of Waikiki Beach, 2 streets off the beach, it was perfect. After a long day of business I was able to escape to the open air lobby for drinks at the bar, or travel within a two block radius and eat some of the best food I have ever had. I was told by a local that the Laylow has recently re-modeled their rooms. They did a great job. Beds are super comfortable and the shower is spacious. In fact, I liked the shower head so much that I found out the brand and model and purchased one off Amazon when I got home. I used the fitness room several times and it had all the necessary basics. I did not use the pool, but there were always a lot of people out there lounging around. The only downside is that my room had a view of the parking lot, but that didn't bother me as I was only in it to sleep and get ready for my day. I would get up early at 4:30am (due to the time difference from Virginia), and hit the Starbucks next door (which opened at 4:30am thank goodness). Then I would come back to the hotel and sit in the bar/restaurant area and drink my coffee. Very pleasant experience. I included 2 pictures of the view from where I was drinking my coffee. The large building is a condo across the street and the street shot is of the udon noodle restaurant right across the street. Everyone who worked at the Laylow was extremely pleasant and helpful. I had some business associates who stayed in a different hotel and were not pleased with their situation. Especially after they saw my room...and shower!

Stayed here for 7 days in January.Pros:-you get a nice little welcome basket that’s full of snacks, water and slippers. -good location. Located right next to the new international market place, it’s convenient for restaurants and is central to most things in Waikiki. -it’s unheard of to find a room that can accommodate 2 King beds. This is really nice when traveling with kids or friends. -bed was really comfortable. They provided a firm pillow and a soft pillow for each person. -air condition worked well. -WiFi was free. Tv was a smart tv so you can hook into your Netflix when needed. -Downstairs has a coffee bar (serves stumptown coffee) and has a restaurant where the food was good. -parking for $35 a Day is average for Waikiki but that being said, the valet guys are great. Very helpful, very patient, very friendly. They were by far the friendliest staff at the hotel.Could be improved but not deal breakers:-tv, phone and mini fridge functioned intermittently. Had to power off/on several times for it to work. -no view. The building only faces car garages. -this hotel is not ideal for kids. The pool is small and meant for relaxing, the bar downstairs had live music but was really loud. -little dresser and counter space. Again might not matter to most but with kids it makes things difficult. -wish they had a coffee machine and a microwave. -the toiletries provided were not very good. Had to buy the necessities at an abc store. -wish they offered beach towels. -the room service menu was limited to several items whereas if you were to get take out from the restaurant below, the selection is greater. Which is kind of a pain to have to go downstairs. -with the exception of the valet, the rest of the staff were just ok. Not unfriendly but not the type of local friendliness I’m used to. Overall I think the hotel is a good choice if you’re visiting Waikiki.

This is not a five star hotel, more like a solid four stars. Room:The room had an older layout feel, but everything inside is refurbished. So it's like a mixture of old and new, although it's "new". Bed was comfy, decor was typical Hawaiian and happy, and bathroom was adequate space wise. No double sinks or fancy showerheads or toilets. We got a room on the fifth floor. It is on the side of the bar and was super noisy at night. If you are trying to sleep early, then this might not be the room for you, as the music doesn't stop until the early morning. However, if you were like us, then you joined the festivities and the loud music was not a problem. Breakfast:For Marriott gold, don't expect a full on breakfast experience like a typical Marriott. We got coffee from a Nespresso type machine, some Hawaiian donuts or pastries, and a fruit. There is no lounge. I'm not sure about the restaurant, as we did not dined there. There are many places to eat within' walking distance.Pool:It's a smaller pool, and depending on time of day, will not get sunlight as it's blocked from all the high rises around. It's a nice pool. A bit crowded though.Bar:LOVE IT. If I were to go back to this hotel, it's to hang out at the bar and get a drink. Urban feel and trendy. It felt like a rooftop bar, but it wasn't "rooftop". I think a lot of the renovations went into the bar. Location:Being across the street from Marukame Udon was a high plus. It's not on the beach, but still central. It's within' walking distance to all the Waikiki Beach places, shopping, food, two blocks from the beach. I like it's location. Overall:We would stay here again to experience Waikiki Beach and Honolulu. If we want a beach getaway, we would stay closer to the beach. But if that's what we wanted, we'd go to Maui or Kauai to "relax". Honolulu is to walk around, eat, enjoy night life, and have fun! The Laylow is adequate for all that.

The price is a little cheaper because you are not on the water. However it doesn't include any breakfast certificate like other Marriott's. If you are a Marriott elite, don't expect access to the executive lounge. You have to pay for everything, right down to the coffee and water! The hotel has a retro type vibe that is pretty cool and the bed really do "laylow". they are like German platform beds. The layout of the rooms is a little odd, with a dining table squeezed into the corner and hardly usable. The location is on the the "second" strip (not the main) and has a noodle place across from must be great as it has a line out the door every time I checked. Food at the hotel was average. Best is to go out somewhere else. (Doraku Sushi is off the charts!) They do have live music nightly, but so do most of the other hotels I have stayed at in Honolulu.
user_name:
Wwtravler321
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The hotel has a very hip vibe. Great for young families. The pool is made for children, only 3 feet deep. No lifeguard, no hot tub, but a lot of nice loungers. The workout room is clean with new equipment. They provide fruit flavored water, fruit, wipes, towels and earbuds. The guest rooms and bathrooms are updated and clean! The elevators take long, as there are many young families with one kid, but all the gear (massive stroller plus a beach wagon!) The restaurant serves delicious food. We only ate breakfast there and found the prices to be in reasonable (as the take out places next door charge the same for similar items.) The staff was great. The front desk is only manned by at most 2 people, so sometimes they take long, but they were always happy to help. The valet, if you call ahead, they have your car waiting. They really do hustle to get your car there and are always pleasant. The restaurant staff was always nice, especially Ben, the manager. He came to our rescue when we attempted to revive our cellphone. Housekeeping always had our room cleaned properly. In all, we had a wonderful time at the Laylow.

Location is awesome. Beach Views are amazing. Must definitely stay. Staff friendly and accommodating. Will visit again soon. Thanks to everyone at the reception for amazing service everyday of our stay. Water sports was the best experience ever.

I've stayed at the Laylow several times now and worked with the hotel to structure a deal for my project team. I am a Platinum Member and I love this hotels feel. It's so different than most in the same price range. Its got a vibe that you can feel as you take the escalator from the street level to the lobby. The lobby is a smaller open air design that flows right into the bar and restaurant as well as pool. Its a few blocks off the beach which is walkable or you can take a free bike, which I highly recommend. At night, the bar makes great drinks, several craft beers on draft and their food menu is simple but outstanding. Try the spicy edamame. I've run into so many international travelers that stop down for a drink and listen to the live music. I guess they recruit locals that can sing well which also attracts people to the bar. Rooms are very cool and I like the pool area. Its not on the beach so don't think of it as a beach resort. I've stayed at the Marriott Waikiki and I'd rather stay at the Laylow.

My BFF and I live in Honolulu and decided to check in at the Lay Low for a 3 night staycation. I just loved this hotel! From the moment we arrived we were greeted by friendly staff. Everyone seemed to be in a great mood and ready to help. Our room was ready way before checking time. The room(#1412) was spacious and the decor was modern. The 2 queen size beds super comfy. The bathroom was amazing. I loved the fact we had a balcony and the view was great part city/part ocean/part mountain. The welcome basket with goodies was a great surprise! The pool area was great and the lounge chairs super comfy. The area is full of restaurants and the walk to the beach is pretty short. This is a great place to stay for a good price and a great modern hotel. The Hideout ( cafe/restaurant downstairs) was excellent. I eill for sure check in here again. I am recommending this hotel to my family and friends.

We stayed at the Laylow twice during our recent Hawaii vacation. The first stay of two nights was planned which included New Years Eve. The second came about as a direct result of how staff dealt with us during our first stay. The Laylow is a beautiful hotel in a fantastic location. The outdoor dining and recreation zone is super chilled and the food and drinks are great quality. The rooms are well laid out and have a very relaxed Hawaiian vibe. The provided goodie basket is also very cool and we loved the included flip flops. The price is comparable to other good hotels in Hawaii. Off beach but right between the International Market Place and also Dukes Market and Eatery. We had a couple of small issues during our first stay, nothing dramatic and more just to do with teething problems of a new hotel and the connection between the pool accessible rooms and the outdoor space. All feedback we gave to the hotel was dealt with professionally, promptly and with great follow up. In particular the front office Manager Ashley was a star in approaching our concerns in a friendly and professional way. So much so that we decided to come back and spend our last night in Hawaii there a week and half later. We look forward to seeing where the team from the Laylow are at in six to twelve months when they hit their stride.

My mom and I stayed here and absolutely loved it! The location is perfect, located right in the middle of Waikiki with access to pretty much everything you need just a short walk away. My mom and I both loved the staff for being so friendly and helpful during our stay, my mom especially had great things to say about the front desk staff, with her being older and a little slow, the staff at the front desk were very patient and understanding with her. Not something you find in many busy places during tourist season! We both enjoyed the food at the restaurant and would recommend trying the pizzas, they are amazing! Overall, we had a great experience staying here and would highly recommend to anyone wanting a relaxing vacation in the heart of Waikiki.

The hotel had a very good review, we stayed the week after Christmas and it was not very good, it was just ok. The place was very busy. Wifi was never working in the room. The lobby had spotty wifi. One of the elevator was out for 3 days, the wait for the other elevator was very long. The hotel staff were nice enough to waive the resort charges, but it is still just ok, I think it has been overrated in the past

I was there on business and the hotel was perfect. I got my latte and a delicious pastry at their coffee shop at 6am every morning and off to work. When I returned, I had a beer and a burger at their restaurant (try the Piggy Marley!!), listened to some local music and called it a day. Staff is efficient and friendly, rooms are very nice and housekeeping was perfect. I wish I had more time to enjoy some of their amenities. The location is great and you can walk to everything. Very impressed with the cleanliness of the hotel and overall ambiance. Wish I had more business in Hawaii to come back soon.

I stayed here for a weekend getaway with one of my friends. We heard many great things about this hotel and it is in the perfect location! We were pleasely surprised with how nice the front lobby/restaurant/pool area was! We were greeted by a very friendly staff that answered all of our questions and really made us feel welcome and excited to start our staycation! Our room was super cute and very clean. We will definitely be coming back! 5 stars!!

We stayed at this hotel for one week and found the rooms very comfortable and the location to be very good with several restaurants, shops and Waikiki beach all within walking distance. The hotel was recently renovated so now is the time to stay. There is a pool although it's small and there are limited lounge chairs available, but those lounge chairs are very comfortable. The sleeping rooms have an interesting style of furniture - the bed was very comfortable, but the couch is very hard and not very comfortable (there is no back to the couch, the cushions rest on the wall and windows. We did feel that the staff of the hotel was accommodating, especially at the front desk, but when we called for service on the phone, the service was not very friendly. We were also disappointed with the housekeeping service - very spotty. We did not use the restaurant at this property, but the coffee bar in the lounge was very good. The parking area is almost non existent and not very easy to get to.
user_name:
sugarsnappeaplum
New York City, New York

review_body: This is my 2nd time at the Laylow & I just love this hidden gem. The Front Desk/Valet staff are so knowledgeable & friendly. Plus they have LIVE music which makes the atmosphere perfect for visitors!!

We just returned from a short vacation to Oahu and decided to stay in Waikiki at the Laylow. We weren't sure where to stay since there are so many hotels and we are in general more resort people. I am so glad we picked the Laylow. I liked the retro look with plants everywhere, which is so different than what most other hotels do. So many details like the hula dolls behind the front desk.The location was super convenient next to the International Market Place and only a very short walk from the beach. Their pool was smaller than a typical resort pool but it was very nice with lounge chairs in the water and great service throughout the day. They pass out drink samples and have shaved ice every day at no charge. Breakfast in the restaurant was delicious and so was dinner. We ate there every day. No need to go anywhere else. Servers were quick and friendly. They also have live music every night by some local musicians. Sit at one of the firepits, have a cocktail and life is good! The ambiance was perfect.Best thing is their coffee shop that opens every morning at 4am where you can get a delicious latte from a friendly barista. Perfect for us jet lagged east coasters.The rooms are large enough, we liked our two king beds, and the bathroom, while not huge is perfect with cool wood tiles in the shower. Housekeeping was spot on and the girl who cleaned our room was very nice. There is a neat welcome basket in the room with Hawaiian sandals and some delicious local snacks. Loved it. They also have a ukulele in the room that you can bring down to a free ukulele lesson at their restaurant lanai. Have a cocktail and you'll learn real quick! You can also buy them at their gift shop which has some other nice little gifts and souvenirs. We liked some of the local soaps and sunscreens and took some home with us.But what was most impressive, was the staff. Literally everyone that we encountered was super friendly, always eager to help and greeted us with a friendly smile and aloha whenever they saw us. We celebrated my wife's birthday and when they found out they sent us some wine and chocolates.The Concierge hooked us up with a couple of cool activities which we really liked. They are very knowledgeable and easy to work with. During peak times there was a line but the front desk jumped in and helped us out with some directions.I usually don't write long surveys but I just wanted to thank them for making our trip very special. Wish I remembered some of the names of the great staff. I would stay there again in a heart beat.

The hotel is located at a prime location, with beautiful decoration and spacious rooms. However, the customer service is HORRIBLE and almost non-existing. We lost an item in the hotel gym, and when we went to the front desk to inquire whether it has been turned in, some staffs were extremely dismissive and unhelpful. Subsequent attempts in following up with the staff about the lost item were equally met with rudeness and even eye-rolls. Additionally, the hot water in the shower stopped working one night, and when we requested for maintenance, the staff simply told us that nothing can be done. We were left with cold showers without any explanation. Overall, it's a great hotel with clean and modern facilities, the bar/restaurant is great, but some staffs made the experience an unpleasant one.

We stayed here for 5 nights and really enjoyed the experience. From check in to check out. We would recommend dining out, there are so many excellent options nearby and the food here is average. The fish was very dry. The staff are friendly and helpful. One downside was concierge who helped arranged our daily activities. There was a mix up with our names which caused some delay at the other end with the tour operators. They also suggested we do the Waikele Outlet stores when we got to the North Shore, only yo find that it was 50 mins away from our hotel. It's much closer and cheaper to go to Waikele from Waikiki. Apart from the concierge and fish, we really enjoyed our stay.

I'm disappointed in the stay, only because of the expectations that I had set for the hotel and the experience as a whole, seeing as we chose this hotel for our New Years Eve celebration. We arrived early after disembarking from the NCL Pride of America and were told to check back in around 1:00 and that our room should be ready no later than 2:00... Great! No problem! We chose to leave our bags with the hotel and explore Waikiki a bit. We eventually found a bar to enjoy some lunch and drinks before heading back around 1:00 to check on the status of our room. We waited around in the lobby and close to the hotel afterwards as we were looking forward to a quick rest and a shower before exploring more of Waikiki on one of the three nights we had. At 3:00 (check-in time) we checked in with the front desk to see if our room was available, and after much confusion ("Yes, your room is ready and your bags are in the room... Oh wait.."), we looked down the hallway to see the cleaning crew had just gotten to the room to begin cleaning it. Finally, around 4:30, we walked into our room to find no bags, which only showed up after multiple calls and visits to the front desk. We finally received our bags around 6:00 pm, only to have felt like an entire day of our vacation was wasted by waiting on the hotel. Please - just level set expectations with your guests. If we had been told that our room wasn't going to be ready until 3:00, we would have explored the city until 3:00. We stayed in one of the cabana rooms, which as with many of the experiences at this hotel, I'm conflicted about as I reflect on it. On a positive note, these rooms are conveniently located on the same floor as the lobby, meaning we didn't have to deal with the elevator issues, but along with this came a definite lack of privacy and noise. Should you choose to stay in one of these rooms, be prepared to have the fan running in your room at all times to block out the noise of the hallway as well as the pool. We spent a ton of time on our balcony area, sitting in the chairs, but so did everyone else. **Note to management - please for the privacy of the guests who pay extra to stay in these rooms, indicate that the chairs are for room guests ONLY, and not for everyone.** I lost count of the number of times that we opened our curtains (which typically had to remain closed while we were in the room because of the traffic of the pool) only to find people sitting in the chairs, staring back at us. To be fair to those individuals, it's not clearly marked. I feel we spent way more time outside than we would have with a traditional balcony, and for that I'm grateful. The room itself was large, although missing amenities that many others have already touched on (in room coffee maker so I didn't have to pay $4 for a cup in the morning, towel hooks, better lighting, etc.). Other items to note: -Breakfast was delicious, although expensive. -Many members of the staff are incredible and genuine, I firmly believe our negative experience was only with a few staff members and should not be a reflection on the whole. I apologize that I can't remember names, but some of the people we dealt with were fantastic and wanted to make amends for the issues we encountered. -The pool area looks incredible, but from a functionality perspective, misses the mark. It is shady most of the day, and the chairs that are available are taken quickly in the morning, something I attempted to do twice only to have someone else take over the chair while I went back into my room to put on a bathing suit and apply sunscreen. -While the beach is "close", it's definitely a walk, and it's difficult to find a place to enjoy it. Keep that in consideration when booking this hotel if your preference is to lay by the pool/beach all day. This probably isn't the hotel for you.

This hotel was such an unexpected treat. Loved the decor and feel. Swinging basket chairs in the lobby, cute little hulu dolls displayed behind the front desk, and free shaved ice from 1-2pm at the pool. The location was excellent and the hotel restaurant/lobby juts out onto the street for a view of what's happening while you're either dining or enjoying the fire pit - including a sand floor so it feels like a beach!The room was beautiful and we even had a small view of the ocean. Free welcome basket was completely unexpected - and good stuff. too! Fantastic staff. We had an amazing stay.

We stayed here for a couple nights and we impressed with everything it had to offer. I have stayed at other places in Waikiki, this is modern and close to everything. Great location, amazing noodles right across the street. The line always looks long, but it’s fast!! Nordstrom Rack next door. International Market as well. The rooms are quite spacious and the pool is nice. The bar is amazing! I would come back in a heart beat!! Thank you,

This is a hard review to write, because of the pros and cons. I arrived at 1:30p and the room wasn’t guaranteed until 3p, but I attempted to check in regardless. It took 20+ minutes to wait in line to check in, which was the first display of their disorganization.They told me they would call me when the room was ready, but that it would be ready by 3. (Understandable) At 3:20 I got in line again, and patiently waited while they tried to find me a room. They called housekeeping, verified that a room had been “inspected” and then finally handed me keys. However, when I got up to the room, housekeeping was in there and said that the room had a problem (a horrible chemical smell that they couldn’t identify or fix) and said that I couldn’t stay in that room. So they sent me back down to check-in. At this point, a manager upgraded me to a junior suite and apologized profusely. That’s part of the reason this is tough to write, because all of the staff I encountered were friendly, helpful, and went above and beyond!! But...The room was noisy, and I could hear traffic on the street as well as in the halls, at all hours of the day and night. In addition, I must have been close to the kitchen (though I was on the 7th floor) because there was always a bevy of fresh cooked smells wafting through my room. (Not as enticing or enjoyable as it may sound)But, again on the positive side, they had great entertainment and a host of fun activities that took place downstairs, as well as a phenomenal location. However, there are so few pool chairs, that I never got to enjoy the pool, despite the fact that I wanted to. See what I mean??? CONFLICTED. All in all, I don’t think I would stay here again. I visit Honolulu 3 - 4 times a year, and there are plenty of other places in the same price range that are a far better value for the money, with much quieter rooms and a closer walk to the beach.

This was for a business trip to Honolulu. Laylow is a nice new addition to the Marriott family. Good location for walking. The pool is nice, but the sun is gone later in the day due to the buildings around it. Restaurant and bar very fun.

The Laylow has a cool vibe, great location, and nice rooms...but for a place that fancies itself a premier Waikiki destination, its missing some of the details. Our check in process was torturous and then it took 1.5 hours and 3 calls for the bell desk to get our luggage to our room. The mid-century feel and architecture is well done but the lobby is small and constricted although our corner room was roomy and nicely put together. The Hideout bar/restaurant is a excellent place to hang out and the breakfast was especially good. And being right next door to the International Marketplace makes it easy to check out shopping and food options...I would go back but it probably won't be my first option.

My teenage son, husband and I recently spent a week at the Laylow Hotel and I can't say enough good things about it! We have been to Hawaii before - but we had never found a home away from home that we would be prepared to return to, until now! You will have read all about the charming décor, gift basket and very cool mid-century make-over that the hotel has had. The renovation looks like real quality work, and I expect it will continue to look as lovely as it did when we arrived only months after it re-opened. Usually, we stay in apartments so we have a bit of space and privacy, but this time, as we were only in Waikiki for a week, we decided to all bunk into the one room. I can say that even with three of us, it was enough room. The huge and comfy king size beds did not feel as though they consumed the entire room, and there was plenty of bench space on the cool Eames style wall shelves. For me - there was not enough lighting in the room. That makes for a lovely moody space, but at night, when trying to read a book on the side of the bed that does not have a bedside table, it is difficult. Perhaps a sconce light over the 'outside' edges of the beds could be helpful. The only other thing that could be improved - as everything else was perfect for me - was that there was nowhere to hang towels in the bathroom. The bathroom is just beautiful - really stylish down to the finest detail .... except for the practical matter of hanging your towel (or lovely gown that is also supplied) after your shower. Again, no big problem, but noticeable when there are three of us using the space.There were plenty of coat-hangers, towels, glasses and really nice quality bath accessories. You can't always assume those sorts of things will be in plentiful supply, so it was fab to have all that on tap. Added to all this, the staff were mostly lovely, although sometimes, some staff seemed too preoccupied or unable to assist readily, and room service choices for in-room dining could have been better with some simple meals or snacks to have in-room after a long day out. The ABC stores next door were good enough for that though!The location is the best in town, in my opinion, having stayed in several other high profile properties and areas over the years. Our room on the 10th floor was surprisingly quiet.I am already hoping to come back to Hawaii, and next time I do, we will absolutely want to stay at the Laylow Hotel.Thank you all for a fantastic holiday!

Family trip to Oahu, first for the kids. Got package deal at Costco for the Laylow Hotel which was awesome. Great boutique hotel w perfect location we wanted a block off Waikiki strip and beach. Staff was awesome and concierge helped direct us to some good day trips. Rooms were clean and had two king beds each. Bathroom was clean and new...maybe could have had two sinks but that would be my only complaint. Hotel had nice pool, exercise room with up to date equipment and bar/restaurant area called the Hideout. Food at the Hotel was good for all meals. Would recommend highly and definitely stay again.

Nice enough hotel. Was given a nice upgrade to a suite(more like a junior suite) as a Gold member. Stayed 7 nights. Felt the amenity fee was weakly justified but that is not unusual. Vouchers for the restaurant for Gold members in lieu of a lounge is nice but it is a shame they are no longer allowing the vouchers to be used for alcohol. Also it seemed like every waiter handled these vouchers differently. It is not a luxury hotel but is fairly comfortable.Location of the hotel is great if you do not need to be right by the beach. Staff were nice.I am giving this a 2 rather than a 4 or 5 though as I was annoyed when I was denied the Gold/Platinum member 4pm guaranteed late checkout "because they are a resort". While hotels classified by Marriott as resorts certainly do not have to offer the 4pm late checkout, I had researched this hotel beforehand and was almost certain it was not classified as a resort. On checking with some people after and on the Marriott resort directory, I got confirmation that this is definitely not classified as a resort by Marriott(hence the daily "amenity fee" and not "resort fee"). I really do not like hotels lying to try to get out of the guaranteed 4pm checkout. Thankfully most Marriotts are very good at honoring this benefit. I appreciate that giving this benefit in Waikiki with so many red eye flights might be difficult but these benefits are part of the deal they make when they affiliate with Marriott. They should do better. We ended up changing our flight to a morning flight in part because of this.

So we booked a room that is supposed to accommodate five, paying extra for it. They give us a room with one King and a "sofa" that's really not meant for sleeping on. We ask for the room we booked with that bedding plus a queen. Sorry, they say, we thought you only had 2 in your group, so we gave you enough bedding for 2. The marriott website doesn't allow you to list your kids, just how many "guests' you have. This hotel charges for guests 3 to 5 IF they are ADULTS, so we put down 2 guests. I pointed out that as Gold members, we are entitled to the bedding we booked. Nope, sorry, they are full. Could they bring us a rollaway? Nope. Could they bring us a spare mattress (plenty of room for it) from a bed or the cushions from a sofa not in use. Nope, they claim that housekeeping has NONE. Really? I don't believe it. Anyway, they refused to honor the bedding gurarantee, or to give the $100 compensation that's the minimum Gold members are entitled to when they don't get the bedding they booked. They waived a $35 fee, and gave us pillows and blankets to our kids could sleep on the floor. Totally unacceptable, but it was Christmastime and there was nowhere else to go, so we put up with it for one night.Next day, we said we are checking out, and asked for the 4pm "guaranteed" late checkout. The woman at the desk claimed that his guarantee was subject to availability (it's not) and that she couldn't do anything past 1. After about ten minutes of arguing, I was about to show her the dictionary definition of "guarantee" when another clerk intervened and gave us the 4pm checkout. Because there was nothing else available for a family in the city, we decided to leave the island early, so the hotel ruined our vacation.I then mentioned to the manager that we are entitled to the $100 for not getting our bedding, and after disappearing into his office for 20 minutes, he finally came out and said no, because how was he to know that we had more than 2 people in our party? Hello? The guarantee isn't dependent on how many people you have in your party. What if we weren't a couple, and wanted the king and queen so we'd each have a nice size bed? And is it our fault that Marriott doesn't let you specify that you have kids coming with you?The only good fortune we had with the hotel is that we were on the 3rd floor, as one of the 2 elevators was broken, leading to huge lines, so we walked instead. Near as I can tell, the hotel offered no compensation beyond a meager apology for making guests either wait 10-20 minutes each time they wanted to use the elevator, or walking up and down the stair--the hotel has some very high floors!Did I mention that you can hear the music from the lobby in your room when you try to sleep?This is by far the worst experience I've ever had at a Marriott, with the absolute worst, ill-trained staff.BTW, if they had had a queen bed, it apparently would have been similar to the incredibly uncomfortable "Sofa" that was in our room. This hotel is not built to accommodate more than a couple, regardless of their claims on their website to have rooms for 5.Finally, instead of giving Gold members breakfast, they give a voucher of $15 for a single, $30 for a couple for their restaurant--but nothing on their menu is $15 or under, so the breakfast isn't free.STAY AWAY!

Waiting an hour past the stated check in time for a room I am paying over $400 a night for. Management doesn’t seem to care. I would suggest the Holiday in across the street, amazing accommodations, closer to the beach and they actually care about customer service.

I want to start off saying I flew in from India for my birthday. I picked this hotel because it said it was a Marriott hotel. This is not a full size Marriott hotel it’s just a boutique hotel. As a Platinum Marriott member this was not a Great idea for me to book this hotel! They don’t treat you any better or upgrade your room. They said I would have a Mountain View high up and we had a view of a parking lot! I also asked for two connecting rooms as I have a kid who has special needs and we will be in the rooms a lot. It why I wanted a room with a view and connected. For 5000.00 USD I expected more. When I sent an email to the management they called me and offered me some Marriott points and Champaign. They had no idea or seemed to even care they have really messed up my only family vacation. I don’t want points I want the room I reserved! To add to the bad things. They left our luggage in the rain and I put it out of the rain myself but somehow they put it back in the rain! So don’t bring your Gucci or Chanel suitcases The second of only two elevators didn’t work for 3 days! So we had to walk up and down the stairs! Because the elevator line was so long. When we checked out I called for a bell boy to get our bags. They didn’t show up so again I carried my bags. They I saw him in the lobby and asked him for help with my bags he sent to me to the front desk and she told me I had to carry my stuff to the valet myself again! And he didn’t help get my wife’s suitcase and she has to also carry her own stuff. So long story short only stay here if you are not a Marriott member who expects the same great service at the Marriott hotels any place else. Good stuff the rooms are big and nice and clean. Room maids did a Great job and always said hi when we saw them. The bartender was Great made me a drink that was very very strong The lobby is nice but small. So if a kid Throws up right in front of you there’s no real place to go and it takes forever for someone to clean upThe pool is nice but only gets sun for about two hours a day so be ready. The nicest person was the guy who helped me change my shoe size in the gift shop. He needs a raze! Or make him manager he went out of his way to be very helpful.

We had a corner suite on the executive level, where a limited breakfast selection in the hallway was included. Orange juice, nice WMF machine coffee/latte and croissants or danish. Worked very well for us to start our day.Beds are slightly too soft for us.Location is great, close to shops and restaurants. Beach is 2 small blocks away, no biggie for us.Can recommend and would go again

The Laylow is a stylish new hotel located in the heart of Waikiki. The location is convenient to beaches, shopping, restaurants, and night life. In addition, the property is chic with a vintage-Hawaii decor that includes a ukulele in each room. Unfortunately, there is no lounge.I chose the Laylow for our stay because I am a Marriott Rewards member, and it was an Autograph Collection property with good online ratings. Unfortunately, the property did not live up to the hype. While the property looks fantastic and flashy, the staff and facilities left much to be desired.The property has two elevators for guests to reach their rooms. One of those two elevators was broken for four out of our five nights on property. It made for long waits for the elevators and cramped quarters in the elevators themselves. In addition, the elevators are secured, meaning you need a room key to reach your floor. It's great for security, but it's not so great when the elevator is stuffed with guests, and you can't get to the panel. Also, it made things difficult for guests with luggage, whether checking in or out.The room was nicely appointed with two king beds and the amenities included robes, a safe, an iron & ironing board, a refrigerator, & spa toiletries. The bathroom was nicely laid out and finished with nice materials. The shower was especially large, and the it had good water pressure and instant hot water. The one downside for me - I found hairs in multiple towels and under the cap of a bottle of conditioner. It was off-putting for me.The Front Desk Staff and the Concierge were fantastic. They always greeted us with smiles and friendly interactions. I took advantage of the Concierge service to book some activities, and Meena was excellent.The Valets/Bellmen, on the other hand, seemed disinterested and not very well trained. On multiple occasions, they simply handed me a car key when I gave them my claim ticket. Thank goodness it was for the correct car. However, my biggest issue was with their attention to details...or lack thereof. From 40+ minutes for baggage assistance to messing with the driver's seat in the car, they didn't seem to be concerned with the finer details. And for me, the details make the difference.The Laylow is a nice property, but I cannot justify returning when there are so many other great properties in Waikiki.

Love staying at a brand new hotel and seeing all the gorgeous design details. This was straight out of a space age 60s surf film but only months old. Fun pool and great bar scene with amazing apps and cocktails available among tiki torches and cozy couches Rooms themselves are minimalist and fresh. Service was friendly and fun. There’s no beach access or ocean view but this is a really good part of town and easy walk to everything Couple of notes to the hotel : towel hooks! There’s an amazing robe in the room but no where to hang it! And if you wanted to be green and reuse a towel there’s no where for it to go. Also - lamps! I loooove the beautiful fixtures but there’s literally dark spots in the room - 908 was so dark at night I couldn’t pack! Maybe our lamp was missing?

Great outdoor lounge with large firebowls, kept us warm on cool evenings. great service from the "guy" The food/appys were delicious. We went back several times. great atmosphere and people watching. Great location behind the mall and 1 block from the beach.

We booked a larger suite with a corner view and after aome confusion at check in we were given the correct room. We were not told tnat as Gold Elite we should have had access to the coffee etc on Floor 15 and as tne room had no coffee maker this was inconvenient to say the least. We did receive $15 vouchers towards breakfast. The room itself was good and for the most part the service was excellent especially in the Hideout restaurant.

Nice hotel, centrally located. Not too far from Waikiki beach, 10 min walk. Next door to International Market Place and a large array of restaurants in the area. I was lucky to get a room as soon as I arrived at the hotel after arriving at 7:30am. Not bad.Room was nice, looks just like the pics on the website, plenty of space but... I booked a room on the Ho'okipa Level and thank goodness I booked breakfast as the complementary food on the level was so basic it was more grab and go and should be stated as such. In fact they leave you bags to take the food away. The food/drinks area is in the middle of the hall located between the rooms so if you want a coffee super early your likely going to wake half the floor!! There is no signage to tell you what is what and whilst most items are easily identified until I used the taps I didn't know one was for soda water and other two were just filtered water. Coffee was ok but no stirrers provided and as no cutlery in room how was I to stir my sugar?? There's a bar fridge in the room - empty for you to fill as you wish. A basket with thongs, water and snacks but again nothing to say that it's complimentary! Water bottles are not replenished as I guess you are supposed to refill your bottle using the taps in the hallway!The bed is waaaay too soft and uneven in firmness. Plenty of pillows to choose from thoug so that's lucky! Also plenty towels etc in bathroom, although I did get child size towels on a couple of days - so small I wasn't sure what happened! Breakfast is ok, but can be slow even with the number of staff. The pool area looked nice but didn't get to use it or gym.

Stayed a couple nights for the first time this past week. Property is in a great location (unless you want beachfront), close to many great places to eat and shop. Whoever did the decorating for the property gets a gold star. Very retro, hip and funky rolled into one. Room itself was not very large (we had a corner "suite" which was not really really a suite, but the bed was comfortable and the balconies were great. Bathroom is nicely done, but very small.Check in was methodical and not overly friendly. Remaining staff was hit or miss, with some seeming to enjoy their role and interacting with guests, and others not so much. (Managers roaming the property were very engaging) Marriott status did get food vouchers after asking, but not much else. (FYI for lounge access, upgrade expectations etc.) Resort "fees" are commonplace at resorts and while you do not care for them, you pay it, hope to recoup your money while on property and move on. Resort fee seems in part to augment the base room rate. You do get a cool welcome basket, but you are paying for it. Other "perks" I remembered was use of a bike (we only saw one) and $50 off $100 spend with the concierge which we did not use. Overall, we were happy, just trying to capture our experience. This was our first overnight in Honolulu after many in Maui. Truly a different experience, so we were glad we did.

This was a very friendly and nice hotel with many amenities. Meena at the concierge desk was very helpful and booked some fabulous tours for us. The breakfast at the terrace restaurant was great. The staff in general were so nice it made for a memorable trip.

The hotel is absolutely an instagrammers trendy dream. Great wallpaper, cool patterns, decor is just awesome.Everyone was really friendly and helpful and the food we had at the Hideout bar/restaurant and room service was really good. The location was also central to everything in Waikiki. Minutes from the beach, tons of restaurants shops etc. All of that being said, for the price (knowing Waikiki is expensive) I just wasn't wowed. Nothing particularly bad but just wasn't impressed. It was beautiful and new, good drinks, good service, thus the 4/5 rating but just nothing particularly exemplary. Take that with a grain of salt, I don't care for Waikiki, or Honolulu all that much and perfer other parts of O'ahu for vacation but we were with friends and needed to be in Waikiki.No complaints necessarily, but was just left feeling indifferent.

For someone who is not at least a gold member of Marriott rewards, this hotel is an excellent choice. Most of the staff was pleasant and professional and the concierge was especially helpful. When checking in it was hard to communicate with the front desk due to the loudness of the lobby during a weekend evening. Although those who want to be part of the action will appreciate the nighttime activity in the hotel, the sounds which emanate from it can still be heard on high floors. Although bookings through the concierge receive $50 off $100 in spending, for two people who wanted to visit some parts Pearl Harbor. it might not be that easy to utilize. The concierge suggested adding some things to our activities that we might not otherwise have chosen in order to reach the $100 figure. Overall, I liked the hotel but thought that it was worth pointing out that someone who is a Platinum Starwood and Marriott member might be disappointed in the status benefits offered. Although platinum members are guaranteed lounge access and breakfast for two and offered space available upgrades, I believe the hotel's approach is to minimize its offering of benefits. Since there was no coffee machine in my room or in the lobby, it would have been nice to have access to a lounge where I could make coffee before the restaurant opened. Although the executive floors have a coffee machine, filtered water and some minimal food offerings, I was initially told only guests upgraded to those floors receive access. The explanation offered was that as an Autograph collection hotel, they are different. A brief review of Marriott's policies would show that Autograph collection hotels are not exempt from providing stated benefits. Even if the counter is not considered a lounge, it would have cost the hotel little to offer gold and above members access to it without debate. The $15 per person food and beverage credit is a marked improvement from what some reviewers had claimed was the hotel's attempt to substitute the offerings on the executive floor for the required offering of continental breakfast for gold and higher members. Some Marriott hotels, including Autograph collection ones, provide a full breakfast or at least a substantial continental breakfast. Increasing the credit by $5 or $10 per person would make this hotel more competitive.

For the price we paid to stay at an "autograph" level hotel the location us obviously what you pay for. The rooms were fine but have no view and the pool is really small. For the 251 room hotel, how can they only have 16 loungers by the pool?!? And to top off the negative experience, they dont have music playing so all you hear is city traffic noise. Not the impression we had from viewing the website and for the price you might as well stay on the beach.

Just returned from a long weekend at the Laylow with friends. Some other friends were staying at a big resort on the water. We would go visit them to enjoy the ocean and pools but it was so nice to return to the Laylow. It's a peaceful small hotel that has everything you need. We received a wonderful welcome basket with snacks and flip flops. The room had two king beds - yes KING beds, two of them. And they were comfortable. We didn't have much of a view - mostly over buildings. They serve free shave ice from 1-2 p.m. and that was nice. The bar/restaurant is excellent. We had breakfast there and it's was delicious. Bathrooms were nice with a glass shower that had hot water and was spacious. The pool is really small but nice with lounge chairs in the water. They have a great workout facility and fresh water with fruit daily. The decor is funky - retro Hawaiian. We had great service. There was entertainment in the bar in the evening. Rooms were cleaned pretty late in the day. I would stay here again , no question. The big resorts felt a little crazy and crowded and I looked forward every day to returning to the Laylow.

Super cute and trendy hotel in a great location in Waikiki. 5 minute walk to the beach, and walking distance to all of the shops. It has a younger crowd, with great music in the lounge area. The rooms are awesome and very comfortable. You also get a little goody basket with treats and flip flops! Loved the hotel and highly recommend staying here.

First time staying in this hotel. Our room was spacious, clean and the bed was incredibly comfortable. The retro design vibe was fun. The staff were attentive and friendly and we enjoyed drinks and appetizers in the outdoors bar several times. The local musicians playing live music during happy hour and into the evening were amazing! The only drawback is their pool. It’s nice, but small and not terribly inviting but with the beach just a couple of blocks away, no need to be by the pool! It’s right next to several restaurants and places to shop. Will definitely stay here again!

Good stuff:- great location, close to shopping, the beach and restaurants - everything in the hotel is new and clean- great restaurant and bar on site, they have very nice cocktails- well equiped gym that didn't seem that busy- helpful staff- lovely pool area- they have done a good job with the noise insulationNot great stuff - the pillows are quite high, so bring your own if you have neck problems- while the breakfast is very nice (try the oats and fruit bowl if you want something healthy and the the coffee is the best I had in Hawaii) it does take some time for the food to arrive. You need at least 45 minutes for breakfast, which can be a bit problematic if you are in a hurry. Breakfast is also only served from 7 am, so if you have an early flight you will go hungry.

We chose the Laylow on a whim. We had stayed in Waikiki several times before as stop overs to shop after staying on the other islands. We figured that it was more financially expedient to stay one block back from the main strip. What a marvellous decision!! The rooms were what the website indicated (small but clean, tidy and a little funky, i.e. ukele, etc) but what the internet doesn't tell the you is that the staff are great, the little pool is just right and the proximity to the International Market, Maui Brewing Co., PF Chang's as well as the Cheesecake Factory means you are central without too much noise!! Awesome bar service during evening drinks - thanks Seth (he remembered our drinks) and Cassandra (Irish?? accent) for keeping tired Aussies happy. Jarren at reception who was polite, patient and very professional - thumbs up, it was a busy day that we arrived. Richard our concierge who helped with arranging massages, etc and still remembered our names whenever we walked past!! The pool staff who made sure they refreshed guests with NA drinks and did NOT hassle us to buy cocktails AND provided sunscreen - Australians are big on that. Finally - each corridor has a coffee, tea juice, ice station with snacks for guests to grab on their way to their rooms, this was a nice touch. The only downer??.. The morning of our departure - the fire alarms went off and instead of letting guests know it was a false alarm within several minutes, it was announced when many of the guests had already run down (in our case 15 flights and we ran back up because the lifts were taking too long) to the EEP....luckily we had a 7am departure. We will stay at Laylow again.
user_name:
Stephanie P
New York City, New York

review_body: Pros1. Good design. I love the wood floor in lobby, pool, and some bar area. It is modern with Zen style.2. The bar is very nice. 3. Very good location. Next to the international market shopping mall. 5 min walk to beach. Next to Marukame Udon (a restaurant that always has a long line.) 4. Pool has soft water. They claimed it is heathy to skin. 5. A few gift, including two pairs of slippers.)Tips1. Valet parking is 35 per day. 2. no resort fee.Cons1. service is a bit slow. I asked for a kettle. It took a few hours to deliver.2. No free bottle waters except for the 2 when you check in.Overall, it is a good choice if you enjoy city life more than the beach.

Had a wonderful week with my wife at Lay Low - my first of hopefully many stays! We got a room on the 10th floor facing the pool, so it was quiet and we could get to sleep early. The hotel is run very well - everything is clean and in order - they washed the stone tile sidewalk once too. We really liked the shower - it had a great shower head, sliding glass doors, and interesting wood-like tile! There is a refridgerator you can put lots of items in, and its quiet. We loved how the bed covering is completely done with sheets - you don't mind at all having your arms on top of the bed covering.We got a breakfast package too - it was a credit for the Hideaway restaurant integrated into the hotel, so we could order different items each date. Oatmeal was great, egg dishes, and buckwheat pancakes. Plan on $25 a person when eating there (our credit covered this).Can't wait to return!

I am picky about properties that attempt to be boutique but are parts of a chain. They nailed it here. Design was executed well, staff was knowledgeable and friendly, restaurant was great, pool area had a nice calm scene if like minded people. I was only here one night but it was a great night Definitely spend the extra money for the concierge floor... it’s not a full meal but the offerings were delightful

This hotel was AMAZING! I stayed in three places during my stay in Waikiki and this was by far my favourite, beating a top rated beach front hotel. This hotel is only one easy walked block from the beach and worth it. The staff were amazing and were happy to help with any request. The rooms were clean with a cool vibe, comfy beds, and gorgeous bathroom (you should see the showers!). Oh it was super quiet!Not that we watched much TV but having a TV with a full channel set and Netflix ability was great, you don't see that much.Breakfast was included for us and was super yummy. Also best coffee we found in Waikiki. We don't do a lot of filter coffee in New Zealand so to have a proper barista in the hotel was such a bonus.I can't rate this hotel high enough, it should be WAY further up the ratings list. Laylow I would stay with you again in a heartbeat.

Stayed two nights in November with family. Loved this hotel. Great vibe, great lounge, restaurant lobby. The pool area is really nice and cozy. Our room was very clean, comfortable and decorated very trendy and modern. Would definitely stay here again. Enjoyed breakfast and dinner at their restaurant. Close to shopping and restaurants in International Marketplace.

I enjoyed sooooo much myself in this hotel although I was on my own.It s trendy, cool and modern. It has a great atmosphere, you can easily make contact with other guests or not and it's architecture is very cool. The swimming pool is great. The personnel is kind very helpful and friendly.The rooms are very comfortable and make you feel at home.I really recommend it if you are alone with friends or in couple

From the moment I walked in I knew this place was gonna be a great stay! From the awesome experience at the front desk to settling into my room it couldn’t have been more easy! Great spot so close to everything in waikiki and Julie made our trip! Great bartender and ambassador of ALOHA! You don’t get that kind of love visiting from neighbor islands usually....

This brand new resort offer you a contemporary taste of the Hawaiian way of life in the hearth of the over-urbanized area of Waikiki. We required the service of the concierge during our stay and we had an excellent and efficient experience with it. The salted water pool is an oasis of relaxation. The attention accorded to every single detail of the general atmosphere of this hotel make a big difference between all the standardized corporate hotels that you can find in Waikiki. Mahalo and we will be back for sure sooner or later.

I stayed two weeknights at The Laylow, Autograph Collection, in Waikīkī, Honolulu, with a complimentary upgrade to an ocean view on the 12th floor in a corner suite. The location is excellent, a mere 20 minutes from the unfathomably lousy international airport, seconds from the shops of the International Market Place, and minutes from the high-end boutiques of Kalakaua Avenue and the Kapiolani beach.
