In other words, it is in the heart of the place to be. The hotel offers 16 floors of stylish, comfortable accommodation in what is billed as a throwback to 1960s glory as might be experienced in Miami or Las Vegas. The hotel’s aesthetic matches its claim, but the overall feeling is one of underwhelming achievement. The property could and should do more, but it doesn’t. The “suite” is an example of the disappointment. I booked what unfortunately is the “best” and “biggest” room, which begs the question of what a standard room offers. The room boasts two balconies, one of which affords a commanding view of a neighbouring car park and the other a narrow ocean view. To be fair, this isn’t a beachfront hotel and so its nice to see the water at all. What really disappoints is the daily “Destination” fee for activities. The best way to describe it is as extortion, as the partner offers are of dubious value. I had to pay $50 daily for the convenience of WiFi that I’d have received for free anyhow and for other so-called amenities like pool towels, access to the gym, and daily newspapers. If I wanted Ukulele lessons, then I’d have paid for them separately. The fee should be optional at a property that isn’t anywhere close to a resort. It is enough to prevent my return as a guest and spoilt what was otherwise a pleasant stay.

Overall, very bad customer service at front desk, especially Kimberly and Stephanie. Room walls are paper thin and doors don't fully close. Have to pay for water. I picked this hotel for a business trip. I usually stay at Hilton Waikiki Village or Marriott Waikiki, but decided to try something new. The facilities at Laylow is pretty neat and the decoration is kinda weird given that it's in tropical Hawaii and their interior looks like IKEA European modern style. I was given a room on 9th floor at first, but I soon noticed the walls were paper thin and I was sharing a door with the next door and I could hear them talking clearly as if they were in my room. So I requested an upgrade by paying $20 more per night to get changed to 15th floor that they called the "executive floor". 15th is supposed to have free drinking water in the hallway, but the tap was broken the whole time I stayed. I also noticed that when the room door closes, there's a gap around the door and if you turn off the light, you can see a square of light coming through the gap, which is lights up the room at night and is very annoying. Location of the hotel is good though. I requested for complementary water, and got a response from the front desk (she also frowned upon my request rudely) that I could go to the bar and buy one at $5. Oh hell no. I ain't paying $250 per night to also pay for a bottle of purified water, this is crazy talk. Hilton and Marriott both have free waters at front desk and offer them to you at request. Here, no. And they make it sound like you are the crazy one. 15th noise level was better, but most rooms are facing the parking lot so you dont get any view. My suggestion is that if you are paying $250 anyways, go to Marriott or Hilton. They at least offer complementary upgrades and you can usually see a corner of the ocean at least. Upon checking out, I asked the front desk to put my small carry on with them and I'll be back to pick it up in 30 min. I stood there for 10 minutes when I watched Kimberly assisted customer after customer who were checking in and left me completely to the side. Finally I questioned whether they were always treating members like that and girl named Stephanie roller her eyes when she heard it. Bet these people got hired here because Laylow is newly opened and cannot find anything better than Kimberly and Stephanie. After finishing assisting customers who came way later than me at the front desk, Kimberly wrote me a tag, which only took less than 30 seconds. Then she rolled her eyes and apologized to the customer in front of her. EXCUSE ME?! This Laylow front desk overall is definitely NOT ALOHA SPIRIT, and they always seem to push back on your simplest request that you take for granted at other resorts. I won't be coming back, and will stick to my regular Marriott.

I can give nothing but accolades for the Laylow. Ashley was instrumental in helping me book the perfect rooms for our trip. She was extremely helpful and knowledge about the Laylow. The Laylow is lin a great location. It is right next to a very popular Udon restaurant, 5 minute walk to the beach, and away from all the hustle and bustle of the main strip. Everything you need is a 5 minute or less walk. Each room received an awesome welcome basket which includes sandals, candy, cookies, and water (Not sure if this is given to everyone.). The staff was very friendly and helpful. I am definitely going to stay at the Laylow next time I am in Waikiki.

This hotel was so cute and the staff was really awesome. Everything was very new and clean, it was very stylish. I enjoyed the coffee machine on the executive level. My only complaint is that the fees are very high, parking and resort fee.

Had the visit Hawaii for business, even though that’s hard to believe. Stayed at the Laylow and was surprised by how great the service was. The staff was friendly and welcoming. On top of that the breakfast options were amazing. The live music in the evening was great as well. Would recommend the place for sure.

Loved the decor and the location of this hotel - not directly in the hubbub of Kalakaua but not too far from the action with the beach only a 5 min walk away. The breakfasts were tasty and there are plenty of good food and drink options close by.Minor hiccups were that housekeeping was inconsistent in the level of cleaning they did in the rooms each day. Also, it may sound pedantic, but the mattresses were extremely soft offering very little back support. I’m not one to usually care about these things but it really affected the quality of sleep each night.

Hotel and location was excellent, staff young and dynamic. If you are planning to visit Honolulu and do not need the beach this is the place to stay. Restaurants all around the hotel and good shopping is a block away. Although you are staying in the middle of everything, once u walk in your room you will not notice anything from outside.

Beautiful hotel and gorgeous rooms. Coming from the Middle East, I expected the executive floor to have a room to grab a bite and some drinks (wine, beer etc) - the most disappointing executive floor access I've ever had! Just apple juice, coffee and water on a kitchen top with cookies and fruit. When I woke and left the next morning, it appeared most people had already taken their stash of cookies. We didn't use the pool as we went shopping before catching our flight home. There's a noodle place opposite the hotel which has a huge queue at all times! Due to our short pit stop, we didn't join the queue. We did enjoy the bar at the hotel and friendly banter with other guests and the staff.Would I return? Yes, but I wouldn't bother going to the executive floor.

We normally stay on the beach, but this time decided that we would try something different. Only a few blocks back from the beach, this well renovated hotel is in a great location. The shopping, restaurants and bars are within walking distance, and the hotel bar converts to a hip bar with resident DJ on Saturday night. The staff were all really nice, and the rooms have been renovated and are very well appointed. Our room did have a fixed floor lamp, that could not be plugged in anywhere! But that is the only small issue. Parking, is as always is limited, and is valet only (so we booked parking as part of the package). The restaurant food was great, and the staff were very friendly.

We absolutely loved this hotel in the heart of the city of Honolulu. It’s walking distance from great shopping and restaurants. Really great bar and restaurant at the hotel! The pool and bungalows were great for relaxing. Our room was quiet and comfortable. Definitely recommend

Key positives: excellent location, excellent value, updated/new rooms, cool environment/vibe. Waikiki Beach is 1.5 block from Laylow - short walk down Duke Alley thru a tourist market on the side of the alley. No resort fees. Close to shopping and restaurants. Parking is easy - excellent valet(only) service. Room upgraded to suite - Platinum. Restaurant and lounge excellent. Highly recommend this hotel.

Loved this location and the whole Laylow vibe! Steps from Waikiki beach and great shopping - luxe, craft and discount. Room was large with nice amenities like flip-flops! Great gift shop near the pool. Would def go back.
user_name:
MABM917
New York City, New York

review_body: Stayed here for 5 nights with my fiance in October 2017 while we were in Waikiki for a friend's wedding and would highly recommend. You get the consistency of Marriott service and standards with an intimate, local, boutique feel. Rooms were new and clean. Loved the pool area. Service was amazing and food was also really good. Check-in - Since it's a smaller hotel, early check-in is probably unlikely unless you have status and request before hand. Also don't think they have a hospitality suite but they do have nice, clean restrooms if you wanted to change/freshen up. Vibe - We loved the vibe at the hotel and ended up spending most of our time hanging out there by the pool. We found it much calmer and relaxing than the 1,000+ key resorts in the area and with a much more laid back/local vibe. While we didn't love Waikiki, we would be tempted to go back just to stay at this hotel again.Location - Great, central location. Next door to an ABC Store that opens at 7am and a lot of casual and higher end food options in the new International Marketplace. Also across the street from Marukame Udon so you can go at odd times when there is no line (we thought it was pretty good but not worth more than a 10-15 minute wait). Would also recommend Boss Tea for bubble tea right across the street and the Hula Dog food truck a few blocks down Kuhio. Really easy to get a taxi/uber but also walkable to the farther attractions Diamond Head (45 minutes), Ala Moana Center (30 minutes). F&B - Had breakfast a few mornings as well as drinks and food out by the pool. Food was always delicious and prices are reasonable for Waikiki. My personal favorite was the breakfast skillet fried rice and kalua pork egg rolls. Bar pretty lively at night and they have live music and lots of areas to just sit and chill. Pool Area - Small with some loungers, chairs and two cabanas but guests are pretty good about not reserving spots so we never had any issue getting a spot. On weekend afternoons, we would occasionally have to chill on a chair or in the pool for 15-20 minutes before a lounger opened up. During busier hours they have servers for food and drinks and when they don't, very easy to pop over to the bar and order yourself and they will bring it over. We were there in October so due to orientation of nearby buildings, best sun in the pool area was from 11am-3pm. Free shaved ice in the afternoons!Service - Everyone we interacted with was friendly and professional, especially the front desk staff and the servers.Only note is that we found housekeeping to run on a really late schedule so if you want your room cleaned before you return from the day's activities, would recommend calling and requesting a cleaning on your way out. Rooms - New, modern, clean, and well-furnished and thoughtfully decorated. The welcome basket upon arrival (ours had flip flops and snacks) was a nice touch. Only very minor comment on the bathrooms was there weren't enough hooks / towel racks so between the two of us, we had to get creative with towels, wet bathing suits, etc.

During my stay at the Laylow, I received an upgrade to a suite on the 14th floor that included a balcony and a welcome gift also. The hotel is very new looking but is a block off the main strip of Waikiki.The hotel is attached to the international marketplace and so many things are within walking distance from food, to the beach, to stuff to do. I opted to park on the Ala Wai for free, but valet parking is available for your stay.The feel of the room is very modern and has a great Hawaii feel to it. The view from the outside was just ok, but staying in the room felt just at home. The pool is also a Salt Water so that makes for the ocean experience without having to deal with so many people. For a hotel not quite on the strip, but still close to everything, this is a great choice.

The rooms were great big and clean, the staff from the General Manager to cleaners could not do enough for us.The Bar staff and restaurant staff always said hello.2 streets back from the beach was not an issue, the pool and the night life made the holiday

I travelled to the Laylow with my boyfriend and 2 young kids.This is our 3rd time on the island of Oahu and I always stay somewhere new everytime.This hotel lived up to my expectations!PROSTHE POOL - if you have young kids, this pool is very child friendly. its only 3 feet (maybe 3 1/2 feet deep at the most) my kids loved it bc they could confidently go out on their own and I didnt have to worry too much. this is a boutique hotel so the pool never got too busy. anytime of day you can find a seat by the pool. another plus - the pool towels were so pretty!!!TOILETTRIES - I usually never use in in-room bodywash, shampoo etc. but the ones provided smelt so good! I even used it on my kids and didnt have any problemsFREE GIFT BASKET - each room has a gift basket that includes snacks, water and flip flops! (again SO PRETTY)DESIGN - everything looked like the pictures. the room, the lobby, the resto/bar. aesthetically pleasing. LOCATION - if this hotel isnt centrally located, i dont know what is! right beside the international marketplace, 3 blocks from waikiki beach, literally 3 blocks from everywhere you want to go!CONS (not many)VALET - the staff was very nice and worked as quickly as they could but i just felt like they didnt have enough staff. the same valet who took our car, delivered our luggage to our room. so i guess valet and bell services are the same.NO ICE MACHINE - went searching for one but can only get from front desk. didnt bother us that much bc there is a fridge in-room THE VIEW - i didnt pay extra for a better view. we were on the 4th floor and the parking garage was literally outside our window. the cars parked across can probably see us without even trying.

We only stayed a night since we were transiting from Australia to Canada but oh I wish we could have stayed longer!! Friendly staff, especially Jarren at the front desk who was really helpful and caring. Clean bedroom with a nice welcome basket, delicious cocktails selection at the lounge in the lobby. Hotel is about two blocks away from the beach and lots of shopping to do around. We'll be back next time for a longer stay :)

The staff was friendly. The restaurant/coffee shop is beautiful. They had a live band one of the nights we were there and we liked it. Our room was right in front of the elevator on ninth floor and all night, there was some kind of an air stream coming in/out of the elevator and through our balcony door and it made a lot of noise. I opened the door just a little bit and it got better, but I would recommend you ask to have a room that is not in front of the elevator. We had a few drinks and rolls (they were delicious) by the pool, the pool section is perfect. We booked Kualoa Ranch zipline activity with the hotel because they offered a 50$ discount - and it was super fun. I recommend this hotel to everybody, we enjoyed it.

Well-maintained with a unique character that is both vintage and modern. They’ve done a good job with the touches that make this a “boutique” hotel, but it lacks basic features; otherwise, it would have gotten an “excellent” rating from me.-There is no ice machine available for guest use. (Guests obtain ice from front desk.)-Outside of the hotel restaurant and bar, (which close at 11:00 p.m.) there is no access on the property to food or drink. Not even a vending machine, or anything to eat or drink in the gift shop.-No coffee maker in guest rooms. (The hotel has a coffee shop in the lobby.)The personal-care ammenities in the guestvrokms are top-notch (body wash, shampoo, etc.)

I'm not one to complain about my stay a lot, but when hard earned elite status goes almost unnoticed, that I have a problem with. Bell staff and valet were very nice, front office was a little dry (most of them don't even smile - it's Hawaii!). Very young staff, which I believe need more training on brand and customer service standards. I decided to extend one more day in Hawaii, so I was advised to stay in the same room (corner king suite) I liked the suite for the most part (bathroom was small). So I asked the front desk if they can send extra water bottles, she told me she can't do that as it's basically one stay and water bottles are scarce(something to that context) I mean how could that be? It's a freakin hotel! She did offer me a drink in a cup. While on the elevator, I could overhear another elite member saying that their lounge sucks, I was like they have a lounge?! He said yeah it's only for platinum members its on the 16th floor. NO ONE TOLD ME THIS. I quickly went downstairs and asked about it, and the reason why I (a plat elite) didn't have access to it. She told me it's only for elite members staying on that floor, I told her that's unacceptable because a lot of the people who were going there didn't stay on the 16th floor. She told me that she'll give me comp access this one time. This was so weird. On my last day, I called SEVERAL times to have my room made, and I'm not exaggerating this, I mean several I told them I was heading out to dinner. So come to find out once I got back up to the suite, my room has not been made at all! I called clearly upset and told the front desk emp(male) this, he said that it's weird why they missed it. So he offered 5k points into my account I said, yes, that would be great. A couple of days after my stays posted, NO 5,000K BONUS POINTS. What is it?! SO many excuses, like no water, they missed your room (several times), poor customer service from front desk. This is by far the worst hotel service Ive received with my elite status and surprisingly it's in Hawaii where people are supposed to be warm and friendly (I come from an island too). Plus no parking fee waiver for elites. They should just charge once for a stay. I get that this is a new hotel, but this being an autograph brand, you should up your standards, invest in a better lounge, give complimentary breakfast (not coupons) and retrain your staff. Otherwise category level should be lower IMO.Some positive points:AGM was friendly enough, she was helping out with the shaved ice service. Bell/Valet staff were mostly friendlyTV was nice, with Netflix option.

Loved, Loved, Loved the Laylow! Staff was great, toiletries great, linens great, food great, welcome basket great, location great! Decor was chic and trendy! The $ 35 parking charge seemed high but perhaps is the going rate. Only negatives I could mention was one night music at the pool didn’t get muted and was too loud and disruptive to sleep and one elevator went out one morning during checkout. We are Marriott Rewards Gold members and are pleased to report we really appreciated the $15 pp Hideaway vouchers. ( not good on alcohol) The food was excellent! Didn’t miss a “ lounge” at all!

Stayed here for a week with my Mum & Sister. Great room - spacious and ultra modern. From the moment we arrived everyone was super friendly and helpful - from the concierge to the coffee crew, the bar and the valet team Thank you helping make our week memorableI must say the female singer they had @ the bar on Friday night should probably not return. She wasn’t very good

Great location and only a stone throw away from the main Waikiki beach. Lots to offer around (shopping!) which makes it quite convenient. Love the design of the hotel, modern hawaiian retro. The hotel is clean, great cafe and restaurant, we thoroughly enjoyed the coffee and breakfast everyday. Rooms a little to the small side, but sufficient for a 2 night stay. Only fault would perhaps be the cleanliness of the rooms and bathroom - perhaps the shower room and the drains can be cleaned more frequently, as I saw lots of hair trapped and it is unsightly (perhaps a matter of design?). All in all, it was a decent stay.

The Laylow hotel is modern and sophisticated. It's not right on the beach, but definitely close enough to walk to and from throughout the day. There is a nice pool. The rooms are clean and sweet. The best part is definitely the Hideout restaurant/ bar. The staff there are so friendly and welcoming. It's an amazing spot to kick it or party on the weekends. The daily live music is amazing and unforgettable. I cannot wait to travel back. Make sure to ask for the GM of hideout, he's an awesome guy who will give you the best recommendations on the island.

The Laylow, a boutique 1960’s Hawaii retro hotel with mid-century flair is centrally located in Waikiki on Kuhio Avenue. It is right across the street from the notable restaurant, Marukame Udon. It is a 10-minute walk from the world-famous Waikiki Beach. Would not recommend for anyone that wants to be right on the beach. It is however a short walk or even shorter Uber ride away. Check-In is an escalator ride up from Kuhio Ave. The hotel is right next door to Michael Mina’s establishment, The Street. If you were walking on Kuhio, you probably wouldn’t notice Laylow as it tries to encompass the concept of its’ title, a place where you can lay low in the chaos of Waikiki. It’s bar Hideout has a similar concept. Once you reach the top of the escalator, you’re greeted with mid-century furniture and leafy palms. On the lobby floor, you’ll find the Restaurant, Bar (Hideout), Coffee Shop, Saltwater Pool, Gift Shop, and where your clients check in. The saltwater pool provides infused water and cocktail service from the bar. They also include complimentary shave ice. Fun fact: Hawaiians don’t call it shaved ice, for some reason they knock off the d. Reason for a 4: Long wait time at The Hideout for Guests and no Hawaiian coffee at the coffee bar. Room: Sync your phone up to the TV and play music from the Bluetooth connection. Included in the $25 Resort Fee are complimentary snacks, thongs or slippers (flip flops), and a ukulele in your room. You can bring the ukulele downstairs to the lobby for complimentary lessons. The rooms are uniquely designed with palm print wallpaper and certain quirks: books from authors on Hawai’i or Hawaiian authors. Maak (pronounced make) bath products are inspired by the native flora of the region and are specific to the Laylow. I.e., you will not find their smell anywhere else. Every room or suite has a lanai. Con: The coffee shop does not serve Hawaiian coffee. How is that so? It is the only state in the U.S. that can grow coffee commercially. I would recommend reconsidering the lighting as the rooms are slightly dim. I would also recommend reserving a few sofas at Hideout for Guests Only as our group had to wait over 15 minutes when many sofas were available. All in all, I would highly recommend.

Very lovely hotel. Great Wifi. The pool is pretty small but the sun lounges are very comfy. The staff are very friendly and the rooms are modern. The location is in the middle of Wakiki, very good for shopping but a bit if a walk to the beach. The restraunt plays live music for dinner and has a good bar but I can’t drink. Very nice hotel and great value.

The Laylow Autograph Collection hotel, which is close to the wakiki beach area, is an excellent hotel to stay at. It has just recently been renovated and is very appealing, very clean, and very accessible. It is close to many things including only two blocks from wakiki Beach. It also has a great breakfast.

Avid Honolulu visitor. On previous visits I have experienced the Royal Hawaiian, Moana, Sheraton Waikiki, Ala Moana and the Prince. I can honestly say that if you are looking for personalized friendly service visit the Lay Low hotel.We arrived at the hotel after a tedious and exhausting trip from the mainland where we were greeted by a charming and enthusiastic Lei Lani at the front desk. We were delighted to find that we had been upgraded to a suite through my Starwood preferred membership. When we entered our room we noted the new, up to date retro design. Many of the older hotels in Honolulu could use an update. It was a pleasure to stay in a newly renovated room. We enjoyed the welcome basket that was provided.We were constantly impressed with the friendly service of all of the desk staff who personally acknowledged us and greeted us by name.Must mention the fantastic food at the small restaurant on the property. We especially enjoyed the delicious breakfast menu.When I returned from my visit I had a question about my bill. I called the hotel and Summer was able to provide an answer to my question in a timely and courteous manner.This will be my go to hotel in Honolulu in the future.

First time at this hotel and very pleasantly surprised. The location is centrally located close to the beach and great shopping areas. You can easily walk anywhere from here. The rooms are very nice mid-century modern. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The front desk staff is super especially Sheila A. who was more than happy to answer our many questions and help with directions. We would definitely stay at this hotel again. Very quiet and restful rooms.
user_name:
Danielle R
San Marcos, United States

review_body: Apart from this Hotel being a top Hotel in an excellent location, the team here do go the extra Mile for their guests. We had a situation where my wife had to go to Hospital by Ambulance (nothing to do with Hotel). Robert and his team could not have been more helpful! They met the Paramedics and assisted them to get to my wife asap. That wasn't the end of it; upon our return from Hospital, Robert Freidl and his team were genuinely concerned for my wife and could not have been more helpful. As a Business consultant I rate Robert and his team 10/10! You only ever discover how good an organisation is when things go wrong. Laylow Hawaii are excellent. We will be back. Thanks you Robert and the Team at Laylow

The Laylow is perfectly located in the heart of Waikiki. Only one block from the beach and just next to all the shops and restaurants. The rooms has a modern vibe and are very clean. We stayed 5 adults in a Corner Suite. Lots of room for everyone. Actually we choose the hotel for the price and location - and when we arrived we were pleased to see that to hotel was just as pretty as on the photos. The staff is kind and we got our room an hour early. Every night there is live music in the bar / restaurant. Will definitely recommend and probably come back myself!

Recently renovated. Retro Chic. Great location with lots of shopping and dining options. Lots of friendly touches. Staff very friendly and helpful. Can be a bit noisy with traffic and music permeating into the rooms at midnight. Ask for a room on high floor. In room Coffee and Tea making facilities not standard but can be requested. Good space for afternoon drinks and bites on the terrace. Overall a good experience. Will definitely visit again.

The Laylow was the perfect hotel for my sister's bachelorette! Summer, the hotel manager, was nothing short of superb as she was able to answer all of our questions and accommodate our needs. We did not reserve a suite; however we did get two King Deluxe Rooms and they were just right for 7 women. Upon arrival they provided a delicious, fresh mango snack and fragrant hand towels, which were a nice touch. Inside each room they had a complimentary basket of snacks, as well as two free pairs of super cute "slippahs." The breakfast was literally the best free hotel breakfast I've ever had because you can use your credit at their coffee shop, which has amazing coffee and ridiculously scrumptious baked goods. The pool is smaller compared to other chain hotels, but it was perfect for us and not crowded at all. The lounge chairs inside the pool were great and the beach towels are really cute! The location is perfect as it is right across the street from Marukami Udon (over 6k reviews on Yelp!), next to the International Market with shops and restaurants, next to Nordstrom Rack, and a short walk to the beach. The decor is tropical chic and I would hire their interior designer in a second for my own home. The only feedback I would give is that the rooms need a little more lighting and the Friday night bartenders could have been a little more friendly (told us they couldn't serve us from where we were standing and already waiting for 20mins). Other than that, the Laylow was excellent and I will definitely stay there again.

Stayed here 3 nights and what an excellent experience. The rooms on the concierge level were fabulous and we were greeted by a welcome basket of flip flops, cookies, dried fruit and taro chips. The outdoor restaurant bar overlooking one of the main streets gave you a beautiful view of downtown and had nice outdoor fire pits to relax by. The poke ( Asian ahi tuna and rice dish) was wonderful as was the breakfast. The hotel is conveniently located in the center of everything and just a couple blocks from Waikiki beach. Plenty of shops and other restaurants to choose from. We loved the outdoor wading pool and the comfortable lounge chairs. The staff was very good and do meet Richard Guerrero, their concierge. He made our trip so enjoyable and was full of great ideas where to go and what to do. Would stay there again in a minute. While we were fortunate to have platinum Marriott status, it is still less and expensive than some other hotels in Honolulu.Very impressive, modern and chic!

The Laylow is a chic, mod hotel decorated in a retro theme. Our room was attractively appointed with cute touches like complimentary flip-flops and a golden pineapple that I was tempted to take home with me. The bed was very comfortable with nice linens and they didn’t skimp on the towels like some hotels. The Good: spotless room, nice staff, and valet attendants were super helpful (even offering food recommendations). The Bad: Noise. Located in the heart of Honolulu you hear street noise and walls weren’t terribly thick. We had the misfortune of being in a room on the 15th floor located directly across from a mini-bar of sorts that held their continental breakfast offerings of coffee, fruit, and pastries. Every morning we were awakened at 5:00 am sharp with the sounds of the staff clanking containers and refilling their coffee machine. After an hour of that noise then came the patrons standing around and talking as they got their coffee. The idea that a food station would not interfere with the peace of guest rooms nearby, is incredibly short-sighted and unrealistic. We asked to be moved to another room, but the hotel was full. When we checked out a savvy staff member compensated us for the inconvenience, but I had to fight for it. I can’t emphasize enough what a poor design this is, so if you book an Executive Suite be sure that you don’t get placed next to that bar!

Stayed at the Laylow for a long weekend recently. It was amazing.Staff was extremely kind and professional, valet crew was great, and the stay was extremely pleasant.The bar and restaurant staff were extremely nice and made our experience so enjoyable.I hosted a large crew for a dinner/happy hour and it was so fun. reserved one of the fire pits and had a great time.If you are looking for a nice boutique hotel in the heart of Waikiki, this is your diamond.I would stay here again any day!

The valet and service of this hotel is the best I've ever experienced! The valet crew is awesome! So friendly and quick! Allen and the crew was great! Thanks for the stay! We will definitely be back and recommend it!

Am staying at present. The hotel room has very nice decor. Nice large tv with many different channels. The bathroom is very nice as Well. The bed however is quit horrible. The bed is hard, the pillows are High and very bad, the duvet is synthetic fibers, bed not at all up to par with other hotels in the marriott family. Af is working nicely though. Just arrived home first evening. Room not cleaned, beds not made etc. Talked to reception, they where not sure if they Could manage a cleaning Now. They asked if i had put the sign on this morning, to which i answered yes, untill noon. The reply was that when they see the sign, they do not Make up the rooms. There is a sign in the room saying that cleaning is from 9am to 5 pm, hmmm that is kinda strange.The breakfast is a la carte. We had breakfast included for two. We are 3. Asked when checking in, they told me that breakfast was one entree and a non alcoholic beverage pr person, for two people. When asking the same question at the breakfast restaurant, the nice lady told me that we Could order what ever we wanted. I told her that sounded Strange. She Got what i Think might be the superviser, which told me we could spend 50 USD, and the additional was extra. Took her word for it. Would however have been nice with non conflicting answers.The breakfast is not to my liking. Way overpriced, Lots of fat laced options, and they are not quit sure what a Continental breakfast is. On the laylow it is coffee, juice and a Pastry at 13 USD. A Danish is 6 dollars.Pool area is very good for waikiki, with some treats during the day, like shaver ice water and the likes.The hotel staff is very nice, and the whole decor is authentic to Honolulu. The location is also quit nice.Would I stay again? Probably not, as the essential for me is the bed and breakfast.

We stayed at the The Laylow from sept 7-11 and we had a great time! The hotel is in the middle of everything and love its location because it's right next to shopping and restaurants .Love the mid century meets Hawaii designsAll the little are amazing!We had the suite (disable room) since I needed a hand held shower (Regular rooms only have head shower) when I'm giving my toddler a shower. The room is spacious and I love the day bed!!The breakfast was great but kindha pricey but is expected since we are in Waikiki.Overall, I'll come back again and love the hotel!

I wanted to update my last review. We visited in May right after they had opened and there were many complaints as they had starting pains and not many incentives for Elite members to stay.In two months when we visited again in July, they had made many improvements and we will stay here. For one, Elite members do get better treatment including $15 vouchers that can be used in the hotel restaurant or bar for food or drinks.Everything was much smoothly run. It is probably now our "go-to" place in Waikiki.

I never envisioned myself staying on Kuhio when I thought of lodging in Waikiki. Let me tell you the place has changed. I noticed a few hotels going through makeovers. My guess would be to keep up with the International Marketplace. I decided to give the Laylow a chance after seeing it on Instagram. I give this a 5/5 on the IG meter. You pull up to the narrow valet driveway steps from the escalator that lifts you from the crowd. Once you step off into the open air lobby you see the simple clean interiors. The pool area is quaint. The most important staple for the modern day traveler is anchored right in the heart of the lobby...the espresso machine. The super adorable reception area with the hulah dolls. Have those trigger fingers ready on your smartphone. Like I said 5/5 on the IG meter. The feeling of "I picked the right place" hit me.The customer service of EVERYONE was EXCELLENT. From check in to check out, we were constantly greeted upon arrival and departure for the day's activities. Michelle who was constantly monitoring activities was so gracious and also remembered my boys' names and took the time asking how was their stay. A great touch!The room was clean and really well done. I thought the wood panel in shower was sick! BTW water pressure was great. The two kings (I think) were nice to come back to and sprawl out on after a day of activities. I even loved the books that were on the book shelves. Wifi signal was strong too. Whether you were in your room, lanai, pool or lobby.The hotel is close enough to plethora of restaurant. Too many to name. All you need to know is udon across the street and ABC about 40 feet from escalators. I ate breakfast one morning and pancakes and French toast were delicious.In the evening, the Hideout had a different performer nightly and the music was too 40's and every single one was awesome. Not your boring lounge singer that moaned the oldies. I enjoyed listening from my balcony some nights too. Here's the thing if you want a quiet night's sleep you probably shouldn't be within a four block radius of Waikiki. Have fun in the North Shore. Book your stay now! You won't be disappointed.

As visitors as well as military looking for discounts , this is a great place. It is in a great busy accommodating atmosphere. It is very trendy and stylish as well as family and pet friendly. The locations to eat and entertain you are nearby, within walking distance. Its new and as always, it depends on what you like.

This hotel has an interesting vibe that tries to be funky, cool and fun and mostly succeeds. Our room had a ukulele which I learned to play on YouTube, ha ha. The decor in the rooms consists of open shelving with a bunch of books, the ukulele and other Hawaiian-themed things. However it would be nice if they put books on the shelves that were helpful or interesting for the guests! The ones in our room were weird and boring photo books. I guess they picked titles people would not want to steal. Hotel has a really tiny pool that is largely in the shade. They apparently serve shaved ice in the lobby but no one mentioned that to us. It is a LOOOOOONG convoluted walk to the beach (minimum 10 minutes if you walk really fast) from here. Don't stay here if you plan to spend a lot of time at the beach!! Also, bathrooms had NO towel racks to hang up wet bathing suits etc and the shower door went to the ceiling so that didn't work either. We thought this was a serious oversight in design. Our room was super quiet, which we loved. But the ice makers are all located on the lobby level, which we hated. Overall, this hotel was nice but it was too far from the beach for us.

Overall I had a pleasant 3 night stay in mid August. Loved that they had 2 king beds in one room. And the room came with complimentary snacks and 2 flip flops upon arrival. And they had towels on the pool area that we can take to the beach that is 5 minute walk. It's not a beach front property but we knew that. It is next to International Market that provided convenient food options nearby and shopping if you needed anything. Having ABC store next door was also great when I needed water bottles and snacks.Housekeeping did a good job overall and was pleasant to deal with. The 2 negatives I have to say was that we had a low floor and it was facing the pool. At night, there is music playing and you can hear some conversations and in the morning, you can hear cars and buses passing by. Being that this was the first island that we arrived to and we were jet lag so we were able to sleep anyway so we never asked for a room change. Not sure if the low floor assignment had anything to do with booking through Costco. I am a Marriott member but did not get any benefits since I didn't book directly with them. The second negative was the valet parking fee and resort fee. There is no self parking in garage and sometimes had to wait a few minutes to get your car even if you call early and getting into the valet check in, one time, the line was out the street. The resort fee, only thing I felt I benefited was the one time snack in the room and the one time I used towels to the beach. The pool though nicely kept was a bit small. Never knew about the shaved ice in the afternoon as was never told when I arrived. Never used the concierge and $50 activity credit as you need to spend $100+. Might be a nice discount for 2 person but we were a family with children. But I would still recommend this hotel if you are not looking for a beach front hotel. Just ask for a higher floor and hopefully you won't need the valet parking.

Really wanted to love my stay here, unfortunately, a few hiccups. Facilities and rooms were great. We arrived early so staff did their best to get us into a room as soon as possible, which we were very grateful for. However, after a day or two, I noticed there were many extra charges on my credit card for which there was no explanation. These charges were in the hundreds. The staff did their best to fix the issue and prevent it from reoccurring by removing my credit card, however, I wasn't able to get the funds back immediately which limited what we could do during our last days. To top it off, after we returned home, they charged AGAIN for the entire stay. The payments were returned a week later, however, as a young student, this was very inconvenient for me. Emailed but got no reply back. TV also didn't work for half the stay, requested twice for it to be fixed then broke again and wasn't repaired after another request. One of the women at the front desk was very good to us, tried to help as much as she could and waived destination fee but overall, not a very pleasant stay.

This hotel has been open a few months and we decided on a little weekend staycation in Waikiki. We were qualified for a certain rate that was a great surprise in that it was all inclusive. Room rate, internet, valet parking, "destination amenity fee" and a $100 food and beverage credit. No extra charges or hidden fees upon checkout...very transparent and a nice change.Being Marriott Premier Platinum, hotels are usually very good to us. This hotel was no exception and they provided a room upgrade to a corner "suite" on a high floor. Always appreciated, but the "suite" was just a regular hotel room with a partition separating the bed and a couch/table. Regardless, it was nice of them to do and the room was perfect for the two of us. The staff at valet were a warm welcome, reception was a little slow as there was only on person on the desk at the time, but very pleasant once it was our turn. Since the hotel doesn't have a lounge, they offered bonus points or breakfast vouchers for the morning. The executive floors do have a small continental breakfast on each floor with juice, coffee, fresh fruit and pastries. While not typical, it was great for when we woke up and wanted to relax before going down for full breakfast. Speaking of full breakfast...the POG (Passion, orange, guava) mimosa was great and the Hideout Benedict with pulled pork instead of Canadian bacon was awesome! Also had the Nutella French Toast...ridiculously good.Having dinner plans elsewhere, we decided to enjoy some drinks at the Hideout (hotel bar) before heading out for sunset. Over walks our waitress Cassandra, who couldn't have been more full of life. She was awesome and a joy to talk with. We used our F&B credit to start the evening off with a bottle of Champagne while sitting out by the sand surrounded fire pit on the lanai. A nice way to wind down from the day and get your evening in Waikiki started,Didn't use the pool and it's rather small, but there is a pretty good sized pool a few blocks away. I like to call it the Pacific Ocean. Another observation was that the neighboring buildings started to shade the pool mid-afternoon.Staff the next morning at the desk were a little confused on how to accept a Marriott gift card. Still left the property without a finalized bill, but I'm sure the accounting department will figure it out.Car brought around and again, a pleasant interaction with the valet staff. A fond farewell was offered and smiles. I would definitely stay here again when we want a little break in Waikiki.

We spent 4 days and 3 nights in a King suite on the 15th floor. The room was decorated in a retro but comfortable style. It was plenty roomy for the 3 of us. The welcome basket, mini-frig and fair-sized bathroom were all nice touches. The A/C worked well and the room was cleaned nicely each morning. We had a partial ocean view from the balcony. The pool wasn't large but was nice for an afternoon dip. It was close to the beach and all sorts of shopping and dining. Being next to the new International Marketplace was very convenient! Would definitely stay again!

Fresh, bright, comfortable, modern hotel in the heart of Waikiki. Happy, attentive, smart staff. A lovely place to stay, plus great coffee at the cafe in reception. Complementary welcome hamper was a classy touch.

First, we arrived at 5:30am from the airport. They quickly checked our luggage so we could get outside and see the beautiful sunrise! After breakfast they were able to accommodate us to get into our rooom at 9:30am. We were exhausted and that was so kind and above and beyond. The pool area was so much fun. One complaint is it needs more shade. We were lucky enough to get a shaded cabana so that was really helpful. Great food and drinks poolside and loved the lounge chairs in the shallow water! Staff were so friendly and kind! Free shaved ice from 1-2pm. My kids (and my husband and I) all loved that! There was a ukelele lesson at 5pm but we missed it. Breakfast was included in our rate and that was very tasty and the kids ate free (under 12). The rooms were so comfortable. Loved the beds (we had 2 kind beds!!!) Loved the decor and the welcome basket ( flip flops, honolulu local treats etc) and Loved playing my pandora through the TV. Also loved the bath products.Overall, this hotel was amazing. We were only in Honolulu for 30+ hours on our way to another island but I would stay here again in a heartbeat. I wish I remembered the staff who helped us, but the front desk team and pool team and restaurant staff were all top notch!

Where do I start? I'd like to start with my initial meeting with the sales manager Patricia. The energy she brings is just what is needed while visiting Hawaii and this luxurious hotel. I met with her after a terrible stay at the Holiday Inn Express which is right down the street from the LayLow Autograph. During our meeting, she welcomed me with fresh fruit and food from their lounge area which is called the Hideout (details to come). She gave me a brief history about the hotel and the direction it is heading to. I was given the opportunity to sample some of the food that was made by the hotel Chef who is an amazing cook. Patricia also gave me a tour around the hotel and allowed me to see what the rooms will look like once I checked-in. Once I saw what the rooms looked like, my jaw dropped in astonishment because this was going to be my home for a few months. I was so excited!!!I must say from the minute I got out of my vehicle (Valet) and made it to the top of the escalator, I was highly impressed. Patricia did not have to say much about the hotel. I was sold already lol. Once you make it to the top of the escalator or elevator, you're introduced to the hotels "Hideout at the LayLow". It's a bar, restaurant and lounge area which is part of the hotel. This is definitely the place to be while visiting Waikiki. The managers Ben & Chandly (I hope I pronounced it correctly, so sorry) lol, are so awesome. They make you feel right at home. They greet you whenever you enter in the lounge area and seat you at your table. The Hideout has live entertainment 7 days a week which starts at 7 - 10 pm. They also offer a happy hour from 4-630 pm. On Friday and Saturday evening they have a live well known Dj who gets the party started from 9pm - 12am. They have a killer bar that has every drink known to man and also some of the hotels specialty themed drinks. The restaurant and bar closes down at midnight every night. The Hideout patio is filled with soft outdoor furniture which sits under the moonlight. Tiki torches are also lit to bring out the mellow ambience of the great people who partake at the Hideout. I'd like to recognize the employees at the LayLow Autograph that I can remember off the top of my head. This is in no particular order:Patricia, Ben, Chandly, Housekeepers, Victoria, Rachel, Hoku, Jarren, Leilani, Morgan, Cassandra, Daysha, Emily, Forrest, Seth, Shania, Trevor, Julie, Richard, Chefs, Cindy, Rita, The Entire Valet Crew, and Night Watchmen Crew. If you want the bests nights rest, outstanding customer service and have the option to socialize with great people, this hotel is the best hotel for you in Waikiki.....Guaranteed!!!!

I was very very pleased with my stay at the Laylow. This hotel is awesome. It's modern, perfect location, it also has a restaurant located inside the hotel with live music Sun-Thur and a DJ on Fri and Sat. Our room come with a very nice gift basket. Also they have complementary shaved ice in the lobby from 1-2pm.The whole Staff was wonderful! Especially Patricia and Ben. They both are wonderful and make you feel like you're at home. They go above and beyond to make sure you are totally satisfied and comfortable. They are really awesome. I highly recommend staying here.

This hotel is close to everything - short walk to the beach, right by all the great shopping, and surrounded by great restaurants. I wish it were right on the beach but none of the places right on the beach have rooms with 2 king beds, which we wanted for our family and a friend vacationing with us. We got just what we wanted at the Laylow. We also appreciated the lovely welcome baskets at our arrival with snacks, drinks and flip flops. We also enjoyed the free afternoon shaved ice treats by the pool. The pool is a bit small but it's lovely. The concierges were helpful. And we paid for breakfast with our rooms and were not disappointed- they have a host of delicious choices! All in all - a great place to stay if you're interested in staying in the Waikiki Beach area.

What a great boutique hotel! This hotel is small and intimate with great décor, friendly staff and an amazing location. While you can't see the beach, the location is a couple of blocks from the Royal Hawaiin hotel and the International mall. The rooms were perfect with a lovely décor and great bathroom. The pool area was amazing and unexpected and we fell asleep twice on the big comfy chairs after a day at the beach!

We stayed at the Laylow in June. Its a fun trendy hip hotel. The ladies at the front desk were full of "aloha" and really sweet to my kids. The lobby is the most fun with their hula doll collection and swings from the ceiling. The rooms are modern and chic. The only reason I give 4 stars is because of the pool area. The pool is on the smaller side and a basic rectangle with a few chairs inside. It is near the lobby and popular bar so its not very private. And gets shaded early because its surrounded by tall buildings. Besides the pool area I recommend this place!

This is my second stay at the Laylow and I absolutely love it. I have a peak-a-boo view of the ocean ... and the location feels convenient and pleasant ... albeit in an area of Waikiki that is becoming increasingly more gentrified (this hotel is certainly evidence of that - with a 60 million dollar stylish mid-century modern re-do of an Aqua brand hotel). Rooms are sleek and modern, but housekeeping could use a bit of consistency & standardization (felt like I got a different combination of towels and toiletries each day ... one day no washcloths, one day they didn't pick up old towels, one day no bar soap or body wash, one day a rubber bath mat appeared but no cotton bath mat ...??). No in room coffee ... but they will being a Kurieg to your room upon request. They have a daily resort fee ... which seems questionable for having only a salt water pool. Lovely front desk staff. Steps away from the International market, nestled between two great coffee chains, Pink line trolley stop, an ABC store & famous Udon shop next door ... and Maguro Bros. poke shop down the street. My kind of perfect in the bustle and hustle of Waikiki.

Great centrally located hotel - handy to many restaurants, transport and short walk to beaches. Good facilities. Room on 8th floor was spacious, clean with balcony overlooking pool. Front desk staff were friendly and helpful. Some much more knowledgeable then others though. tour desk by Expedia in foyer- Patrick was extremely helpful and booked all our cruise shore excursions saving us $$$. Highly recommend this hotel.

I am Platinum Premier with Marriott which means I stay 160 to 180 days per year in Marriott hotels.The Laylow is clean and modern as it has recently been renovated. Facility-wise it's one of the best in the area.The issue I have is being Platinum Premier - by the time you figure in the $25 destination (free shaved ice is what you pay for) fee and the parking fees and the lack of a real lounge – it is actually cheaper to use your cross benefits with SPG and stay at the Sheraton Waikiki which waives the destination fee as well as the parking fee for Platinum members.The lounge is small and offers little more than snacks throughout the day and closes at 9 PM. They do offer a $15 breakfast credit but the breakfast downstairs runs around $20.I've grown weary of all the little tricks to nickel and dime customers – while I don't mind paying extra to stay in a nice hotel, I don't like paying extra then getting fee after fee on top of that with little recognition of Platinum Premier status.My suggestion to management is to improve your lounge – go to the Sheraton and you'll see a well run lounge - and waive fese for your Elite status folks - esp Platinum and up. I know you're new at this but it seems like you always have rooms available while some of the other hotels in the area do not...during a 2 week stay at the Sheraton in July I met 6 Marriott Platinums who chose the Sheraton for the same reasons - and all of us agreed we rarely if ever stay outside the Marriott brand... Bring your game up and you'll see your hotel stay full especially with those of us extremely loyal to Marriott!

Relaxed atmosphere, modern with the obby area having a nice open plan appeal. 5 minute walk to beach and close proximity to cafes,restaurants,shops including international market place. Coin laundry and ABC store close by with a short walk to trolley and bus stop. I like the pool area even though it is a lap pool and others have reviewed it as small. Has 2 x undercover cabanas and adequate deck chairs and lounging chairs in pool itself. Free snow cones by pool daily after 1pm, beach towels provided. There were two of us and we had Junior Suite on the 5th floor with street view and small balcony which was adequate for us but not overly spacious. Shower caps not provided in amenities,however hairdryer and ironing board in room. No hanging hook in bathroom to hang clothing or towels. No tea/coffee making facilities in the room which was a negative for me as I don't want to go downstairs to cafe bar first thing in the morning. Hideout restaurant and bar nice and very popular with live music each night. Best to request a higher floor so music doesn't disturb you and street noises don't interrupt your sleep. As mentioned we were on Level 5 and heard music and street noise but we were prepared and had earplugs anyway so no problem. You can choose street view or pool view rooms. We arrived by taxi and the valet area had 3 staff working at the time of our arrival. All staff members were talking amongst themselves and only after we unloaded our bags did one staff member approach us to ask if we required assistance. No welcome greeting was extended and no direction given to the lifts or lobby area. Not the most welcoming customer service experience I would expect from a four star rated property. Working in the hospitality and tourism industry myself I pay particular attention to customer service standards wherever I go. Checking in at front desk was worry free, however I could not say any "wow" factor was evident and staff provided polite service but again no welcome greeting was extended. We had breakfast once at the property where we provided our room number but then decided to pay cash and discovered on checkout we had been charged again for our meal. In the end front desk staff deducted the amount from my account however it did take a few phone calls to the accounts area. On our last day at the property our room was not serviced which was also a little disappointing. Even with the issues I have listed I would and have recommend this hotel due to its location, price and nice modern appeal.

Beautiful hotel walking distance to everything desired in Waikiki, modern and clean interiors with an undertone of Scandinavian meet tropical decor. Open air seating area with live fire pits for late night ambiance and a trendy bar for cocktails.The hotel is quiet and with a nice pool area for relaxation and a cute gift shop, however weekend evenings gets a bit loud and busy at the bar for some, great live music venue in the evenings where locals stop by as well to enjoy.

I have been around the hotels in Waikiki for a long time and have stayed in almost every one thru the years. Most of the mid-range hotels had the exterior upgraded with not much attention to the rooms except carpet and paint to justify the prices they now charge in Waikiki. This hotel is an exception of that. It's now a Marriott hotel and a complete renovation has transformed this location to a centerpiece property adjoining the new International Market Place. The lobby has been re-done in natural wood and is now open-air. The pool in the courtyard is now resort style. The rooms are all refitted with Marriott standards with new tech and wi- fi. The bar downstairs" The Hide-Out" is now a premier meeting spot in Waikiki like there never was before. The elevators and parking has been re-done and even the sidewalk widened and lit up to highlight this new location. Centrally located and only a block to the beach. The big hotels are nice but staying here is a breath of fresh air in the jungle that is Waikiki.

Located in the recently renovated International Market Place, this hotel is like staying in an open-air mall. Best feature: it's just a short walk to & from Canoes and Duke's which are ground zero for the best beach & surf action Waikiki has to offer. I rented a board and walked through the IMP, passing under the old monkey pod tree and treehouse which are still there, almost every day. So many fond memories of past visits to Honolulu here.The staff is super friendly and helpful. My 11' paddle board couldn't fit in the storage room designated for beach gear so the chief engineer graciously had it parked in his office.Only minor flaw is loudness of open-air lobby / restaurant / bar which offers live music and turns into a popular gathering place every night -- unless you're single in which case this is another plus. Definitely a hot spot.The suites are good size for up to five people. Ours had a sofa bed and queen size day bed in addition to a king, and a semi-separate kitchen area with two balconies. For quiet nights we selected one opposite from pool & lobby area. The breakfast dishes are amazing.

Let me start off this review by saying that my husbands hate Waikiki. He complains about the crowds, traffic and noise. However after stay at the Laylow he is willing to return. It is a beautifully redone hotel that is a block or 2 back from the main strip. There is a quiet road that you can walk down that is lined with little store kiosks to get to the main strip. So you are close enough to the action without being in it. The rooms we had were well appointed and so much larger then expected. I mean have you ever had 2 king beds in a room before? The welcome basket was great and we appreciated the free breakfast certificates because we are gold elite with Marriott (I had read complaints about the concierge breakfast offering before leaving, since they didn't mention having one and offered us free breakfast I'm guessing they got rid of it). The valet and bell hops were excellent as well as the front desk. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

The room was excellent on the executive level with an included station for coffee and snacks. Everything was very well kept and clean. Hideout, the restaurant, was delicious when we enjoyed their breakfast by the beautiful pool. Richard at concierge was extremely helpful in planning a few activities for our trip and we even received a $50 discount from the hotel.

Staying at this hotel was such an incredible experience. You are greeted at the reception desk with a tray of cool washcloths, and a bowl of fresh pineapple to eat while they quickly found our reservation. They voluntarily upgraded us to a higher floor so we could have a better view. We had a beautiful room with 2 king size beds with a lovely view of the city, and a partial ocean view. The room had a complimentary welcome basket containing two pairs of Hawaiian design flip flops, cookies, chips, candy, and two bottles of natural Hawaiian soda. What a perfect way to start our vacation in paradise. They have a lovely pool with some of the chaise lounges actually in the pool - very different. The service of everyone that we came in contact with was extraordinary. The hotel is in a great location - midpoint on Waikiki beach - between diamond head and ala moana. Next door to the International marketplace and surrounded by shops, restaurants, and loads of nightlife. I wish I never had to leave.

From the moment we exited the escalator into the lobby we knew that this hotel was special. The staff was amazing and we were in our beautiful room in minutes. A welcome basket of Honolulu cookies, candies and taro chips awaited us, which my kids loved. There were also 2 pairs of hotel-themed flip-flops in the gift basket. Very cute. We later asked for and received another pair. The beds were so comfy and the decor in the room so appropriate and beautiful. Loved the wallpaper. The saline pool was the perfect ending to a hot day at the beach. Even the pool/beach towels are beautiful. The restaurant served amazingly good food and drinks. Each and every person from the valet on couldn't have been nicer. My 16 year old son said that we should only stay here from now on while in Waikiki. That's the best review, I think. Can't wait to go back!

The location was superb. Whatever you could possible need is just a casual stroll away. The lobby situated on the second story with access via escalator. That gives you a slightly removed feel from the street traffic. No noise from the hustle below, whatsoever. The staff was very helpful and friendly. They really go above and beyond to ensure an enjoyable stay. The entire hotel has recently benefited from an update, with lots of attention paid to detail without being seeming too trendy or snobbish. Comfortable, relaxing and classy. Lots of space to relax by the saltwater pool. The pool appears to be more of an adult feel, with an rectangular shape that welcomes short laps back and forth. Once the weekend came, more kids took over and seemed to jump in and out, getting splashed in the process while sunbathing. I feel that's more of a parenting issue than a staff issue, however. Parents today seem to be buried in their cell phones instead of thinking about the other guests...Just a suggestion ;DThe room had a wonderful gift basket filled with flip flops, sweet potato chips, candy, etc. We have Elite/Gold Status with Marriott, so not sure if that comes standard for everyone. Fun books on Hawaii to read and picture books of Hawaii's history of surfing. It really felt like a home-away-from-home! Soft robes, comfortable beds, and delicious pillows to sleep the night away! Quite rooms, too! Didn't hear a peep from other guests at all. No coffee maker in the room, but one can be sent up if you'e like, free of charge. The coffee machine I requested was more like a Keruge (by the cup) style. We were given $15 per person with food/beverage vouchers a day to redeem, as well as $50 off any local activity you book with the concierge in the lobby. The food was scrumptious, breakfast, lunch and dinner! The views at the Hideout Bar was that of a rooftop get away (on second floor adjacent to the lobby area) along with a coffee lounge with barista's and bakery-like items. Lots of lounge seating around gas fireplaces in the center of every seating area, as well as traditional outdoor tables and chairs to choose from. We never had a reason to step outside of the hotel! One other daily fun treat included made-to-order free shaved icee's from 1:30-2:30 in the lobby. Like I said before, this hotel paid close attention to the small details to make your stay more special. I'd definitely return here again.

We stayed at the LayLow recently during a spontaneous extension of our vacation. The hotel is new, chic, and perfectly located next to the new International Marketplace. Sheila checked us in and was super helpful and welcoming, which we really appreciated. The room was lovely and we had a great time at the Hideout bar downstairs. If you can catch Julie behind the bar, consider yourself lucky-- she's fantastic!

Obviously an old hotel that got a very major facelift courtesy Marriott. The pool and fitness rooms are tiny, but there's little else to criticize. If you want a hotel that feels "new", this might not work for you, but the rooms are very tastefully decorated and clean. The free snacks and water bottles were a welcome touch. The location is excellent, adjacent to the completely revamped International Market. The valet-only parking is a downside, but cars were delivered reasonably promptly. Not my favorite Waikiki hotel, but a nice change for sure.

We stayed at the Laylow for three nights in July...and overall our experience and stay was very enjoyable!!! The hotel is beautiful, as it is new, modern, updated and completely renovated. The staff was very friendly when we arrived and offered to store our luggage in their extra room while we waited for our room to become available. A map of the island, as well as information about the hotel, shops and dining were given to us. There are many restaurants and stores close by to the hotel including the International Market just a few steps away, which we loved. Our room was clean when we arrived and was always done up when we came back to the hotel after our day out. The room's decor was attractive and the bed and pillows were very comfortable. We did have some trouble getting extra sheets and pillows for the sofa bed the first night we arrived, as the items took a while to come to our room and we also had to ask multiple times. We received a gift basket from the hotel filled with many excellent treats and goodies which was a nice little surprise! The pool is very unique and clean with their lounge chairs right in the water, however, the pool itself is very small. If you're looking for a little place to cool down for a while though, the pool is a perfect place! Another fun thing was that they had free shave ice every afternoon by the pool. When we decided to go to the beach, we were given towels and chairs to use. Breakfast was fantastic and the service was fairly good, depending on the server. The lanai off of the breakfast area/restaurant/bar was very nice and comfortable. We found that some of the staff were better than others. Some had some attitude but others were very helpful and friendly. This hotel is quite new, so there was a bit of confusion at times with the staff, as not everything/everyone was consistent or 'in-the-know'. Other than a few little issues/glitches, the hotel was great! A lot of happy memories were made here! We enjoyed our stay very much and would come back here again in a heart-beat!!

My husband and I live on Oahu and love doing Staycations in Waikiki every few months. We've stayed at hotels in a similar category as the Laylow as well as higher categories, and the Laylow is now our FAVORITE! It beats out Hotel Renew, Hyatt Place, New Otani, Waikiki Parc, Vive Hotel, the Westin and Royal Hawaiian. The hotel is beautifully renovated. The lobby, restaurant and pool all have a very cool vibe (though you should really go to the beach a block away!). The location is excellent, right smack between the International Marketplace and Duke's Lane Market and Eatery. The rooms are large, airy and bright. The bed is a cloud you will not want to leave. The bathroom was modern and the shower had good pressure. Bath products smelled amazing. The staff are mostly young and hip, just like the hotel! I mentioned to Summer at the front desk that I was a light sleeper and she kindly moved us to a room away from the elevator. See you soon Laylow!

Stayed in this hotel during a 4 day in between Island family trip. Oahu is our favorite Island but I always struggle where to stay on Marriott points. We tried the Laylow, and although it was small for a family of four - traveling with our two young boys - the two kin beds were extremely comfortable. The gym is spacious and located across a small but perfect pool. Beware of the wood flooring that can get very hot during the day. The hotel offers pool side water and even sun tan lotion (nice touch)The hotel is well decorated and very comfortable. It is located next to the new international market and within walking distance of many restaurants. Right across the hotel, there is a new very inexpensive Ramen Noodle restaurant and excellent. The hotel restaurant is nice and we used it for breakfast since I had the platinum coupons. Btw ... as a platinum member,I received a very nice basket with local beverages, local dried fruit and potato chips, and his/her flip flops. Evening entertainment is pleasant. It is important to mention the staff in the hotel is attentive and very friendly. Areas of improvement: add bath and hand towel racks, add bath soap (we had to run to ABC Store for soap) not just liquid soap, and lower price of $35 parking. Elevators can be busy and appear slow as a result, but not sure if this can be corrected.

Have stayed here on all my business trips since open. Lovely hotel. Great staff. Hoku goes above and beyond at the front desk. Nice bar. Cool rooms. Close to great restaurants. Definitely return here when in town.

We (my sweetie, 16 yr old son & I) were there for the first time from 5-11JUL2017. I booked the hotel in February (before it even opened) but it was an available Category 8 hotel w/Marriott since I was browsing possibilities when I was planning my summer trip on the Marriott web site. I used Marriott Reward points for our entire 5-night stay (Marriott has an ongoing promo that if you use points to book 4 consecutive nights, you'll get the 5th night free).Hotel has valet parking only (no self-parking lot option). It was $35 a night & the garage is underneath the hotel (convenient but cars have to leave the garage & come out around the bldg to pull up to you which isn't far but there's a traffic light & pedestrian traffic to wait on).Lobby is up an escalator & is open (we didn't walk thru any doors). Check-in counter is small but 2 attendants available. We were on the 14th floor (there are 16, I think). A small balcony (ours overlooked the pool). We had a room w/2 king-size beds which were very comfortable. Bathroom is spacious but the door was a sliding door that has decorative (non-see-thru glass). It's very bright if someone turns on the light (w/the door closed) in the middle of the night to use it. Having the sliding bathroom door also doesn't accommodate a door hook to hang towels. Little options for the 3 of us to hang face cloths, bath towels or a hand towel. Not even a rod on the wall on either side of the bathroom sink/counter. I ended up using the arm of the pull-out make-up mirror for my face cloth. As much as we are "green", we preferred not to put our used towels on the floor so we could use them another day (but more than once, housekeeping replaced all our bathroom linens).This hotel does not recycle (& I asked thinking I could set all my recyclables aside for housekeeping to dispense). No dividers in the waste baskets for putting yogurt cups, styrofoam or plastic containers, et cetera).Furnishings were very simple but useful. Small fridge & no microwave (I couldn't even get the staff to heat up some restaurant leftovers for me). Balcony had two chairs & a small table. Shelving (like a bookcase) surrounded the flat-screen TV which had some ornamental objects & paperbacks. This was convenient for putting our "stuff".My sweetie & I went to the pool once. The wooden floor planks where the chaise lounges are were extremely hot on our bare feet. Towels are free (just sign the clipboard w/room # & how many towels). Sun is no longer on the pool by 1400 (& the pool isn't heated). There is a server that occasionally roams pool-side patrons to see if any beverage/food is needed.There is a restaurant in the lobby & my sweetie & I went there every morning for coffee (sweetie) & a caramel latte (me) (both were delicious). It does serve breakfast in the morning then lunch/dinner items after. There is live entertainment on some nights. I also asked (& was accommodated) everyday to fill our water bottles before we left the hotel on our excursions. Very convenient.I did use the workout room (which is by the pool). Spacious & lots of equipment (free weights, bench, yoga mats, medicine balls, treadmills, ellipticals, bikes). Water cooler & towels also available inside. Coming off the elevator, there are directional arrows to tell patrons which direction to go (lobby, pool, restrooms) but no arrow to tell you where the workout room is. So I ended up walking by the lobby, by the pool area to the workout room. When I came out of the workout room, I went the other way & the elevators are right around one corner (instead of 3).Hotel is located by a Starbucks, a small grocery store & plenty of restaurants all within walking distance. Lots of shops too (but I saved my souvenir shopping for the Swap Meet at the stadium).I used the concierge even before arriving to book a luau. There is a $50 voucher that is rec'd upon check-in to be used for any excursion booked thru the hotel. Since I already booked (& paid for) my luau, I had to bring the voucher to the concierge to receive a credit. Strange why this wasn't mentioned when I paid for the luau. I did receive a credit card statement. I am also glad I only booked one excursion thru the hotel. The base MWR has tix for everything. I am glad that I took Richard's advice on Diamond Head. I was going to book a guided tour & when I mentioned this to Richard when I booked the luau, he told me not to. It's $1 per person to get in (so I didn't get the guided tour or a certificate saying I went to the top but I saved money thanks to the concierge).Front desk was very accommodating & printed all our boarding passes the night prior to our flight. All staff are professional & courteous.

Stayed for two weeks, 3 rooms for 5 people. The hotel rooms were inexpensive, nice enough, updated, renovated. But the hotel is not 4 stars. Room service comes in a bag, the front desk is puny, unimpressive, and you have to take an escalator from the street to the lobby, when it works. Otherwise, there's one elevator, prepare to wait. The people were all friendly, restaurant was decent, small menu, like everything else in Hawaii, it's expensive. The location has lots of food around and the shopping is abundant. So why the zero star location? The street that this hotel resides on has 2 strip clubs across the street and hookers galore, homeless galore too, but they're everywhere else as well. I would recommend avoiding this street, stay one street over and the whole situation changes for the better.

Reservations was made on another sight so the room wasn't what we needed. They showed my husband 3 rooms that was available for him to choose from. I've never had one do that. Rooms are decorated Hawaiian Contemporary very lovely. Sleeping areas was a little hard for some of us. Pool was really small but loved the lounge chaise in them to the side. Can be noisy depending on floor and where room is at but hey that's Waikiki.

This hotel is two blocks from the beach, but only 100 feet from the newly build "International Market Place" shopping mall (and from the night market). So, a great spot to spend more money on the way to the beach :-). Anyway the hotel just got a complete renovation and is especially from the room design just great. The bathroom has a great walk-in shower, the room itself shelves has a huge TV, etc. all with a very nice coloring and style, the beds are comfortable - Really great! The pool is small, really small, but for a short dip after a day at the beach or after sightseeing just fine. The Valet parking people are very nice, but the room you have to park your car before they can drive it away is very limited, so it happened twice that we couldn't drive into the valet parking area and blocked the street for some time with all the typical side-effect of the other drivers.We had a little challenge with the room availability and also with the noises from the bar, but one thing they did solve, I guess on the noises they couldn't do anything, but they waived some fees as the room almost directly at the bar entrance..Hendrik

Loved the decor of the rooms, tv was massive for a hotel room and had Netflix which was great. Staff were friendly and Jason at the concierge desk was awesome!Had a great time here. Only downside was that the pool was a bit small/crowded and hotel wasn't on the beach.

Made the reservation to stay at LayLow early in the year before it actually opened. Was hoping that it would be nice, and overall it did not disappoint. I thought the location was great, close enough to the beach to easily walk there. Plenty of shopping and other eating establishments in the area. While waiting for our trip to arrive, I read the reviews as they grew in number. Yes, some things could be handled a bit differently especially for elite members, such as better controlling access to the 15th and 16th floors, but they kept the food offerings pretty well stocked. When the coffee machine went on the fritz, we could go downstairs to obtain one at no cost. It was promptly repaired. I had a corner room which had a small round table with two chairs and a bench along the wall, with USB and electrical outlets. So, it was well suited for working. When first arriving, the welcome package did not have the flip flops I had read about and seen in pictures. I had not brought any as I was planning on using those. I mentioned it at the desk and was told that they had run out and were awaiting more. Later that day, however, as I was passing the Concierge desk, I was stopped and informed that some had been located. My feet were happy! Mahalo. Of course, the shaved iced that others mentioned was available in the early afternoon and appreciated. All in all a pleasant stay.

My spouse and I spent three nights here last week. The staff was phenomenal from check-in to check-out. I used my Marriott points as a platinum member and was given a high level corner room with walk out balconies on both sides. Views were stunning. Bed was very comfortable and amenities at the hotel were better than I expected. The beach is a short two block walk to Waikiki.
