Highlights of the property are: it very much has a boutique feel and not the same vibe as some of the other touristy waikiki hotels | decor is fresh and new | proximity to the International Plaza and great dining options within walking distance | pool and bar area.Only two detractors although both are minor: elevators were on the fritz while there so stairs were needed to be used | not on the beach and probably most views are city (or garage if low).All in all, I would recommend and stay here again if in Waikiki.

My husband travels frequently to Honolulu and I tag along when possible. We usually stay at the Marriott or Waikiki Parc but were excited to give this new hotel a try. Overall we really enjoyed our stay. The hotel is brand new- who doesn't love a fresh, new, stylish hotel? Our room on the 16th floor was great- except the day it wasn't cleaned. We had the do not disturb sign out until 10am, returned at 2pm and called to request a cleaning when we departed again at 3pm. Never happened. I find that inexcusable at what touts itself as a high end hotel. Speaking of high end- I've seen the manager's response to reviews about the continental breakfast. The pastries are not great- chocolate donuts or cheese danishes shoved in a glass box aren't high end. Why not provide the executive floor with the same high quality pastries available at the coffee bar downstairs? The continental breakfast provided definitely has a Holiday Inn Express feel. And as others have noted the hallway fills with guests from other floors so it can be pretty loud in the morning. I felt bad for the guests in the room beside it.Other than that we did enjoy this place and will likely stay again.

best hotel in waikiki, beautifully done, amazing places, and the restaurant there, si to die for, waygu burger, passion fruit salad, pork belly appetizer, ridiculously good, staff is awesome too...., saltwater pool, welcome package, also 16th floow is a must the expresso machine, is amazing!

I guess the new" is not as good as the old for me. I like a regular desk to wok on and sit in a regular chair and have a normal bed to sleep on. None of these were in my room, all were modern (uncomfortable) and watch your head if you were trying to work on the desk (?) space provided. To top it off I was upgraded (?) to executive level with continental breakfast in the hall right outside of my room, very loud lots of people and hard to sleep. One good thing is the staff is friendly.

The Laylow is perfectly located for travelers of all type. It's less than 5 minutes from the famous Waikiki Beach and at the center of amazing shopping and restaurants... that is if you even want to leave the hotel. Hideout (Laylow's on property restaurant) offers authentic Hawaiian cuisine like the catch of the day and poke. You can also grab an amazing cocktail or coffee right there. There's live music on the patio every night starting at 7. We saw two different local musicians and they were incredibly talented. The music, fire pits and comfy lounge tables make it hard to leave! The room itself was spacious, clean, and bright. The design is really thoughtful with little local accents like coffee table books about surfing. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Would recommend to anyone interested with a unique hotel experience!

As a Platinum I was a little skeptical at first about the location but from the time we arrived at valet to check in I was in love with this property. Kudos to a great staff and to the design team behind this property. The pool while small is well appointed and refreshing. The beach towels even deserve a mention as they are top quality. Our room was an upgraded corner suite and I loved almost every aspect of the room....except the tiny closet. About the only miss made by the design team. Room was quiet. Loved the smart TV with easy Bluetooth access for my own music apps. The restaurant and bar are almost a real plus. Great menu and service. For breakfast I had what I think might be the best pancakes I've ever had! So when I'm back in HNL this hotel will become my first go-to.

I really love this hotel. It's a 5 min walk to the beach, and it's centrally located in downtowns it's perfect for families with kids because they have rooms with 2 king size beds which is perfect for us. Rooms are brand new, beds are comfy, plenty of light in the bathroom, a beautiful welcome basket with free flip flops, free snow cones everyday, free sunscreen! It's a salt water pool which is great. The only negative I have was we are on 5th floor and theirs music you can hear from our room from down in the lobby which makes it difficult to sleep. Other than that it would be a 5 star.

My partner and I stayed here in April 2017 - the hotel was only very recently renovated and had only been open for like a month or so - we thought it was excellent and couldn't find any fault. The decor is really cool and the staff were brilliant - when we checked in the room type we'd reserved wasn't available so we were upgraded without any fuss. The room was really clean and was a perfect size for the 5 nights we stayed... the little lounge and dining area in the room made a big difference. On the first day we were given a small welcome basket which included crisps, soft drinks, sweets and two pairs of LayLow flip flops! In the immediate area of the hotel there lots of shopping, right next door is a brand new mall with some great restaurants, one block up is Nordstrom Rack, Ross and Macys if you want some shopping time. Immediately opposite is some great japanese and mexican foodWifi was included and was super fast... no annoying blackspots or drop out at all.We love this place and can't wait to come back!

My boyfriend and I booked this hotel before it had opened so we were a bit apprehensive with the lack of reviews. However, everything about the hotel was amazing! Lots of things went wrong with our trip including having our flight delayed by more than half a day and the fact that most of our plans had been ruined by the constant thunderstorm showers that occurred during our short stay. The staff at the Laylow were the one saving grace! Upon arrival, they upgraded us to a larger room at no additional cost and also gave us freshly cut pineapple to greet us. Shoutout to Summer at the front desk who always helped us with directions/bus timetables and the concierge who helped us rebook our parasailing activity after another company cancelled on us THREE times. The location of the Laylow is perfect with the famous Marukame Udon located right opposite and an abundance of great food options nearby as well as the International Mall for shopping. The beach is a short walk away and the bus stop which takes you to most of the touristy areas like Diamond Head/Hanauma Bay/Ala Moana Centre is located a one minute walk away!

Pros: Lovely MCM island vibes. All around pretty design and styling. The bed was very comfortable. Front desk, valets, wait staff were all very nice. The soap and toiletries smelled so good, but I couldn't find them in their little shop. The shop has a nice little collection of Aloha Beach Club wear and the handmade mugs from an LA artist, but the rest was kind of boring. Cocktails at the bar were very tasty. Chips and guac good, too. Cons: This hotel seems confused of its identity. No coffee or minibar in room, but room service stops at 11p. We checked in at almost 11p and had to call down to let them know our slippers and welcome basket were not in the room. Just kind of a pain when we were exhausted. The executive level lounge is really just a long bar in the hallway in front of the elevators. In the morning there's donuts, the afternoon rice puff snacks and cookies at night. They were similar to what you get at a large grocery store bakery. Fine. But most frustrating is the terrible coffee machine, it's the kind you'd find at a gas station. Really bad. And no cream just a bowl of artificial liquid creamer packs. Seriously? Felt like I was at a roadside motel. Why not have good Kona coffee? Even the restaurant coffee was bad and inconsistent. Was able to get a decent drip coffee from the little coffee shop in the lobby. Everyone in the entire hotel seems to use the executive floor to get coffee and pastries. Business people will ride the elevator up and give you dirty looks for being in a robe on vacation. And stuff runs out at 7am. Such a bad setup. We had breakfast included in our package and the food was just okay. We tried both benedicts and found them so bland and the hollandaise tasted like they forgot the lemon. Never mind that the tiny crab cake patty tasted frozen. The next day we tried the rice skillet and sandwich, both of which were strangely very sweet and again bland. I think they poured sweet syrup all over the rice. Also the skillet pan was cold, like they heated the rice in a microwave and then dumped it in a skillet for presentation. And again the coffee is so bad. The winner finally was the salmon toast. And this morning the entire kitchen/ bar/ coffee shop staff was running around confused and we got to hear a loud argument in the kitchen among the cooks and waitstaff. What a mess. If you're not interested in good coffee, if a minibar and consistent food/ room service aren't important to you and you just want a place to lay your head at night this would be a good hotel for you. I wish I would have stayed at the Surfjack or even paid a little more to stay at the Modern or the Moana. I was looking for more of a place I could eat, drink and hang out at and the Laylow did not fit the bill for that kind of trip. This hotel has so much potential, the design is on point so you think they are going to be boutiquey, but sadly things are just executed poorly. At check out the front desk lady with the metal on her face was not friendly and never offered to call down to valet or even ask us how our stay was. In fact that is the general vibe of things here, the only staff who asked how our stay was going was the valet guys. They were great. The rest of the staff seemed very inexperienced and lacking direction. Despite the insta worthy decor it feels more like a corporate airport hotel. Very confusing and disappointing.

I had the most amazing stay at The Laylow, and kept thinking about the next time I could return to this hotel. I had booked my reservation before it opened, so I had no idea what to expect. Well the hotel ended up being even more beautiful than I expected! There was so much attention to detail, and the tropical midcentury vibe was stunning. The first night we stayed in a standard room which had partial ocean and island view, which was already great. The last 3 days, they moved us to a larger suite due to some technical difficulties. The suite had a separate dining/work space, which would be perfect for those trying to get some work done while on vacation. We loved hanging out downstairs in their lobby area, and the pool was very nicely done with several lounge chairs and two large covered sunbeds. We had happy hour at The Hideout, and got coffee there in the morning (Stumptown was a big bonus!). At night, we would hang out at the Hideout for drinks as well. The live artists and the DJs played amazing music. All the staff were really nice, especially the evening valet guys! The location was very central. We walked to several restaurants and shops. The International Market next door just opened, and it seems like a lot of new restaurants are popping up in that center. I'm worried this place is going to be much more popular by the time I return, but I hope I'll still be able to get a room when I need to. Thank you for the best time!

I am an elite Marriott member who has stayed at many properties worldwide. This is a nice refurbished hotel in a good part of town that has many nice features. If you are an Elite Marriott member who has stayed at the Waikiki Beach Resort, you will find the free breakfast to be an embarrassment. The concierge lounge/free breakfast is a table in the hallway of the 15 and 16 floors that features a coffee machine and a box of doughnuts.My first morning there I complained to the manager and was told that this what you get. Several nights later while sitting by the firepit having a cocktail and listening to the live music, I told my story to my waitress Ivy who took ownership of it and soon I was visited by Chris who is another of the managers. I suggested to Chris that he visit the breakfast at the other Marriott and see what is being provided there as opposed to what was being served at the Laylow.Chris made it right by providing me with daily credit to be used in the restaurant for breakfast. Upon eating breakfast in their restaurant, all I can say is wow. The North Shore Eggs Benedict are amazing.This is a new hotel and probably still experiencing some growing pains. They need to fix their policy with regard to benefits due to Marriott Elite Members, once that is done this will be my choice of places to stay.

The Hotel was perfect apart from a couple of hic ups, when we arrived we had booked one room but they gave us 2 and as I was so tired after a long long flight thought maybe they had given us 2 rooms as there were 3 in our party, it was only after I checked my banking app I saw they had deducted nearly $1900 out of my account, of course I questioned this and they said I had booked 2 rooms but when I showed them the booking.com booking they saw it was in fact only for one room, I was eventually refunded and to be honest don't know whether a booking.com fault or the hotel, the other niggly point was one day we returned to the room to find the door was not closed, the cleaners had not pulled it shut. But I did love the hotel and would stay again, starbucks just a few minutes walk and as is the beach. A lovely gift basket awaits you in the room and a lovely spacious bathroom with glass doors to the shower.

This hotel was absolutely amazing. As you walk into the beautiful lobby surrounded by the unique pool and restaurant/bar area they greet you with best fresh pineapple. The staff was incredible and knew us by name and room number by the first morning we were there. The concierge did everything she could to help us create amazing memories in Waikiki. The rooms are stunning and you are welcomed into the room with a cute Hawaiian gift basket that matches the modern room decor. The decor of the hotel was very unique, tasteful, modern, and created a great environment to hang out in. From 1-2pm they serve free shaved ice in the lobby near the pool. In the pool area they will also deliver drinks and food from the restaurant/bar area. Overall, the artistry poured into the interior design is incredible. I am ready to move into one of the rooms permanently. The staff is overtop the amazing and helpful. This will be my hotel of choice every time I return.

Though the name changed from Okina Autograph Collection to LayLow Hotel - hotel has excellent service from bellhop to front desk check in. Got a complimentary room upgrade from them = Happy wife, Happy life! The room had several mirrors including a full length. The layout was maximed for space it didn't leave you feeling confined. The bedframe was made of wood (with curved edges) not metal. Very helpful when getting in and out of bed to prevent scrapes and cuts. The food was flavorful. Meals were within a decent price range: Brkfst/Lunch $20- $50 a couple. Dinner ranged from $40 and up.The staff was outstanding. The front desk staff was very corteous. Chris was knowledgeable about the area and local establishments. Casey, from bell services was attentive and polite. May-May was efficient and Kehau always had a smile when serving.This is a hotel I would gladly return to.

We just returned from 9 days at the Laylow. Check in was a breeze with fresh pineapple served at the front desk. We had booked a room on the executive level and we were really happy with the room and the view from the lanai. There is a basket of goodies waiting for you including flip flops as well as Honolulu cookie company cookies and other snacks and drinks. We were disappointed with the cro-nut they had for breakfast the next morning- plus the coffee machine was broken- we do not normally eat things like that for breakfast so paying the extra money for the executive level was just not worth it to us. We went to the front desk and asked to move down to a regular room on another floor. Jarren went out of his way to help us change rooms and arranged for our luggage to be moved to the new room while we were out. The hotel staff are very welcoming and helpful! The hotel is in a perfect location- right near Nordstrom Rack, Macy's and International Marketplace. There is an ABC store next door and MacDonalds and Starbucks in the next block. The Food Pantry is a block away- fully stocked grocery store as well as a large selection of ready to go meals. The pool is nice and relaxing- there are two cabanas that are free of charge ( the only negative thing about the cabanas is that the pillows are really small and the wooden railing on the three sides are not comfortable to lean against). The staff let you borrow towels to take to the beach or if you stay by the pool, you get a delicious shaved ice delivered right to where you are sitting! Valet parking is super expensive at $35 a night but .. the valet staff are wonderful! Great hotel -great location- nice rooms! My only advice is that the furniture -beds- chairs on lanai are all low profile which matches the retro 60s vibe of the hotel so if you have mobility issues then maybe see if they have accessible rooms available. Definitely going back to the Laylow!

Spent two nights with the family at this hotel. New hotel with free wifi. They have a small pool and the gym is opened 24hour. The location is good for shopping and sightseeing. It only takes few minutes to the bus stop. The international market place and ABC store are just next to the hotel.

Love love love this hotel! Has a nostalgic sort of vibe with an up to date aura. Staff is excellent and attentive. Rooms are spacious and bathroom is bright with plenty of space to spread out. This is my go to Marriott in Honolulu/Waikiki.

I travel for months at a time and have spent many, many nights in hotels all over the world. This ranks as one of my all-time favorite hotel experiences! From check-in to check-out every part of the experience I had at the Laylow was on point. From the very accommodating front desk staff to the bartenders to the valet to the housekeeping staff -- every single employee was not only a pleasure, but always went the extra mile to make sure my stay was very enjoyable. Thank you so much Laylow Waikiki!! And, an extra-special shout-out to Patricia Guterres, Sr Sales Manager, who made me feel like a super star! I look forward to staying there, again, in future!

Stayed from 4/15 - 4/21Had an amazing stay at The Laylow for a family vacation. Definitely loved the modern/relaxed vibes that the property was giving off. Location was super-convenient, great pool (for when Waikiki beach gets too crowded), great bar, great live music, great food @ The Hideout. Staff was super friendly & attentive. Hopefully we get to make our way back soon...(3 guests | 2 adults & 1 child)

Well prepared staff. Every employee was well informed and comfortably understood the offerings of the hotel. Entire facility is clean and details are being watched.I am back a few weeks later to find the same knowledgable staff. Makes for a good place to stay.Kudos to everyone.

We stayed at this hotel for five nights, checking in on a Sunday and leaving Friday morning. I went with my parents for my dad's birthday trip. We stayed on the 11th floor, in a room with two very spacious king-sized beds. There was a small balcony that overlooked an outdoor pool of the hotel next door.Every morning we had breakfast downstairs at 'The Hideout' with fantastic service from all of the staff. Special shout out to Kehau (or the pretty lady as my mom referred to her) for being so friendly and providing excellent service!If you are using valet, there was quite a bit of construction going on beside the hotel resulting in a bit of a hassle getting out of the alley. The location of the hotel is fantastic and the pool which is on the same level as the check-in desk and the restaurant, is small but is like an urban oasis. Also, the International Market Place is literally right next door and the famous Marukame Udon where you will see long line-ups is right across the street from the hotel. The best thing about this hotel is that everything is brand spanking new (including the towels, furniture, bed sheets etc) and the decor is so unique and retro chic. Although it was a bit of a gamble when I initially booked the hotel as there were no reviews given its newness, I am very happy with the choice and my parents really enjoyed it too. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to everyone!

We stayed at the Laylow shortly after it reopened and were blown away by the change. The bar and roof deck overlooking Kuhio St. with live music and craft cocktails is a great place to spend an afternoon. The food and atmosphere are wonderful and the whole stay could not have been better.

The Laylow is a brand-new property situated in an ideal location near the new International Market Place in Waikiki. It offers outstanding service, friendly staff, and the food is awesome at the Hideout restaurant! This is one of a few hotels in Waikiki That offers all king size beds. Rooms are spacious, nice size pool, and the overall atmosphere and ambiance is great. I highly recommend it!

We checked in on the day it reopened after renovation. Great location with easy access to Waikiki beach and shops. Very helpful and friendly staff. Very clean and the renovations were done with taste and brought the hotel into the modern era. Would highly recommend if you want somewhere convenient, yet very quiet and private.

This hotel saved our Oahu vacation! We originally checked into the Waikiki Marriott Resort and Spa and were so disappointed in the room. I received an email about this hotel opening, but with lack of photos on their website - I just didn't feel confident switching our reservation to this new hotel. Literally minutes after checking in to the Waikiki Marriott Resort and Spa, I picked up the phone and called The Laylow to see if they could accommodate us for a week. Luckily for us, they were able to! Upon our check-in at The Laylow, we were greeted with fresh pineapple slices. There was live music being played in the Hideout lobby bar. The room was spacious with two KING sized beds (Waikiki Marriott has doubles, yuck). The room also had plenty of drawer space, which was highly needed with three women sharing a room! There was a fabulous welcome basket filled with snacks, drinks, and postcards waiting for us in the room - compliments of the hotel manager. The pool area is quaint with a jungle type of feel. They have complimentary water and sunscreen available, as well as super cute towels. Not to mention, they give out complimentary shaved ice mid afternoon. The executive floors were stocked with snacks, water, and coffee. I've stayed at other Marriott hotels that have had much more to offer in this department. The Laylow's set up was pretty basic, but the daily donuts were very legit and tasty!This hotel is retro, but also very modern. This is the perfect hotel for instagrammers! You will have loads of content to take pictures of with all the fun details scattered about the hotel. The location of this hotel is also spot on. It is centrally located and is within walking distance of everything!If I ever get back to Waikiki, I will definitely stay at this hotel again. We all kept saying "we just LOVE the vibe of this hotel!" literally every single time we walked into it. Haha.

We checked in to the hotel on the day it re-opened, with trepidation as there were no reviews or photos of the hotel available at that time. It felt like a leap of faith. We were pleasantly surprised though. The staff are lovely and friendly, it's in a great spot in the middle of everything, but feels like a sanctuary away from it all once you take the lifts up to the reception/pool/bar area. There is a lovely bar/lounge area with live acoustic music each night for a bite to eat or a nightcap. Appreciated the gestures, like the E Komo Mai basket on check in.

We spent 1 week at this fabulous establishment. We were worried because a bad hotel experience will ruin your once a year holidays.There werent a lot of reviews for Laylow when we book, after all the day we check in were only the 3rd week since their grand opening. I will highly recommend and will definitely return to Laylow next time.Let's start with service, everyone is friendly, helpful and smile all the time. I like to comment Mr Chris Horning, for being super attentive and always try to make sure we are well taken care of. Kudus to you sir!We book the standard room with BreakfastRoom, Modern decoration. The room have a three sitter couch which can easily be transform into an extra bed. We have a 2 year old who sleep with us at our bed. The sofa works great for us. Internet, we dont have any issue with the internet. I was playing online game one night and dont have connection or lagging issueLocation, about 2 blocks away from Waikiki Beach. A enjoyable walk. They are plenty of restaurants around too. We got bored of them pretty quick though. The Honolulu Trolley pink line bus station is right across the road. Very convenient. Nordstrom Rack is just around the corner. We spend 4 nights there, just hunting for treasures. Lastly the breakfast. I have to say the breakfast will be the reason we will go back to Laylow. We book the place with breakfast included. I think they under sell their breakfast online. Their breakfast is absolutely amazing. For breakfast, you will get a $50 limit to spend on anything on the breakfast menu. Tips is excluded, so you will have to pay around $10-15 tips. Obviously this is objective. $50 is enough for family of 3. You must try their North Shore Egg Benedict. It is top of the class!Area of improvement:Air conditioning, though its does it job, it could be quite loud when it cranking up. I am pretty sure I can hear the thermostat click. We open our balcony door most nights, but it could still be quite noisy because of the location. We stay at 14th floor.Netflix, it is available at the smart TV but you need to log in with your own account, not a major since I have an account. Though, it a lot better then most other hotel which dont give you an option to Netflix. Bath, there is no bath in the room. The shower were great though, strong pressure, good hot/cold water mix.I would recommend this to all my friends.Good luck with your stay!Sooi

Super cute high-rise property. Contemprary, but soooo Cozy! Swinging "Nest" chairs in lobby, everything was magical! The room was clean, bright, and current in decor. We #lovedit!! !Kudos to Miss Ashley who seemingly was at our beck and call with every request and question we had! (Give this woman a raise!) She was super! With reccomendations for food (You gotta try the Hawaiian bbq chicken tacos), Shopping (At the Internation Marketplace), and even scheduled our snorkeling and surfing excursions! Shooooot, can we take her home with us?!! We had the nicest time at the Laylow, and you will too! And p.s.... Ask for Ashley! : )

Currently on my second stay at the Laylow in the last few weeks. This place is just great, the best most friendliest staff you could hope for, fresh decor, great large rooms, wonderful nightly entertainment and the location is fantastic. If you are looking to stay in the heart of Waikiki and be treated like you are the only guest in the hotel this is the place for you.

First thing - if you're looking for an ocean view, this is not the place. The top couple of floors have a partial view and that's about it. Otherwise, this is a cool, new boutique hotel right in the middle of everything. Next door, for example, is the new International Marketplace. A five-minute walk away is Duke's - and the beach. The hotel itself is kind of Hawaiian-retro. Great for couples - I didn't see many kids. Speaking of kids, the pool is smallish - which is probably not conducive to kids. The fact that it's a Marriott makes it even better. Will definitely stay there again.

Great new Marriott Autograph property. Welcoming friendly staff, from Chris and Rachel at the front desk to Mila, Daisy and Zachary at the bar and restaurant.Always pleasant and helpful. Classy Rooms, nice pool, and a delightful outdoor deck overlooking Kuhio, complete with fire pits, comfy seating and live music. Easy two block walk straight to the beach. Great weekend stay. Thanks to all.

We ended up in this hotel on relatively short notice, after having previously intended to stay in one of the Outriggers. And man, am I glad we did. This might be my new favorite hotel. The only downside is that it isn't right on the beach and you have no ocean view. Other than that, the location is excellent, right in the best part of Waikiki. Walking distance from everything you might want to do in Waikiki. The price is also right. It was less than half the price of the ocean front hotels. None of the hidden fees (such as resort fees and other nonsense that should really be illegal). But this isn't just about the price being lower. The hotel is plain cool. Every guest gets a gift basket. Free shave ice in the afternoon. A cool bar with live music. All beds are really nice king-size beds. Modern AV in the room, allowing streaming apps (such as connecting to your Netflix account). Cool, modern room decoration (to a point where I took home some ideas for our own home). Books and a ukulele in every room add a nice Hawaiian touch. And so on. I really enjoyed my stay.

Atmosphere and service were so amazing! Such a great boutique hotel! Nice small pool area and nice outdoor area to sit and have a drink or appetizers with live entertainment at night! Every day they offer free shaved ice...what a treat! Always welcoming every time you come in or out! Krystel was such a sweet greater who seemed like she never left...Chris I believe was the assistant front office manger was very friendly! Just great experience! Only thing that wasn't A+ was the bed wasn't comfortable...felt like it was used way to much where it was sloping on both sides of the bed...we will definitely be back! Thank you!

Spent a few nights during the course of a business trip in the Laylow and was stunned by the genuine kindness of all the staff I met and the overall cleanliness. Lots of places to eat and shop nearby and Waikiki beach can be reached within 6 minutes by foot.

This place was very nice. The rooms are just what the hotel has on the website. The bathrooms were nicely sized, great shower head. When we arrived, I was set up with one bed but had 4 people. I asked for two beds and we were upgraded to a double king room. There was plenty of room for us. The rooms were clean, flat screen TV with Netflix and Pandora. Robes are provided in the closets. There was a gift basket with local treats, that got us hooked on the cookies from the Honolulu Cookie Company. The staff was wonderful, very understanding and friendly. The valets always held a conversation with us gave us ideas on places to visit. The complimentary pineapples were so sweet! The only thing that I was bummed about was the cost of the valet, which is $35 per day. It's not on the beach, but it did not even matter because we visited beaches away from the hotel area. Will definitely recommend!! Oh, and the noodle place across the street was good and cheap.

We found the Laylow by accident - it was formerly the Aqua Waikiki Wave but had been bought and totally renovated. The outdoor Lanai was gorgeous and there is local music every day of the week. We returned three times for either happy hour or drinks and had food each time. The quality and variety of the food was excellent and very good value. Service from the team was excellent and the music was varied by local artists. Looking forward to returning to Waikiki.

With visitor numbers to Hawaii growing there has been a huge revitalisation of the once neglected Kuhio Ave, literally one street back from the main drag. Part of this redevelopment has been the reopening of the International Market Place with Saks Fifth Avenue, the first tower of the Ritz Carlton open and the second under construction, the first Starbuck Reserve open and only one of 15 in the world and now the Laylow an autograph collection hotel owned by the Marriott.And what a welcome arrival it is, a fun and quirky hotel tha'ts only a week old, that is paying homage to its retro Hawaiian roots but with all the flare of a completely fresh and innovative refurbishment.On the first level is the check in, breakfast area and pool. The Modern has held the mantle of the best new hotel in Hawaii for a while but I think its time to hand it to the Laylow. Rooms on the top two floors are spacious with partial ocean views over the top of the Pink Palace. Decor is Hawaiian but with a great fresh citrus twist that leaves a real zing.The problem with a lot of Hawaiian Hotels - yes you Hyatts, Marriotts, Sheratons and Outriggers is they have the location i.e. beachside but they let their rooms deteriorate into these old and dated dinosaurs. If you are a savvy traveller you will start looking for hotels like the Laylow that offer friendly happy staff that set the atmosphere for your visit. Innovative ideas like snack bars with complimentary snacks, tea/coffee and continental breakfast. Rooms that are styled with a homage to Hawaii that is chic and contemporary. Pool areas that are more Las Vegas than Children's urinal. And a breakfast area that resembles a great urban cafe.While its early days this hotel really deserves to succeed and if the staff are all as welcoming as Rachel and James when we visited then we will be back. Thank you for bringing something new and refreshing to the Hawaiian Hotel Scene may you be the first of many.

So this place is amazing! The rooms are a good size and how they have been decorated seems very hawaii nostalgic. The breakfast at the Hideaway is fantastic! The service each morning has been great. Just outside the room jut in front of the elevators is a snack bar which changes daily - nice touch (if the coconut donut is out have one, it's amazing). We are absolutely in love with this place. Can't wait to stay here again.

My family and I stayed here and were impressed. The staff were friendly and would greet me by name when I passed the front desk. Service was excellent at check-in. Manager Chris and Dawn were great! Valet staff were fabulous. I liked the decor in the rooms and the hotel. The pool area was lovely. Clean and chic and caters well to tourists. Love the lounge chairs in the pool.

Stayed on the first day of the "grand opening" of this lovely chic boutique hotel. Welcomed with huge smiles and lots of Aloha by Summer and Jarren. Efficiently, given a partial ocean view by Jarren and once I had reached my room, the phone rang, and he informed me, i was being upgraded to a corner suite on the top floor. The room was wonderfully spacious with fun decor and a complimentary basket of goodies! On the 16th floor there was a coffee machine, fresh orange juice, pastries, fruits, and snacks for guests. On check in I mentioned I was vacationing over my Birthday and the Front Desk Manager, Andrea, immediately arranges for a complimentary dinner in the beautiful restaurant, Hideout. At dinner I was welcomed by General Manager, Ben, Johnny, and my server, Ivy. The menu offered many delicious selections. I ordered a cocktail, appetizer, mahi mahi entree, and dessert. All excellent and compliments of the Laylow hotel. I am a platinum Marriott member and have been treated graciously at most properties, but this staff went Way "above and beyond". If you want to be pampered I highly recommend this hotel and restaurant. The caring and kindness of the employees is deeply felt. I look forward to my return to Honolulu and another great experience at the Laylow Autograph Collection.

First off this hotel is brand new opened 3/22/17 staff are friendly and very pleasing eager to help you. Being that I travel alot for work and find it hard to get away for a vacation it was nice to be able to have a vacation while I work. A few details about the new Hotel LayLow if driving in you are greeted by a team of valets that will not let you carry anything . So upon entering I was greeted by the manager with a beautiful lei and a warm towel . Room was very nice I did pay a small feee for a corner suite on the beach side ,well worth the money , had a great view of the salt water pool down below At lunch I enjoyed a really good meal ate the hotel restaurant / bar called the Hide out that was amazing. They have 2 fire pits very lounge environment very cozy some artist playing music in the corner. I see why they call it hideout nestled 15 feet above Kuhio st gives you a nice view I imagine at night with fire pits going it is even better . Definitely a must try. Thanks to the staff for making my work stay wonderful. Mahalo
